analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: One would be in a state of transgression and in a state of conflict.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is a transgression with defilement.

original: snyom las sam le lo'am /
analyzed: snyom las sam le lo'am /
translated: If one does not instruct and does not teach, because of laziness, idleness, or lack of mindfulness,🔽this is a transgression with defilement.

analyzed: bag med pas mi 'doms shing rjes su mi ston la yongs su tshol bar mi byed na / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro // thabs des dul bar bya bar 'dod cing dul bar 'dod na nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If one does not instruct and does not teach because one wants to tame the disciples through that method, because one wants to convert them, because one is ill and unable to teach, because one has entrusted the teaching to others, because the disciples are themselves able to learn the teaching, because the disciples are very knowledgeable,

original: dge 'dun gyi nang khrims bsrung na nyes pa med do //🔽na ste sbyor mi bzod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang khrims bsrung na nyes pa med do // na ste sbyor mi bzod na nyes pa med do //
translated: because one wants to avoid the fault of teaching the Dharma in a way that is not appropriate,

analyzed: nus pa gzhan dag la bcol na nyes pa med do //🔽'khor bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa'am /

original: yang na bdag nyid chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol nus par shes pa dang / de dag gis gdams ngag rjes su bstan pas gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i bya ba byas zin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid chos gos la sogs pa yongs su tshol nus par shes pa dang / de dag gis gdams ngag rjes su bstan pas gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i bya ba byas zin na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva is able to seek out Dharma robes and so on, or if the Dharma robes and so on have already been obtained through the activity of instructing and guiding.

original: sngon mu stegs can yin pa las chos rkur 'ongs pa der yang 'dul ba'i skal ba med pa'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sngon mu stegs can yin pa las chos rkur 'ongs pa der yang 'dul ba'i skal ba med pa'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is by nature incapable of being guided.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pas gzhan dag gi sems dang mthun par mi byed na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pas gzhan dag gi sems dang mthun par mi byed na /
translated: If a bodhisattva does not act in harmony with the minds of others because he or she is in a hostile state of mind,

original: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas @96b par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas @96b par 'gyur te /
translated: he or she commits an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and acquires an afflicted offense.

original: snyom las dang le lo dang / bag med pas mthun par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyom las dang le lo dang / bag med pas mthun par mi byed na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva does not act in harmony with the minds of others out of idleness and laziness, or out of lack of mindfulness, he or she commits an offense and a transgression,🔽but acquires an unafflicted offense.

original: gzhan dag gi 'dod pa gang yin pa de mi 'phrod par 'gyur ba yin na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi 'dod pa gang yin pa de mi 'phrod par 'gyur ba yin na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the other person’s wishes are not appropriate.

original: na ste sbyor mi bzod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: na ste sbyor mi bzod na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is sick and unable to do the work.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang khrims bsrung na nyes pa med do //🔽de'i 'dod pa 'phrod pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang khrims bsrung na nyes pa med do // de'i 'dod pa 'phrod pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: There is no offense if the person is observing a rule of the Sangha.🔽There is no offense if the person’s wishes are appropriate,

original: gzhan ches mang ba dag gi 'dod pa ma yin zhing mi 'phrod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan ches mang ba dag gi 'dod pa ma yin zhing mi 'phrod na nyes pa med do //
translated: but the wishes of the majority of others are not appropriate.

original: mu stegs can tshar gcad pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mu stegs can tshar gcad pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is a heretic and is being punished.

original: thabs des dul bar bya bar 'dod cing dul bar 'dod na nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs des dul bar bya bar 'dod cing dul bar 'dod na nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: There is no offense if the person is being disciplined by means of a method that is intended to tame him or her and that is intended to cause him or her to turn away from opportunities nonvirtuous and take up opportunities virtuous.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pas gzhan dag gi yang dag pa'i yon tan rjod par mi byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan pas gzhan dag gi yang dag pa'i yon tan rjod par mi byed cing /
translated: A bodhisattva who is in a hostile state of mind does not praise the genuine good qualities of others.

original: yang dag pa'i bsngags pa mi brjod pa dang / legs par smras pa la legs so zhes bya ba ma byin na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bsngags pa mi brjod pa dang / legs par smras pa la legs so zhes bya ba ma byin na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not praise the praiseworthy, or if one does not say “good” to one who has spoken well, one is at fault and in violation.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is a downfall due to an afflicted mind.

original: snyom las dang le lo dang / bag med pas ma smras na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyom las dang le lo dang / bag med pas ma smras na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not praise or say “good” out of laziness, idleness, or carelessness, one is at fault but not in violation.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod pa chung du yin par dpags te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod pa chung du yin par dpags te /
translated: If one is naturally of few desires,

original: de dang mthun par byed na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de dang mthun par byed na nyes pa med do //
translated: and one’s behavior is in accord with that, there is no fault.

original: na ste mi nus na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: na ste mi nus na nyes pa med do //
translated: If one is sick and unable to praise or say “good,” there is no fault.

original: thabs des 'dul bar bya bar 'dod cing 'dul bar 'dod na nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs des 'dul bar bya bar 'dod cing 'dul bar 'dod na nyes pa med de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If one thinks that praising or saying “good” would be a skillful means to tame someone, and one does not praise or say “good” with that intention, there is no fault.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang khrims bsrung na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang khrims bsrung na nyes pa med do //
translated: If one is protecting the harmony of the Saṅgha, there is no fault.

original: gzhi des kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rgyags pa dang / khengs pa dang / gnod par 'gyur du dogs te /
analyzed: gzhi des kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rgyags pa dang / khengs pa dang / gnod par 'gyur du dogs te /
translated: If one thinks that praising or saying “good” would cause the other person to become afflicted, conceited, arrogant, or violent,

original: de bsal ba'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: and one does not praise or say “good” in order to avoid that, there is no fault.

original: yon tan rnams yon tan ltar bcos pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan rnams yon tan ltar bcos pa yin te /
translated: The good qualities are like counterfeit good qualities.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / legs par smras pa yang legs par smras pa ltar bcos pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / legs par smras pa yang legs par smras pa ltar bcos pa yin te /
translated: What is well-spoken is like counterfeit well-spoken.

original: yang dag pa ma yin na nyes pa med do //🔽mu stegs can tshar gcad pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin na nyes pa med do // mu stegs can tshar gcad pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is not real, there is no fault.🔽If it is for the purpose of refuting the tīrthikas, there is no fault.

original: gtam rdzogs rdzogs su sdod na nyes pa med do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems can sma dbab pa'i rigs pa dang / chad pas gcad pa'i rigs pa dang / bskrad pa'i rigs pa rnams nyon @97a * //
analyzed: gtam rdzogs rdzogs su sdod na nyes pa med do // byang chub sems dpa' sems can sma dbab pa'i rigs pa dang / chad pas gcad pa'i rigs pa dang / bskrad pa'i rigs pa rnams nyon @97a * //
translated: If it is for the purpose of entertaining a gathering, there is no fault.

original: mongs pa can gyi sems kyis sma mi 'bebs sam /
analyzed: mongs pa can gyi sems kyis sma mi 'bebs sam /
translated: If bodhisattvas are not motivated by a defiled state of mind when they need to reprimand, punish, or expel sentient beings,

original: sma 'bebs su zin kyang chad pas bcad pas mi 'chos sam /
analyzed: sma 'bebs su zin kyang chad pas bcad pas mi 'chos sam /
translated: or if they do reprimand them but do not punish them,

original: 'chos su zin kyang skrod par mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chos su zin kyang skrod par mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: or if they do punish them but do not expel them, they commit an offense and a transgression,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they acquire an afflicted offense.

original: snyom las dang le lo dang / bag med pas sma 'bebs par mi byed pa nas /
analyzed: snyom las dang le lo dang / bag med pas sma 'bebs par mi byed pa nas /
translated: He does not let himself be overcome by laziness, idleness, and carelessness.

original: skrod pa'i bar du mi byed na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skrod pa'i bar du mi byed na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not admonish them, up to and including banishing them, because of laziness, lack of willpower, or lack of mindfulness, he commits an offense of wrongdoing.

original: bcos su mi rung ba'i rang bzhin can zhig ste /
analyzed: bcos su mi rung ba'i rang bzhin can zhig ste /
translated: If the person is by nature unamenable to admonition,

original: gtam byar mi rung ba dang / bka' blo mi bde zhing kun nas mnar sems kyi shas che ba la yal bar bor na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gtam byar mi rung ba dang / bka' blo mi bde zhing kun nas mnar sems kyi shas che ba la yal bar bor na nyes pa med do //
translated: unfit to be spoken to, and has a hostile and malicious nature, there is no offense if the monk ignores him.

original: dus las sdod na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dus las sdod na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is waiting for an appropriate time.

original: gzhi de las 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / rtsod par 'gyur bar mthong na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhi de las 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / rtsod par 'gyur bar mthong na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk sees that the person would become quarrelsome, argumentative, and contentious, or would create a dispute in the community.

original: dge 'dun 'khrug cing 'bye bar mthong na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'khrug cing 'bye bar mthong na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk sees that the person would cause a schism in the community.

original: sems can de dag g-yo med de ;
analyzed: sems can de dag g-yo med de ;
translated: If the person is not deceitful,

original: shas cher ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ldan pas myur ba myur bar mthun par byed pa zhig na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shas cher ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ldan pas myur ba myur bar mthun par byed pa zhig na nyes pa med do //
translated: and is generally conscientious and deferential, and would quickly make amends, there is no offense if the monk ignores him.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa dang / mthu rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa dang / mthu rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan la /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have various kinds of miraculous powers, transformations, and abilities

original: sems can skrag par bya ba'i rigs pa rnams skrag par bya ba dang / sems can 'dun par bya ba'i rigs pa rnams 'dun par bya ba dang / dad pas byin pa spong du gzhug pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyis skrag par mi byed 'dun par mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can skrag par bya ba'i rigs pa rnams skrag par bya ba dang / sems can 'dun par bya ba'i rigs pa rnams 'dun par bya ba dang / dad pas byin pa spong du gzhug pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyis skrag par mi byed 'dun par mi byed na nyes pa dang bcas shing 'gal ba dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: are at fault and to be censured if they do not frighten those beings who should be frightened, do not inspire faith in those who should be inspired with faith, and do not use their miraculous powers to stop those who are giving gifts out of faith.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro ;
translated: They are at fault, but not morally at fault.

original: ; sems can rnams gang du shas cher mngon par zhen pa mu stegs can 'phags pa la skur ba 'debs pa /
analyzed: ; sems can rnams gang du shas cher mngon par zhen pa mu stegs can 'phags pa la skur ba 'debs pa /
translated: If beings are strongly attached to something, and if they are non-Buddhists who slander the noble ones,

original: log par lta ba dang ldan pa dag cig na ma bstan kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: log par lta ba dang ldan pa dag cig na ma bstan kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: have wrong views, and so on, there is no fault if they are not taught.

original: thams cad la yang sems 'khrugs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pa dang / sdom pa ma mnos pa la ni shin tu nyes pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la yang sems 'khrugs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pa dang / sdom pa ma mnos pa la ni shin tu nyes pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that there is no fault in any of these cases if the bodhisattva is insane, if he is experiencing intense pain, or if he has not taken the vow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dag ni dngos su byung ba sha stag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dag ni dngos su byung ba sha stag ste /
translated: These bases of training of the bodhisattvas are all actual practices.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims las brtsams @97b nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag tu thor bu thor bur gsungs pa de byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi ma mo 'dir tshang bar bshad de /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims las brtsams @97b nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag tu thor bu thor bur gsungs pa de byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi ma mo 'dir tshang bar bshad de /
translated: The Blessed One taught them in various places in the sūtras, beginning with the trainings in the ethics of restraint, the ethics of acquiring good qualities, and the ethics of acting for the welfare of sentient beings. They are all explained here in this Mother of the bodhisattva canon.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gus pa skyes pas de dag la slob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam pas gzhan las sdom pa yang dag par blang bar byas nas mchog tu gus par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gus pa skyes pas de dag la slob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam pas gzhan las sdom pa yang dag par blang bar byas nas mchog tu gus par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has aroused devotion should receive the vow from another with the pure intention of wanting to train in them, with the intention of wanting enlightenment, and with the intention of working for the welfare of living beings.

original: bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should then respect them supremely and train in them.

original: thog ma nyid nas kyang nyes pa mi 'byung bar gus pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma nyid nas kyang nyes pa mi 'byung bar gus pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: From the very beginning, he should arouse devotion so that faults will not occur.

original: nyes pa byung na yang chos bzhin du gso bas nyes pa las gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa byung na yang chos bzhin du gso bas nyes pa las gso bar bya'o //
translated: And if faults do occur, he should restore them through confession in accordance with the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nyes pa 'di dag thams cad ni nyes byas su bsdu bar rig par bya'o //🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nyes pa 'di dag thams cad ni nyes byas su bsdu bar rig par bya'o // nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: All these faults of the bodhisattva should be understood as being included in the category of wrong doing.

original: theg pa chen po pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: Whether one is a disciple of the Universal Vehicle or the Individual Vehicle,

original: gang dag gi rnam par rig byed de dag khong du chud cing 'dzin nus pa la bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi rnam par rig byed de dag khong du chud cing 'dzin nus pa la bshags par bya'o //
translated: one should confess those actions that one can understand and retain.

original: gal te kun nas dkris pa chen pos byang chub sems dpa' la pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos byung bar gyur na des sdom pa btang ba lan gnyis su slar yang mnod par bya'o //🔽gal te kun nas dkris pa 'bring gis nyes pa byung ba na ni des gang zag gsum mam /
analyzed: gal te kun nas dkris pa chen pos byang chub sems dpa' la pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos byung bar gyur na des sdom pa btang ba lan gnyis su slar yang mnod par bya'o // gal te kun nas dkris pa 'bring gis nyes pa byung ba na ni des gang zag gsum mam /
translated: If a bodhisattva has a downfall that is a great offense due to a great entanglement, he or she must take the vow again, having given it up.

original: de yan chad la nyes byas bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: de yan chad la nyes byas bshags par bya ste /
translated: If a bodhisattva has a downfall that is a great offense due to a medium entanglement, he or she must confess it before three people or more.🔽If a bodhisattva has a downfall that is a great offense due to a small entanglement, or a downfall that is a serious violation due to a great entanglement, he or she must confess it to one person or, if there is no one to confess it to, by sincerely recalling the Buddha.

original: mdun du 'dug nas thog mar dngos po brjod de /
analyzed: mdun du 'dug nas thog mar dngos po brjod de /
translated: The bodhisattva should sit in front of the person to whom the confession is being made, state the matter, and say:

original: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please pay attention!

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ji skad yongs su brjod pa'i gzhi las byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba dang 'gal ba nyes byas kyi nongs pa byung ste zhes brjod la /
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ji skad yongs su brjod pa'i gzhi las byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba dang 'gal ba nyes byas kyi nongs pa byung ste zhes brjod la /
translated: I, named so-and-so, have had the downfall of a serious violation that is a transgression of the bodhisattva’s code of conduct, which is a matter to be specifically confessed, as it is called.”

original: lhag ma ni dge slong nyes byas 'chags pa ji lta ba de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni dge slong nyes byas 'chags pa ji lta ba de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The rest is to be said as in the confession of a serious violation by a fully ordained monk.

original: kun nas dkris pa chung ngus pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos byung ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i nyes pa rnams ni gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa chung ngus pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos byung ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i nyes pa rnams ni gcig gi mdun du bshags par bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that when a bodhisattva has committed an offense that is a basis for defeat that was motivated by a great degree of the entanglements, he or she should acknowledge it in the presence of many beings.

original: gang gi mdun du bshags par bya ba'i gang zag mthun pa med na /
analyzed: gang gi mdun du bshags par bya ba'i gang zag mthun pa med na /
translated: But if there is no suitable person in whose presence a bodhisattva should acknowledge an offense,

original: byang chub sems dpas bsam pa thag pa nas phyin chad mi bya bar sems bskyed par bya zhing phyin chad kyang bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bsam pa thag pa nas phyin chad mi bya bar sems bskyed par bya zhing phyin chad kyang bsdam par bya'o //
translated: he or she should acknowledge it with a superior attitude, thinking, “I will not do this again,” and should also restrain him or herself in the future.

original: de ltar byas na nyes pa de las byung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na nyes pa de las byung zhes bya'o //
translated: If a bodhisattva does this, it is said that he or she has emerged from that offense.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang @98a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang @98a * //
translated: The acceptance of the bodhisattva discipline

original: dag par blang ba de yang gal te yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i gang zag med par gyur na /
analyzed: dag par blang ba de yang gal te yon tan de dag dang ldan pa'i gang zag med par gyur na /
translated: If there is no person who possesses those good qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar bdag nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar bdag nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blang bar bya ste /
translated: a bodhisattva should accept the bodhisattva discipline in the presence of an image of the Tathāgata,

original: 'di ltar spyan sngar bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyan sngar bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas sam /
translated: In this way, in the presence of the teacher, with the upper robe thrown over one shoulder and the right knee touching the ground,

original: tsog tsog por 'dug kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tsog tsog por 'dug kyang rung ste /
translated: or else sitting with the legs crossed,

original: 'di skad du bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang sa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la gsol ba 'tshal te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang sa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la gsol ba 'tshal te /
translated: one should say, “I, by the name so-and-so, request all the Tathāgatas in the ten directions and all the bodhisattvas who have entered the great stages🔽to attend to me.

original: de dag gi spyan sngar byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims thams cad de /
analyzed: de dag gi spyan sngar byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims thams cad de /
translated: In their presence, I will train in all the bases of bodhisattva training and in all the bodhisattva moral discipline,

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims gang la 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bslabs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad slob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims gang la 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bslabs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad slob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: namely, the moral discipline of restraint, the moral discipline of gathering virtue, and the moral discipline of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: phyogs bcu na da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad da ltar slob pa rnams bdag gis yang dag par blang ngo zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu na da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad da ltar slob pa rnams bdag gis yang dag par blang ngo zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: I take up the present training of all the bodhisattvas in the ten directions.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du brjod nas ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du brjod nas ldang bar bya'o //
translated: Having said this twice or three times, one should rise.

original: lhag ma thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: All the rest should be understood as before.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nyes pa'i lam la yang nyes pa lhag ma yang med pa ni med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nyes pa'i lam la yang nyes pa lhag ma yang med pa ni med de /
translated: There is no bodhisattva path of failure that is without a remainder of failure.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa'i nyes pa ni phal cher zhe sdang las 'byung gi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa'i nyes pa ni phal cher zhe sdang las 'byung gi /
translated: The Lord has said, “The bodhisattva’s failure should be understood as arising mostly from hatred, not from craving.

original: 'dod chags las byung ba ni ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa ni 'di yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags las byung ba ni ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa ni 'di yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: ” The intended meaning of that should be understood as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la rjes su chags shing sems can la byams pa'i dbang du byas nas gang ci spyod kyang rung de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpas bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la rjes su chags shing sems can la byams pa'i dbang du byas nas gang ci spyod kyang rung de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpas bya ba yin te /
translated: Whatever a bodhisattva practices, whether it is for the sake of beings or out of love for beings, all of that is the practice of a bodhisattva.

original: mi bya ba ma yin pa la bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa ni nyes par 'gyur ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: mi bya ba ma yin pa la bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa ni nyes par 'gyur ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right that a bodhisattva who is practicing what should be practiced should incur an offense.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la sdang ba ni bdag dang gzhan rnams la phan par spyod pa @98b ma yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la sdang ba ni bdag dang gzhan rnams la phan par spyod pa @98b ma yin la /
translated: A bodhisattva who is hostile to beings is not practicing for the benefit of self or others.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That is not the practice of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar bya ba ma yin pa byed pa ni nyes par 'gyur bar rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba ma yin pa byed pa ni nyes par 'gyur bar rigs so //
translated: It is right that a bodhisattva who is practicing what should not be practiced should incur an offense.🔽The offenses of bodhisattvas should be understood as being of three types:🔽minor,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nyes pa rnams ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nyes pa rnams ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: medium, and great.

original: gzhi bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhi bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like those that are found in the Compendium of Bases.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rang gi 'dul ba la bslab pa la brtson pa ni phun sum tshogs pa gsum po sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas bde ba la reg par gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rang gi 'dul ba la bslab pa la brtson pa ni phun sum tshogs pa gsum po sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas bde ba la reg par gnas so //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is diligent in training in his own discipline, endowed with three perfections—the perfection of application, the perfection of aspiration, and the perfection of prior causes—experiences happiness.

original: de la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of application?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims dag 'dral bar mi byed cing lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kun tu spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang / nyes pa rgyun du mi byed pa dang / sdig pa 'chags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni tshul khrims dag 'dral bar mi byed cing lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kun tu spyod pa yongs su dag pa dang / nyes pa rgyun du mi byed pa dang / sdig pa 'chags pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva does not violate morality, and his conduct by way of body, speech, and mind is pure, he does not habitually commit offenses, and he confesses his sins.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of application.

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of aspiration?

original: chos kyi bsam pas rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi bsam pas rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: He has gone forth with the aspiration for the Dharma,

original: 'tsho ba'i bsam pas ma yin /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bsam pas ma yin /
translated: not with the aspiration for livelihood.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po don du gnyer ba yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po don du gnyer ba yin gyi /
translated: The great bodhisattvas are the ones who strive for it.

original: don du mi gnyer ba ma yin /
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba ma yin /
translated: He is not one who does not seek the great enlightenment.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul dang mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul dang mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba yin gyi /
translated: He is not one who does not seek the way of virtuous endeavor and nirvāṇa.🔽He is not one who, in seeking these, is overcome by laziness.

original: don du mi gnyer ba ma yin pa dang / de de ltar don du gnyer bas le los gnas pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba ma yin pa dang / de de ltar don du gnyer bas le los gnas pa ma yin zhing /
translated: He is not one who is weak in his effort.

original: brtson 'grus mi zhan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / yang 'byung ba pa dang / rims nad dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / phyi ma la skye ba dang / rga shir 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi zhan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / yang 'byung ba pa dang / rims nad dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba dang / phyi ma la skye ba dang / rga shir 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: He is not one who is mixed up with sinful, nonvirtuous qualities that are defiled, that lead to a new existence, that are associated with the afflictions, that are subject to suffering, and that lead to future birth, old age, and death.

original: de ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of aspiration.

original: sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of the past?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpas sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu bsod nams byas shing dge ba byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sngon tshe rabs gzhan dag tu bsod nams byas shing dge ba byas te /
translated: The bodhisattva has previously, in other lives, performed meritorious actions and virtuous actions.

original: des da ltar bdag nyid kyang gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad rnams kyis phongs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des da ltar bdag nyid kyang gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad rnams kyis phongs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: He himself is not lacking in clothing, food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the sick, and necessary utensils.

original: gzhan dag la yang bgo bsha' byed nus pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang bgo bsha' byed nus pa ste /
translated: He is able to share with others.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /🔽byang chub sems @99a * //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yin par rig par bya ste / byang chub sems @99a * //
translated: This should be known as the bodhisattva’s perfection of the prior causes.

original: dpa' 'dul ba la bslab pa brtson pa /
analyzed: dpa' 'dul ba la bslab pa brtson pa /
translated: The bodhisattva who is striving to train in the moral discipline of the bodhisattvas,

original: phun sum tshogs pa gsum po 'di dag dang ldan pa ni bde ba la reg par gnas so //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa gsum po 'di dag dang ldan pa ni bde ba la reg par gnas so //
translated: who is endowed with these three perfections, experiences happiness.

original: de las bzlog pa'i phongs pa gsum dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal la reg par gnas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i phongs pa gsum dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal la reg par gnas par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that the opposite of these three perfections is the experience of suffering.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims kyi mdo dang rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims kyi mdo dang rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the summary and the extensive explanation of the moral discipline of the bodhisattvas, both for the bodhisattva who is a householder and for the one who has gone forth into the homeless state.

original: de las gzhan pa dka' ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ni tshul khrims thams cad 'di'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dka' ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ni tshul khrims thams cad 'di'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other kinds of morality, such as the morality of difficulty, are all to be known as subdivisions of this morality of restraint.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the morality of difficulty for the bodhisattva?

original: 'di ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as threefold.

original: byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod che la dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed cing 'dug pa las longs spyod spangs shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod che la dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed cing 'dug pa las longs spyod spangs shing /
translated: When a bodhisattva, living in great wealth and power, renounces his great wealth and power,

original: dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed pa spangs nas /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed pa spangs nas /
translated: and, having renounced his great wealth and power,

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: takes up the restraint of the morality of the bodhisattva, this is called the morality of difficulty for the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims blangs nas nyam thag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims blangs nas nyam thag ste /
translated: When a bodhisattva, having taken up the morality, is in danger of death,🔽and does not violate the restraint of the morality that he has taken up, even to save his life,

original: srog la thug kyang tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de nyams par yang mi byed na med par lta ga la byed de /
analyzed: srog la thug kyang tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de nyams par yang mi byed na med par lta ga la byed de /
translated: much less violate it out of desire,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s morality of difficulty, the second.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ci nas nyes pa phra rab kyang mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ci nas nyes pa phra rab kyang mi 'byung zhing /
translated: As long as he lives, he does not commit the slightest sin,

original: tshul khrims la 'khrul pa yang mi 'byung na lci ba lta 'byung bar ga la 'gyur ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa dang gnas pa thams cad yid la byed pa dag la dran pa nye bar gnas shing bag yod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la 'khrul pa yang mi 'byung na lci ba lta 'byung bar ga la 'gyur ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa dang gnas pa thams cad yid la byed pa dag la dran pa nye bar gnas shing bag yod pa yin te /
translated: and he does not even err in regard to the morality. How much less would he commit a grave sin! In this way, the bodhisattva is mindful and heedful in all his activities and postures, and he is attentive to his thoughts.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya ste gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s morality of difficulty, the third.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s morality of all aspects?

original: 'di ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as fourfold:

original: yang dag par blangs pa dang / rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / goms pa dang / thabs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa dang / rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang / goms pa dang / thabs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: morality of undertaking, natural morality, morality of practice, and morality endowed with means.

original: de la yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims ni gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems @99b can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blang bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims ni gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems @99b can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blang bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The morality of proper practice is that by which the bodhisattva properly practices the three kinds of morality: the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring virtue, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa nyid kyi sems kyi rgyud rang bzhin gyis dge ba kho na yin pas /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa nyid kyi sems kyi rgyud rang bzhin gyis dge ba kho na yin pas /
translated: The natural morality is that of the bodhisattva who, dwelling in the bodhisattva family, has a naturally virtuous mind and so

original: lus dang ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o//
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o//
translated: engages in pure actions of body and speech.

original: de la goms pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum char la goms par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la goms pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum char la goms par byas pa yin te /
translated: The habitual morality is that of the bodhisattva who has practiced the three kinds of morality in his previous lives.

original: de sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs bskyed pa des sdig pa kun tu spyod pa la /
analyzed: de sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs bskyed pa des sdig pa kun tu spyod pa la /
translated: The power of the cause of the past is the power of the cause of the past.🔽

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi dga' zhing sdig pa las yid byung la /🔽dge ba kun tu spyod pa la dga' zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi dga' zhing sdig pa las yid byung la / dge ba kun tu spyod pa la dga' zhing /
translated: By the power of the cause of that, he does not delight in the practice of evil at all and in any way, and he is disgusted with evil.🔽He delights in the practice of virtue,

original: dge ba kun tu spyod pa kho na 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba kun tu spyod pa kho na 'dod pa'o //
translated: and he desires only the practice of virtue.

original: de la thabs dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni 'di yin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la brten nas /
analyzed: de la thabs dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims ni 'di yin te / byang chub sems dpa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la brten nas /
translated: The morality of means is as follows:

original: sems can rnams la lus dang ngag gi las dge ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la lus dang ngag gi las dge ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the virtuous action of body and speech of beings, which is based on the four means of conversion of the bodhisattva.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the morality of the good person of the bodhisattva?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known as fivefold:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / gzhan dag kyang tshul khrims yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang ; tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa yang brjod pa dang / chos dang mthun pa mthong na yid dga' bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / gzhan dag kyang tshul khrims yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang ; tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa yang brjod pa dang / chos dang mthun pa mthong na yid dga' bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Here a bodhisattva him or herself is endowed with morality, causes others to take up morality, praises morality, and is pleased to see morality and one who has morality.

original: nyes pa byung na chos bzhin du phyir 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa byung na chos bzhin du phyir 'chos pa'o //
translated: And when a transgression occurs, he or she mends it in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ morality of every form?

original: de ni rnam pa drug dang / rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug dang / rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is sixfold and sevenfold.

original: gcig tu bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: When combined, it should be understood as thirteenfold.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rgya chen po yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rgya chen po yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the vastness of the bases of training,

original: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir rgya che ba dang / 'dod pa'i bsod nams dang / bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa dang /🔽ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yang bslab pa 'bul bar mi byed pa'i phyir rtag tu byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing mi 'phrogs @100a * //
analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir rgya che ba dang / 'dod pa'i bsod nams dang / bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa dang / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yang bslab pa 'bul bar mi byed pa'i phyir rtag tu byed pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing mi 'phrogs @100a * //
translated: It is vast because it is dedicated to great enlightenment. It is irreproachable because it avoids the two extremes of indulging in sense pleasures and of self-mortification. It is a basis of joy because it is the cause of the bliss of meditative concentration.

original: pa'i phyir brtan pa dang / tshul khrims kyi rgyan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i phyir brtan pa dang / tshul khrims kyi rgyan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is constant because one does not give up the precepts even for a moment, and it is firm because one is not overcome or carried away by gain, honor, adversaries, afflictions, or secondary afflictions.

original: tshul khrims kyi rgyan ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rgyan ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is adorned with morality,

original: nyan thos kyi sa las byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: and the adornment of morality should be understood as it is described in the Sravaka Levels.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir kun nas bsrung ba'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir kun nas bsrung ba'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: The morality of restraint is for the sake of avoiding such things as killing. The morality of engagement is for the sake of gathering virtue and benefiting others. The morality of protection is for the sake of protecting both the morality of engagement and the morality of restraint.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang ; sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang ; sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don rnam par smin par byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality that produces the marks of a great person, the morality that produces the superknowledges, the morality that produces a good destiny, and the morality that produces benefit for sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva's morality of what is cherished and desired?

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of eight types.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid 'di snyam du rjes su sems te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid 'di snyam du rjes su sems te /
translated: In this regard, bodhisattvas think as follows:

original: 'di ltar bdag ni bdag la su yang gsod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun gyi tshig smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni bdag la su yang gsod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun gyi tshig smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa byed pa dang /
translated: “In this way, I do not want anyone to kill me, to take what is not given to them, to engage in sexual misconduct, to speak falsely, to engage in malicious talk, to speak harshly, to engage in idle chatter,🔽to strike me with their hands, clods, or whips, or to inflict any kind of painful contact upon me.”

original: lag pa dang / bong ba dang / lcag gis bsnun cing rnam par 'tshe ba'i reg pa mi 'dod pa dag kun tu spyod par byed par ma gyur cig snyam du 'dod la bdag de lta bu 'dod bzhin du /
analyzed: lag pa dang / bong ba dang / lcag gis bsnun cing rnam par 'tshe ba'i reg pa mi 'dod pa dag kun tu spyod par byed par ma gyur cig snyam du 'dod la bdag de lta bu 'dod bzhin du /
translated: While they have such desires,

original: gal te gzhan gyis log pa byas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis log pa byas par gyur na /
translated: if others do wrong to them,

original: des bdag phongs par 'gyur zhing de bdag gi yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur bas na gzhan yang bdag ci lta ba bzhin du gzhan gyis gsad par ma gyur cig ces bya ba nas rgyas par rnam par 'tshe ba'i reg pa dag byed par ma gyur cig snyam🔽du 'dod de /
analyzed: des bdag phongs par 'gyur zhing de bdag gi yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur bas na gzhan yang bdag ci lta ba bzhin du gzhan gyis gsad par ma gyur cig ces bya ba nas rgyas par rnam par 'tshe ba'i reg pa dag byed par ma gyur cig snyam du 'dod de /
translated: I do not want others to inflict any of the eight kinds of suffering on me, from being killed up to being threatened.

original: de dag kyang de ltar 'dod bzhin du gal te bdag gis log par kun tu spyad par gyur na /
analyzed: de dag kyang de ltar 'dod bzhin du gal te bdag gis log par kun tu spyad par gyur na /
translated: If I were to act wrongly toward others,

original: des de dag phongs par 'gyur zhing de de dag gi yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: des de dag phongs par 'gyur zhing de de dag gi yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur na /
translated: they would become unhappy with me and that would make me unhappy.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan dag gi yid du mi 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag gis gzhan dag la ci'i phyir kun tu spyad par bya snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan dag gi yid du mi 'ong ba gang yin pa de dag gis gzhan dag la ci'i phyir kun tu spyad par bya snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, why should I do to others what I do not want them to do to me?

original: byang chub sems dpas de ltar so sor brtags nas srog gi phyir yang gzhan dag @100b la yid du mi 'ong ba rnam pa brgyad po kun tu spyod par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de ltar so sor brtags nas srog gi phyir yang gzhan dag @100b la yid du mi 'ong ba rnam pa brgyad po kun tu spyod par mi byed pa ste /
translated: Having examined this matter in this way, the bodhisattva does not act in any of these eight unpleasant ways toward others, even to save his or her life.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s eight kinds of morality that are desired and sought after.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: “What, for the bodhisattva, is the morality that brings happiness here and in the next world?

original: de ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste ;
translated: It should be understood as being of nine kinds.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can dgag par bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa rnams ni 'gog par byed /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can dgag par bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa rnams ni 'gog par byed /
translated: Here the bodhisattva stops those who should be stopped,

original: gnang bar bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa rnams ni gnang bar byed /
analyzed: gnang bar bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa rnams ni gnang bar byed /
translated: allows those who should be allowed,

original: sems can bsdu bar bya ba rnams ni sdud par byed /
analyzed: sems can bsdu bar bya ba rnams ni sdud par byed /
translated: brings together those who should be brought together,

original: sems can tshar gcad par bya ba rnams ni tshar gcod par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can tshar gcad par bya ba rnams ni tshar gcod par byed cing /
translated: and disciplines those who should be disciplined.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang ngag gi las yongs su dag par 'jug ste /
translated: In this, the bodhisattva engages in pure actions of body and speech.

original: 'di ni re zhig tshul khrims rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig tshul khrims rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: This, then, is the fourfold morality.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan dang ldan pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa dang rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan dang ldan pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa dang rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Moreover, it is fivefold: morality endowed with generosity, morality endowed with patience, morality endowed with effort, morality endowed with meditation, and morality endowed with wisdom.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bsdus na tshul khrims rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bsdus na tshul khrims rnam pa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: If these two are combined into one, morality is ninefold.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dang gzhan dag la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la bde bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dang gzhan dag la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la bde bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “conducive to happiness here and in the next world” because it brings happiness to the bodhisattva and others in this life and the next.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s pure morality?

original: de ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of ten types.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is the morality of the bodhisattva who is engaged in the Great Vehicle, who is endowed with the Great Vehicle, who is intent on the Great Vehicle, and who is intent on the Great Vehicle in order to attain omniscience, not for the sake of rebirth as a god or

original: 'tsho ba 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin pas dang po nyid nas legs par blangs pa dang 'gal ba byas pa la chung ngu 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa dang / gnas ma yin par 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ha cang thal ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'tsho ba 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin pas dang po nyid nas legs par blangs pa dang 'gal ba byas pa la chung ngu 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa dang / gnas ma yin par 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ha cang thal ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: Since they have no regret for improper actions, they are not overzealous.🔽Since they do not indulge in the pleasures of sleep, lying down, and resting, they are free of laziness.

original: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba nyams su mi len pa dang / nyin mtshan du dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa'i phyir le lo med pa dang / snga ma bzhin du yan lag lnga'i bag yod pa la brten pas bag yod pas yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba nyams su mi len pa dang / nyin mtshan du dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa'i phyir le lo med pa dang / snga ma bzhin du yan lag lnga'i bag yod pa la brten pas bag yod pas yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: Since they are diligent in virtue day and night, they are conscientious, as explained above, in being conscientious about the five limbs.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la zhen pa med pa dang / lha nyid du smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par khas blangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir smon lam legs par btab pa dang / spyod lam dang / @101a * //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la zhen pa med pa dang / lha nyid du smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par khas blangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir smon lam legs par btab pa dang / spyod lam dang / @101a * //
translated: Since they are not attached to gain and honor and do not observe pure conduct aspiring to be a god, they make good aspirations.

original: 'phral gyi bya ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba rnams la lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa shin tu phun sum tshogs shing 'tsham pa'i phyir cho ga phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang / tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa log par 'tsho bar byed pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'i phyir 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: 'phral gyi bya ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba rnams la lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa shin tu phun sum tshogs shing 'tsham pa'i phyir cho ga phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang / tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa log par 'tsho bar byed pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'i phyir 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pas yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: They are fully endowed with perfect conduct of body and speech in all their immediate actions and in their application to virtue. They are fully endowed with perfect livelihood, for they are completely free of all the faults of wrong livelihood, such as hypocrisy.

original: 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms dang / bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i rjes su sbyor ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa dang / mu stegs can thams cad kyi lta ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa dang / nyams par mi byed cing med par mi byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa yongs su ma nyams pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms dang / bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i rjes su sbyor ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa dang / mu stegs can thams cad kyi lta ba rnam par spangs pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa dang / nyams par mi byed cing med par mi byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa yongs su ma nyams pa ste /
translated: It is free from the two extremes, because it avoids the extremes of indulgence in sensual pleasures and of self-mortification. It is a way out, because it avoids all the views of the heterodox. It is the bodhisattvas' acceptance of morality that is not defective, because it does not fail and does not cease to be.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These ten kinds of morality of the bodhisattvas are called pure.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po chen po 'di ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po chen po 'di ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu bskyed pa ste /
translated: Thus, this great aggregate of morality of the bodhisattvas produces the fruit of great enlightenment.

original: 'di la brten na byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas /
analyzed: 'di la brten na byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas /
translated: In dependence on it, the bodhisattva, having completed the perfection of morality,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ji srid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa de srid du /
translated: For as long as they have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dpag tu med pa 'di la slob pa na phan yon rnam pa lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dpag tu med pa 'di la slob pa na phan yon rnam pa lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: while they are training in this immeasurable aggregate of morality of the bodhisattvas, they will obtain five benefits:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs par 'gyur ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba chen po la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / lus zhig nas kyang gang na de dang tshul khrims mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs par 'gyur ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba chen po la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / lus zhig nas kyang gang na de dang tshul khrims mtshungs pa'am /
translated: they will be considered by the buddhas, they will die while abiding in supreme great joy, and after their bodies have fallen apart, they will be reborn in a good place, in a heavenly realm, and there they will see the bodhisattva, the great being, and will hear this perfection of wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skal ba 'dra zhing chos mthun pa pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa dag gnas pa der skye bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang /🔽tshe phyi ma la yang rang 'khrungs kyi tshul khrims nyid de /
analyzed: lhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skal ba 'dra zhing chos mthun pa pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa dag gnas pa der skye bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la yang rang 'khrungs kyi tshul khrims nyid de /
translated: In this life, they acquire immeasurable heaps of merit that perfect the transcendence of morality.

original: tshul khrims de'i bdag nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims de'i bdag nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in future lives, they attain the morality that is naturally spontaneous.

original: tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid la sogs pa rnam @101b pa dgu po ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims de thams cad ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid la sogs pa rnam @101b pa dgu po ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims de thams cad ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: That morality is included in the three kinds of morality: the morality of vow restraint, the morality of gathering virtuous natures, and the morality of working the weal of living beings.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba rnam pa gsum byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba rnam pa gsum byed de /
translated: These three kinds of morality are in brief the three actions of the bodhisattva.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni sems gnas par byed do //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni sems gnas par byed do //
translated: The morality of restraint makes the mind steady.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa ni bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa ni bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: The morality of acquiring virtuous qualities ripens one’s own qualities of buddhahood.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims ni sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims ni sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: The morality of acting for the benefit of living beings ripens living beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad ni 'di dag tu zad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad ni 'di dag tu zad de /
translated: All the actions of the bodhisattva are included in these three.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to live happily in this life,

original: sems gnas pa dang / lus dang sems dub pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems gnas pa dang / lus dang sems dub pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yin te /
translated: one must have a steady mind, and one must ripen the qualities of buddhahood without weariness of body and mind, and one must ripen living beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni de dag tu zad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni de dag tu zad do //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva is included in these three.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phan yon kyang de dag tu zad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi phan yon kyang de dag tu zad do //
translated: These are the benefits of the bodhisattva’s morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi bya ba yang de dag tu zad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi bya ba yang de dag tu zad do //
translated: These are the duties of the bodhisattva’s morality.

original: de las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: de las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: de las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: de las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing more excellent than this.

original: de la ni 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub chen po 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang bslabs so //
analyzed: de la ni 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa' byang chub chen po 'dod pa rnams kyis kyang bslabs so //
translated: In this, the bodhisattvas of the past, who desired great enlightenment, trained.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang bslab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang bslab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas of the future will train.

original: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa na gnas pa dag kyang bslab po //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las tshul khrims kyi le'u ste bcu pa'o /
analyzed: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa na gnas pa dag kyang bslab po // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las tshul khrims kyi le'u ste bcu pa'o /
translated: The bodhisattvas of the present, who abide in the endless, limitless world systems of the ten directions, are training.

original: // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: This concludes the chapter on morality, the tenth in the Yoga of the Foundation of the Bodhisattva Levels.

original: sdom ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdom ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The summary is as follows:

original: snga ma tshul khrims kyi le'u bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma tshul khrims kyi le'u bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood according to the previous chapter on morality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of the bodhisattva’s patience?

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs la brten nas sam /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs la brten nas sam /
translated: or by the power of analysis.

original: yang na rang bzhin gyis gzhan gnod par byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / thams cad kyi ji mi snyam pa dang / thams cad la ji mi snyam pa dang / zang zing med pa'i sems dang / snying rje 'ba' zhig gis ji mi snyam pa gang yin pa 'di ni mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rang bzhin gyis gzhan gnod par byed pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / thams cad kyi ji mi snyam pa dang / thams cad la ji mi snyam pa dang / zang zing med pa'i sems dang / snying rje 'ba' zhig gis ji mi snyam pa gang yin pa 'di ni mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is the indifference of the bodhisattva which is natural, which is indifferent to the harm done by others, which is indifferent to everything, which is indifferent to all things, which is indifferent with a mind free of material things, and which is indifferent with compassion alone. In brief, this is the nature of the bodhisattva's patience.

original: @102a * // de la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: @102a * // de la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What is the totality of the bodhisattva's patience?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as twofold:

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
translated: that which is based on the side of the householder and that which is based on the side of the homeless devotee.

original: phyogs de gnyis la brten pa de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs de gnyis la brten pa de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: That which is based on these two sides should be known as threefold:

original: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa la mos pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa la mos pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is patience in not retaliating for harm done by others, patience in accepting suffering, and patience in bearing with difficulties in the pursuit of the Dharma.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam par bzod par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam par bzod par byed ce na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas practice patience in not retaliating for harm done by others?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal drag pa rgyun mi 'chad pa sna tshogs yun ring ba mngon du byung na 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal drag pa rgyun mi 'chad pa sna tshogs yun ring ba mngon du byung na 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: When they are faced with various kinds of intense, continuous suffering caused by others, they train themselves correctly in the following way:

original: 'di ni rang gi las kyi le lan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi las kyi le lan yin te /
translated: “This is the result of my own karma.

original: des na bdag rang gis byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu 'di 'dra ba nyams su myong la ;
analyzed: des na bdag rang gis byas pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu 'di 'dra ba nyams su myong la ;
translated: So I am experiencing the results of nonvirtuous actions that I myself have done.

original: bdag ni sdug bsngal mi bzod de /
analyzed: bdag ni sdug bsngal mi bzod de /
translated: I cannot bear suffering,

original: mi bzod pa 'di ni phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i gnas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi bzod pa 'di ni phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i gnas su 'gyur la /
translated: and this impatience will be the cause of suffering in the future as well.

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i chos de yang dag par blangs te /🔽'dug na ni bdag nyid la mi sdug pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid sbyor bar byed par nges so //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i chos de yang dag par blangs te / 'dug na ni bdag nyid la mi sdug pa gang yin pa de la bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid sbyor bar byed par nges so //
translated: And if I were to take on myself the things that cause my suffering,🔽then I would certainly apply myself to what is unpleasant for myself.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la gnod pa byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la gnod pa byas par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, I would be harming myself,

original: gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but not others.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'du byed 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis kyang sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'du byed 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis kyang sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: All these formations that exist in my own mental continuum and in the mental continuums of others are by nature suffering.

original: gzhan dag gis ni de ma shes pas bdag rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba la yang sdug bsngal bskyed na bdag shes bzhin du bdag gis kyang gzhan rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba rnams la yang sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni cha ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni de ma shes pas bdag rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba la yang sdug bsngal bskyed na bdag shes bzhin du bdag gis kyang gzhan rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba rnams la yang sdug bsngal bskyed pa ni cha ma yin no //
translated: Since others do not understand this, I should not cause suffering for those who are naturally suffering.

original: gcig tu na nyan thos bdag nyid kyi don la zhugs pa rnams la yang bdag dang gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal bskyed pa mi bzod pa rigs pa'i tshul ma yin na /
analyzed: gcig tu na nyan thos bdag nyid kyi don la zhugs pa rnams la yang bdag dang gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal bskyed pa mi bzod pa rigs pa'i tshul ma yin na /
translated: In one way, it is not reasonable for even the śrāvakas, who are engaged in their own goal, to be unable to bear the suffering that they and others experience.

original: gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa bdag la lta ci smos snyam du de ltar so sor brtags nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa bdag la lta ci smos snyam du de ltar so sor brtags nas /
translated: How much less reasonable is it for the bodhisattvas, who are engaged in the goal of others?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de 'du shes rnam pa lnga sgom zhing sems can mdza' bo dang / mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal @102b pa rnams dang / dma' ba dang mtshungs pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams dang / skyid pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de 'du shes rnam pa lnga sgom zhing sems can mdza' bo dang / mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal @102b pa rnams dang / dma' ba dang mtshungs pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams dang / skyid pa dang /
translated: Having thus reflected, the bodhisattvas cultivate five kinds of perception and are patient with all the harms done to them by friends, enemies, and strangers, by those who are inferior, equal, and superior, and by those who are happy,

original: sdug pa rnams dang / yon tan dang / skyon dang ldan pa rnams la gnod pa thams cad bzod par byed do //
analyzed: sdug pa rnams dang / yon tan dang / skyon dang ldan pa rnams la gnod pa thams cad bzod par byed do //
translated: unhappy, virtuous, and vicious.

original: 'du shes lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of perception?

original: sngon gyi tshe rabs su snying du sdug par gyur pa'i 'du shes dang / chos tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes so //
