analyzed: sngon gyi tshe rabs su snying du sdug par gyur pa'i 'du shes dang / chos tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: the notion of having been a beloved in former lives, the notion of following mere phenomena, the notion of impermanence, the notion of suffering, and the notion of being held.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la snying du sdug pa'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la snying du sdug pa'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
translated: How does a bodhisattva cultivate the notion of being a beloved in regard to beings who do harm?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par bslab ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par bslab ste /
translated: Here a bodhisattva should train him or herself as follows:

original: dus ring po 'das pa sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu sems can gang bdag gi pha'am ma'am spun nam /
analyzed: dus ring po 'das pa sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu sems can gang bdag gi pha'am ma'am spun nam /
translated: “For a long time in the past, in other lives, these beings were my father, mother, brother,🔽sister, teacher,

original: sring mo'am / slob dpon nam /🔽mkhan po 'am /
analyzed: sring mo'am / slob dpon nam /🔽mkhan po 'am /
translated: preceptor,

original: bla ma'am / bla ma lta bur ma gyur pa ni tshul gyis rnyed par dka'o snyam du de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la dgra'i 'du shes ni med par 'gyur la snying du sdug pa'i 'du shes ni gnas par 'gyur te🔽/ de snying du sdug pa'i 'du shes de la brten nas /🔽gnod pa la ji mi snyam par byed /
analyzed: bla ma'am / bla ma lta bur ma gyur pa ni tshul gyis rnyed par dka'o snyam du de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la dgra'i 'du shes ni med par 'gyur la snying du sdug pa'i 'du shes ni gnas par 'gyur te / de snying du sdug pa'i 'du shes de la brten nas / gnod pa la ji mi snyam par byed /
translated: With this kind of proper attention, he does not perceive those who harm him as enemies, but rather as dear friends.🔽He is able to tolerate the harm that is done to him

original: bzod par byed do //
analyzed: bzod par byed do //
translated: because he has the perception of dearness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod par byed pa rnams la chos tsam du rjes su 'brang ba'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod par byed pa rnams la chos tsam du rjes su 'brang ba'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
translated: How does a bodhisattva cultivate the perception that those who harm him are merely phenomena?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Here a bodhisattva trains him or herself correctly in the following way:

original: 'di ni rkyen la rag las pa dang / 'du byed tsam dang / chos tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'di ni rkyen la rag las pa dang / 'du byed tsam dang / chos tsam du zad de /
translated: “This is merely a condition, merely a formation, and merely a phenomenon.

original: 'di la ni gshe bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la ni gshe bar byed pa'am /
translated: There is no one here who is insulting,

original: khro bar byed pa'am /🔽rdeg par byed pa'am /
analyzed: khro bar byed pa'am / rdeg par byed pa'am /
translated: who is angry,🔽who is beating,🔽who is criticizing,

original: mtshang 'dru bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: mtshang 'dru bar byed pa'am /
translated: Or they are looking for faults.

original: brgyad bkag byed pa gang yin pa de dang / gshe bar bya ba'am /🔽khro bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: brgyad bkag byed pa gang yin pa de dang / gshe bar bya ba'am / khro bar bya ba'am /
translated: what is it that is to be scolded,🔽what is it that is to be angry with,

original: brdeg par bya ba'am /🔽mtshang 'dru bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: brdeg par bya ba'am / mtshang 'dru bar bya ba'am /
translated: what is it that is to be beaten,🔽what is it that is to be criticized,

original: brgyad bkag bya ba gang yin pa'i bdag gam /🔽sems can nam /
analyzed: brgyad bkag bya ba gang yin pa'i bdag gam / sems can nam /
translated: what is it that is to be stopped?🔽There is no self, no sentient being, no life-force, and no person at all.”

original: srog gam / skye ba po ci yang med do snyam du de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas sems can du 'du shes pa ni med par 'gyur la chos tsam du 'du shes pa ni gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gam / skye ba po ci yang med do snyam du de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas sems can du 'du shes pa ni med par 'gyur la chos tsam du 'du shes pa ni gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, by properly bringing this to mind, the perception of sentient beings will be eliminated and the perception of mere phenomena will remain.

original: de chos tsam du 'du shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: de chos tsam du 'du shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas /
translated: Relying on and abiding in that perception of mere phenomena,

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa thams cad la ji @103a * //🔽mi snyam par byed /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pa thams cad la ji @103a * // mi snyam par byed /
translated: he will be indifferent to all the harm of others.

original: bzod par byed do //
analyzed: bzod par byed do //
translated: He will be patient.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas meditate on the perception of impermanence with regard to sentient beings who harm them?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Here bodhisattvas train correctly as follows:

original: sems can skye zhing 'byung ba gang dag su yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang 'chi ba'i chos can yin la gnod pa'i mchog ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can skye zhing 'byung ba gang dag su yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang 'chi ba'i chos can yin la gnod pa'i mchog ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Whatever sentient beings are born and appear, all of them are impermanent and subject to death. The greatest harm is this:

original: srog dang bral bar byed pa 'di yin pas na /
analyzed: srog dang bral bar byed pa 'di yin pas na /
translated: they are deprived of life.

original: de ltar sems can rang bzhin gyis 'chi ba'i chos can mi rtag pa rnams la skyes bu mkhas pa rnyog pa'i sems bskyed pa yang ma yin na /🔽lag pa'am / bong ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar sems can rang bzhin gyis 'chi ba'i chos can mi rtag pa rnams la skyes bu mkhas pa rnyog pa'i sems bskyed pa yang ma yin na / lag pa'am / bong ba'am /
translated: Thus, when sentient beings are naturally subject to death and impermanence, it is not right for a wise person to generate a disturbed mind.🔽What need is there to mention striking them with a hand, a clod of earth,

original: dbyug pas bsnun pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dbyug pas bsnun pa lta ci smos te /
translated: or a stick?🔽What need is there to mention killing them permanently?

original: gtan du gsad pa lta ci zhig smos snyam nas de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas rtag pa dang snying por 'du shes pa ni spong la /
analyzed: gtan du gsad pa lta ci zhig smos snyam nas de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas rtag pa dang snying por 'du shes pa ni spong la /
translated: In this way, by properly attending to this, the perception of permanence and an essence is abandoned.

original: mi rtag pa dang snying po med pa'i 'du shes ni gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang snying po med pa'i 'du shes ni gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: The perception of impermanence and the absence of an essence is stabilized.

original: de mi rtag pa'i 'du shes de la brten nas /
analyzed: de mi rtag pa'i 'du shes de la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on that perception of impermanence,

original: gnod pa thams cad la ji mi snyam par byed bzod par byed do //
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad la ji mi snyam par byed bzod par byed do //
translated: one is indifferent to all harm and forbears it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod par byed pa rnams la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod par byed pa rnams la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas cultivate the perception of suffering with regard to sentient beings who harm them?🔽Bodhisattvas see that even those sentient beings who are in a state of great perfection are connected with the three kinds of suffering: the suffering of change, the suffering of pain and the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas ni sems can gang dag phun sum tshogs pa chen po la gnas pa de dag kyang sdug bsngal gsum po 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang 'brel par mthong na rgud pa la gnas pa rnams lta ci smos te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas ni sems can gang dag phun sum tshogs pa chen po la gnas pa de dag kyang sdug bsngal gsum po 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang 'brel par mthong na rgud pa la gnas pa rnams lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to speak of those who are in a state of decline?

original: des de ltar mthong ba na 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: des de ltar mthong ba na 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: When they see this, they train themselves correctly in the following way:

original: de ltar rtag tu sems can sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu sems can sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: “In this way, I must always strive to remove the suffering of those sentient beings who are suffering.

original: bdag gis btsal bar bya'i sdug bsngal bsgrub pa'i phyir ni mi bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag gis btsal bar bya'i sdug bsngal bsgrub pa'i phyir ni mi bya'o snyam ste /
translated: I must not act in order to create suffering.”

original: de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bde ba'i 'du shes ni med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bde ba'i 'du shes ni med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: As they reflect in this way, the perception of happiness is eliminated.

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The idea of suffering will arise.

original: de sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes de la brten nas /
analyzed: de sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes de la brten nas /
translated: And on the basis of that idea of suffering,

original: gzhan gnod pa byed pa thams cad la ji mi snyam par byed /
analyzed: gzhan gnod pa byed pa thams cad la ji mi snyam par byed /
translated: he will be indifferent to all the harm others do to him.

original: bzod par byed do //
analyzed: bzod par byed do //
translated: He will be patient.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes ji ltar sgom zhe na /
translated: How does a bodhisattva cultivate the idea of being held dear by sentient beings who do harm?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Here a bodhisattva trains him or herself correctly in this way:

original: @103b bdag gis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa na /🔽sems can thams cad kyi don bdag gis bya'o zhes sems can thams cad chung ma'i tshul du bzung ste /🔽bdag gis 'di ltar sems can thams cad nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: @103b bdag gis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa na / sems can thams cad kyi don bdag gis bya'o zhes sems can thams cad chung ma'i tshul du bzung ste / bdag gis 'di ltar sems can thams cad nye bar bzung nas /
translated: “When I first gave rise to the thought of awakening,🔽I took up the responsibility for the welfare of all sentient beings, as if they were my own children.

original: de dag gi don bya'o zhes byas pa las gnod pa byed cing /
analyzed: de dag gi don bya'o zhes byas pa las gnod pa byed cing /
translated: Having taken up the responsibility for the welfare of all sentient beings,

original: gnod pa byed pa las ji mi snyam par mi byed pa 'di ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa las ji mi snyam par mi byed pa 'di ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam ste /
translated: it is not right for me to be indifferent to those who do harm, and to not respond to those who do harm.”

original: de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas /
analyzed: de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pas /
translated: In this way,

original: sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la gzhan yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes ni med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la gzhan yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes ni med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: he does not have the idea that sentient beings are other,

original: yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes ni gnas par 'gyur te /🔽de yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes de la brten nas gzhan gnod par byed pa thams cad la /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes ni gnas par 'gyur te / de yongs su bzung ba'i 'du shes de la brten nas gzhan gnod par byed pa thams cad la /
translated: but has the idea of their being his own self.🔽On the basis of that idea of their being his own self,

original: ji mi snyam par byed bzod par byed do //
analyzed: ji mi snyam par byed bzod par byed do //
translated: he is indifferent to all who do him harm, and he forbears.

original: de la bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is forbearance?

original: mi 'khrugs pa dang / phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang / sems la yang kho na du mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa dang / phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang / sems la yang kho na du mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not being disturbed, not returning the blow, and not bearing ill will in the mind.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s forbearance of suffering?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Here a bodhisattva trains him or herself as follows:

original: bdag sngon 'dod pa spyod pa dag la gnas shing 'dod pa rnams yongs su tshol ba na /
analyzed: bdag sngon 'dod pa spyod pa dag la gnas shing 'dod pa rnams yongs su tshol ba na /
translated: “Formerly, when I was living the home life, I was intent on obtaining sensual pleasures.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par tshor bzhin du /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par tshor bzhin du /
translated: Knowing that they are the cause of suffering,

original: 'dod pa sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can rnams kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can rnams kyi phyir /
translated: for the sake of the objects of desire, which are by nature suffering,

original: zhing las dang / tshong dang / rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba la zhugs nas /🔽sdug bsngal mang po drag po dag nyams su blangs shing dang du blangs la nyams su myong ba de de ltar don med de /
analyzed: zhing las dang / tshong dang / rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba la zhugs nas / sdug bsngal mang po drag po dag nyams su blangs shing dang du blangs la nyams su myong ba de de ltar don med de /
translated: they engage in farming, business, and service to the king,🔽and they undergo and accept many kinds of intense suffering.

original: sdug bsngal kho na'i phyir tshor bzhin du mi shes pa'i nyes pas bdag gis sdug bsngal chen po nyams su blangs nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kho na'i phyir tshor bzhin du mi shes pa'i nyes pas bdag gis sdug bsngal chen po nyams su blangs nas /
translated: That is pointless, for they undergo great suffering while knowing that it is suffering, and through the fault of not knowing,🔽now I will engage in virtue that brings about happiness.

original: da ni bdag bde bsgrub pa'i dge ba la zhugs par tshor bzhin du de las bye ba phrag 'bum 'gyur du sdug bsngal dang du blang zhing nyams su blangs pa ni cha yin na /
analyzed: da ni bdag bde bsgrub pa'i dge ba la zhugs par tshor bzhin du de las bye ba phrag 'bum 'gyur du sdug bsngal dang du blang zhing nyams su blangs pa ni cha yin na /
translated: While knowing that, I will undergo and accept suffering a hundred thousand times more than that.

original: de bas chung du lta la ci smos snyam ste /
analyzed: de bas chung du lta la ci smos snyam ste /
translated: What need is there to mention a lesser amount?’

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la zhugs pa de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub la zhugs pa de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed cing /
translated: The bodhisattva who is thus correctly attending to the thought of awakening

original: gzhi thams cad las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang du len par byed do //
analyzed: gzhi thams cad las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang du len par byed do //
translated: He accepts the suffering that arises from all bases.

original: gzhi thams cad las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi thams cad las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is the suffering that arises from all bases?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as being of eight types:

original: gnas la brten pa @104a * //
analyzed: gnas la brten pa @104a * //
translated: 1) based on the dwelling place;

original: dang ; 'jig rten gyi chos la brten pa dang / spyod lam la brten pa dang / chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brten pa dang / slong mos yongs su 'tsho ba la brten pa dang / mngon par brtson pas dub pa la brten pa dang /
analyzed: dang ; 'jig rten gyi chos la brten pa dang / spyod lam la brten pa dang / chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brten pa dang / slong mos yongs su 'tsho ba la brten pa dang / mngon par brtson pas dub pa la brten pa dang /
translated: 2) based on worldly conditions; 3) based on deportment; 4) based on upholding the Dharma; 5) based on living by alms; 6) based on the fatigue of striving;

original: sems can gyi don byed pa la brten pa dang / 'phral gyi bya ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa la brten pa dang / 'phral gyi bya ba la brten pa'o //
translated: 7) based on benefiting sentient beings; and 8) based on immediate activities.

original: gnas ni gzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas ni gzhi ste /
translated: The dwelling place is the basis.

original: gang la brten nas legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs te /
analyzed: gang la brten nas legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs te /
translated: Based on that, one goes forth from the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, and receives full ordination.

original: dge slong gi dngos por 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos por 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: One becomes a fully ordained monk.

original: chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad rnams te /
analyzed: chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad rnams te /
translated: They are the robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for sickness that are obtained in a way that is base, small, contemptible, or delayed.

original: de dag ngan pa dang / nyung ba dang / ma gus pa dang / brgyangs pas thob par byang chub sems dpa' mi dga' bar mi 'gyur /🔽yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag ngan pa dang / nyung ba dang / ma gus pa dang / brgyangs pas thob par byang chub sems dpa' mi dga' bar mi 'gyur / yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: The bodhisattva does not become unhappy or discouraged by these.

original: gzhi nges brtson 'grus kyang gtong bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi nges brtson 'grus kyang gtong bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: And he does not give up his effort.

original: de ltar gnas kyi rten gyi sdug bsngal dang du len par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar gnas kyi rten gyi sdug bsngal dang du len par byed do //
translated: Thus he accepts the suffering of the basis.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos ni dgu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos ni dgu ste /
translated: There are nine worldly concerns:

original: ma rnyed pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / smad pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can 'jig pa dang / zad pa'i chos can zad pa dang / rga ba'i chos can rga ba dang / na ba'i chos can na ba dang /🔽'chi ba'i chos can 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / smad pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can 'jig pa dang / zad pa'i chos can zad pa dang / rga ba'i chos can rga ba dang / na ba'i chos can na ba dang / 'chi ba'i chos can 'chi ba ste /
translated: gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos 'di dag mtha' dag gam /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos 'di dag mtha' dag gam /
translated: These nine worldly concerns are either all good or all bad.

original: so sor 'ong zhing mngon du gyur pa las sdug bsngal 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi chos la brten pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so sor 'ong zhing mngon du gyur pa las sdug bsngal 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi chos la brten pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That suffering which arises from the individual’s own manifest actions is called “based on worldly things.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni des thebs kyang gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni des thebs kyang gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed ;
translated: Even when a bodhisattva is struck by that, he does not abandon effort on account of it.

original: so sor brtags nas nyams su len cing dang du len par byed do //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas nyams su len cing dang du len par byed do //
translated: He endures it and practices with full awareness.

original: spyod lam ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: spyod lam ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four postures:

original: 'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'o //
translated: walking, standing, sitting, and lying down.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa gnyis kyis bsgribs pa'i chos rnams las nyin mtshan du sems yongs su sbyong bar byed de /🔽gzhi de las ngal ba'i sdug bsngal byung ba dang du len par byed kyi dus ma yin par khri'am /🔽khri'u 'am / rtsva bting ba'am /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa gnyis kyis bsgribs pa'i chos rnams las nyin mtshan du sems yongs su sbyong bar byed de / gzhi de las ngal ba'i sdug bsngal byung ba dang du len par byed kyi dus ma yin par khri'am / khri'u 'am / rtsva bting ba'am /
translated: In these, the bodhisattva purifies his mind day and night of the obscurations of the dharmas of walking and sitting.🔽He endures the suffering that arises from that cause. He does not lie down on a couch, a bench, a spread of straw,

original: lo ma bting ba la glos 'bebs par mi byed do //
analyzed: lo ma bting ba la glos 'bebs par mi byed do //
translated: or a spread of leaves at the wrong time.

original: chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven kinds of Dharma-holding:

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa dang / @104b rim gro bya ba dang / bla ma la mchod pa bya ba dang / rim gro bya ba dang / chos rnams bzung ba dang / bzung ba rnams gzhan dag la rgya cher ston pa dang / gsang bstod de kha ton du bya ba dang /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa dang / @104b rim gro bya ba dang / bla ma la mchod pa bya ba dang / rim gro bya ba dang / chos rnams bzung ba dang / bzung ba rnams gzhan dag la rgya cher ston pa dang / gsang bstod de kha ton du bya ba dang /
translated: worship and service of the Three Jewels, worship and service of the guru, receiving the teachings, teaching extensively to others what one has received, reciting them with reverence,

original: gcig pu dben par gnas te /
analyzed: gcig pu dben par gnas te /
translated: and staying in solitude.

original: yang dag par sems shing 'jal la nye bar rtog pa dang / rnal 'byor yid la byed pas zin pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sems shing 'jal la nye bar rtog pa dang / rnal 'byor yid la byed pas zin pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'o //
translated: And there is the cultivation of serenity and insight, which is supported by the attention of yoga.

original: chos yongs su 'dzin pa rnam pa bdun po 'di dag la byang chub sems dpa' rtsol ba na /
analyzed: chos yongs su 'dzin pa rnam pa bdun po 'di dag la byang chub sems dpa' rtsol ba na /
translated: When the bodhisattva is engaged in these seven kinds of Dharma-holding,

original: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de yang dang du len cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de yang dang du len cing /
translated: he or she accepts whatever suffering may arise

original: gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed do //
translated: and does not abandon effort on that basis.

original: slong mos 'tsho ba yang rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: slong mos 'tsho ba yang rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
translated: The life of a mendicant is also to be understood in seven ways:

original: khyim pa'i mtshan ma spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyim pa'i mtshan ma spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he abandons the signs of a householder,

original: skra dang kha spu bregs pa la sogs pas gzugs mi sdug pa nyams su blangs pa dang / gos dras pa dang / kha dog ngan pa 'chang ba'i phyir kha dog ngan pa nyams su blangs pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa thams cad la gdams nas gnas pa'i phyir tshul gzhan bya ba dang /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs pa la sogs pas gzugs mi sdug pa nyams su blangs pa dang / gos dras pa dang / kha dog ngan pa 'chang ba'i phyir kha dog ngan pa nyams su blangs pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa thams cad la gdams nas gnas pa'i phyir tshul gzhan bya ba dang /
translated: he practices ugliness by shaving his head and beard and so on, he practices bad color by wearing patched rags and bad colors and he practices a different mode of behavior by abandoning all worldly behavior and remaining in solitude.

original: zhing las la sogs pa'i las kyi mtha' rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: zhing las la sogs pa'i las kyi mtha' rnam par spangs te /
translated: He practices the abandonment of work by abandoning work such as farming.

original: gzhan las rnyed pas 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir gzhan la rag las pa'i 'tsho ba can dang / rnyed pa rnams sogs shing longs spyod par mi byed pa'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan la chos gos la sogs pa 'tshol ba dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos spangs pa'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i 'dod pa rnams las ldog par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan las rnyed pas 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir gzhan la rag las pa'i 'tsho ba can dang / rnyed pa rnams sogs shing longs spyod par mi byed pa'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan la chos gos la sogs pa 'tshol ba dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos spangs pa'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i 'dod pa rnams las ldog par bya ba dang /
translated: They turn away from human desires for as long as they live, since they abandon sexual intercourse, which is impure conduct.

original: zlos gar dang / gar thabs dang / bzhad gad dang / sgeg pa la sogs pa lta lta ba spangs shing /🔽mdza' bo dang / snying du sdug pa dang / chung po grogs dag dang / bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' dgur spyod pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zlos gar dang / gar thabs dang / bzhad gad dang / sgeg pa la sogs pa lta lta ba spangs shing / mdza' bo dang / snying du sdug pa dang / chung po grogs dag dang / bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' dgur spyod pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: They turn away from watching shows such as plays, dancing, comedy and flirtation.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i dga' ba dang rtsed mo rnams las ldog par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i dga' ba dang rtsed mo rnams las ldog par bya ba ste /
translated: They turn away from human pleasures and games for as long as they live, since they abandon friends, lovers, young companions, laughter, play, joy and revelry.

original: de lta bu nyam nga ba dang / gnod pa'i slong mo spyod pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de lta bu nyam nga ba dang / gnod pa'i slong mo spyod pa la brten nas /
translated: Such is the life of a beggar, full of danger and harm.

original: sdug bsngal byung ba de yang byang chub sems dpa' dang du len par byed la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal byung ba de yang byang chub sems dpa' dang du len par byed la /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva endures the suffering that arises from the hardships and dangers of begging for alms.

original: gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed do //
translated: And on that basis, he does not abandon his energetic practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa la lus kyi dub pa dang / sems kyi 'khrugs pa yongs su ngal ba'i gzhi @105a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa la lus kyi dub pa dang / sems kyi 'khrugs pa yongs su ngal ba'i gzhi @105a * //
translated: When the bodhisattva is engaged in the practice of virtue, he may become physically exhausted and mentally upset.

original: las gang dag byung yang byang chub sems dpa' gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: las gang dag byung yang byang chub sems dpa' gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed do //
translated: But on that basis, the bodhisattva does not abandon his energetic practice.

original: sems can gyi don gyi las ni snga ma bzhin du rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi las ni snga ma bzhin du rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The work for the sake of sentient beings should be understood as elevenfold, as previously described.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhi des sdug bsngal byung ba yang dang du len par byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhi des sdug bsngal byung ba yang dang du len par byed la /
translated: The bodhisattva endures the suffering that arises from that work.

original: gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhi des brtson 'grus gtong bar mi byed do //
translated: And on that basis, he does not abandon his energetic practice.

original: 'phral gyi bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i chos gos dang / lhung bzed kyi las la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral gyi bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i chos gos dang / lhung bzed kyi las la sogs pa'o //
translated: The immediate action is the action of the robes and begging bowl of one who has gone forth, and so on.

original: khyim pa'i ni yang dag pa'i zhing las dang / tshong bya ba dang / rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pa'i ni yang dag pa'i zhing las dang / tshong bya ba dang / rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The householder’s is the action of agriculture, commerce, service to the king, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhi de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yang dang du len par byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhi de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal yang dang du len par byed la /
translated: The bodhisattva willingly accepts the suffering that arises from those actions.

original: gzhi des brtson 'grus kyang gtong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhi des brtson 'grus kyang gtong bar mi byed do //
translated: And he does not abandon his effort.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sdug bsngal gang yang rung bas thabs kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug pa kho nar byed kyi /🔽mi 'jug par ni mi byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sdug bsngal gang yang rung bas thabs kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jug pa kho nar byed kyi / mi 'jug par ni mi byed la /
translated: Whatever suffering the bodhisattva encounters, he makes it a means to enter into unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.🔽He does not fail to enter into it.

original: zhugs nas kyang ldog par mi byed cing /
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang ldog par mi byed cing /
translated: And having entered into it, he does not turn back.

original: yid mi dga' ba med la /
analyzed: yid mi dga' ba med la /
translated: He does not become discouraged.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'jug pa 'di ni de'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'jug pa 'di ni de'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He enters into it with a mind that is not afflicted. This is called the bodhisattva’s patience that willingly accepts suffering.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos la nges par sems pa la mos pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos la nges par sems pa la mos pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s acceptance of conviction in the teaching?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shin tu brtags pa'i blos mos pa'i gnas rnam pa brgyad po dkon mchog gi yon tan rnams dang / de kho na'i don dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu chen po dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shin tu brtags pa'i blos mos pa'i gnas rnam pa brgyad po dkon mchog gi yon tan rnams dang / de kho na'i don dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu chen po dang /
translated: Here the bodhisattva, with a mind that has well investigated the discernment of the true teaching, has a firm conviction in the eight kinds of objects of conviction: the qualities of the Three Jewels, the meaning of reality, the great power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / bdag gis thob par bya ba'i don dang / des thob pa'i thabs dang / shes bya'i spyod yul la mos pa shin tu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / bdag gis thob par bya ba'i don dang / des thob pa'i thabs dang / shes bya'i spyod yul la mos pa shin tu gnas pa yin no //
translated: cause and effect, the meaning to be attained by oneself, the means of attaining it, and the domain of knowledge.

original: mos pa de yang rgyu gnyis kyis legs par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: mos pa de yang rgyu gnyis kyis legs par gnas pa yin te /
translated: And that conviction is well established by two causes:

original: yun ring po nas goms pa dang / shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par thob pas so ;
analyzed: yun ring po nas goms pa dang / shes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par thob pas so ;
translated: long practice and the attainment of very pure knowledge.

original: ;'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyogs rnam pa gnyis la brten pa'i bzod pa thams cad de /
analyzed: ;'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyogs rnam pa gnyis la brten pa'i bzod pa thams cad de /
translated: This is the patience of the bodhisattvas based on two aspects.

original: de la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i bzod pa la sogs pa rgyas par dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i bzod pa la sogs pa rgyas par dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: On the basis of that, the patience of the bodhisattvas should be understood as divided into the difficult, etc.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i bzod pa gang @105b zhe na ;
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i bzod pa gang @105b zhe na ;
translated: What is the bodhisattvas difficult patience?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as threefold.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can nyam chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod par byed pa 'di ni dka' ba'i bzod pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can nyam chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod par byed pa 'di ni dka' ba'i bzod pa dang po'o //
translated: Here a bodhisattva endures the harm done by weak sentient beings. This is the first difficult patience.

original: rje dpon du gyur pa la bdag nyid bzod par byed pa 'di ni dka' ba'i bzod pa gnyis pa'o//
analyzed: rje dpon du gyur pa la bdag nyid bzod par byed pa 'di ni dka' ba'i bzod pa gnyis pa'o//
translated: He endures the harm done by those who are in a high position. This is the second difficult patience.

original: sems can rigs dang rus ches dma' ba dag gis gnod pa mchog tu chen po byas pa bzod pa 'di ni dka' ba'i bzod pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rigs dang rus ches dma' ba dag gis gnod pa mchog tu chen po byas pa bzod pa 'di ni dka' ba'i bzod pa gsum pa'o //
translated: He endures the great harm done by sentient beings of low social class and family. This is the third difficult patience.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad kyi sgo nas bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad kyi sgo nas bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: In this regard, what is a bodhisattva’s patience that is directed everywhere?

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of four types:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni mdza' bo dang / mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal pa dang / gsum char gyis dma' ba dang / mtshungs pa dang / lhag pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni mdza' bo dang / mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal pa dang / gsum char gyis dma' ba dang / mtshungs pa dang / lhag pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa bzod pa'o //
translated: Here a bodhisattva endures the harm that is carried out by all beings—those who are loved, those who are not, and those who are neutral—whether they are inferior, superior, or equal to oneself.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu dam pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu dam pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: In this regard, what is a bodhisattva’s patience of a true spiritual being?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of five types:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni thog ma kho nar bzod pa la phan yon du lta ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni thog ma kho nar bzod pa la phan yon du lta ba yin te /
translated: Here a bodhisattva is one who, from the very outset, views patience as a benefit.

original: gang zag bzod pa can ni phyi ma la yang dgra mang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dbye ba mang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba mang bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang zag bzod pa can ni phyi ma la yang dgra mang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dbye ba mang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba mang bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: He or she thinks to him or herself, “A patient person will not have many enemies in future lives, will not have many disputes, will have much happiness and mental satisfaction, and will die without having had any regrets.

original: lus zhig kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: lus zhig kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: Even if the body is destroyed, they will be reborn in the higher realms, among the gods.

original: de de ltar phan yon du lta bas bdag nyid kyis kyang bzod cing /
analyzed: de de ltar phan yon du lta bas bdag nyid kyis kyang bzod cing /
translated: Thus, seeing the benefits, they themselves are patient,

original: gzhan yang bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la /
analyzed: gzhan yang bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug la /
translated: and they encourage others to be patient.

original: bzod pa'i bsngags pa yang brjod cing /
analyzed: bzod pa'i bsngags pa yang brjod cing /
translated: They praise patience.

original: gang zag bzod pa can mthong na yang yid dga' zhing kun tu dga' bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zag bzod pa can mthong na yang yid dga' zhing kun tu dga' bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And when they see patient people, they are delighted and rejoice.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s patience in all its forms?

original: de ni rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is of six kinds and seven kinds,

original: gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bcu gsum du yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bcu gsum du yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: which together make up thirteen kinds.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni mi bzod pa mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur bar rig pas 'jig pa las kyang bzod pa dang / sems can rnams la snying brtse ba'i sems dang / snying rje ba'i sems dang / gnyen po'i sems kyi byams pas kyang bzod pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni mi bzod pa mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur bar rig pas 'jig pa las kyang bzod pa dang / sems can rnams la snying brtse ba'i sems dang / snying rje ba'i sems dang / gnyen po'i sems kyi byams pas kyang bzod pa dang /
translated: They are patient with a mind of love that is affectionate toward sentient beings, a compassionate mind and a mind that is the antidote.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa drag po dang ldan pas @106a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa drag po dang ldan pas @106a * //
translated: They are patient with a strong aspiration for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽They are patient with the causal factor that is the cause, because they wish to perfect the transcendent perfection of patience.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'dod pas byed rgyu'i rgyus kyang bzod pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu byung ba rnams ni bzod pa'i stobs can yin no zhes gsungs pas rnam grangs des kyang tshul khrims yang dag par blangs shing rab tu byung ba la bzod pa med pa ni rigs pa'i tshul ma yin pas chos yang dag par blangs
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'dod pas byed rgyu'i rgyus kyang bzod pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu byung ba rnams ni bzod pa'i stobs can yin no zhes gsungs pas rnam grangs des kyang tshul khrims yang dag par blangs shing rab tu byung ba la bzod pa med pa ni rigs pa'i tshul ma yin pas chos yang dag par blangs
translated: Since the Bhagavān has said that those who have gone forth are those who have the power of patience, it is illogical for those who have taken up discipline and gone forth to be impatient.

original: pas kyang bzod pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / sngon bzod pa goms par byas pa la gnas shing 'dug pas /🔽rang bzhin gyis kyang bzod pa dang / chos thams cad la sems can med par rig nas brjod du med pa'i chos tsam du mthong bas chos la nges par sems pas kyang bzod pa dang / gnod par byed pa thams cad kyang bzod pa dang /
analyzed: pas kyang bzod pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / sngon bzod pa goms par byas pa la gnas shing 'dug pas / rang bzhin gyis kyang bzod pa dang / chos thams cad la sems can med par rig nas brjod du med pa'i chos tsam du mthong bas chos la nges par sems pas kyang bzod pa dang / gnod par byed pa thams cad kyang bzod pa dang /
translated: patience due to the power of the cause, patience due to the power of the condition, patience due to the power of the root, patience due to the power of the field, patience due to the power of the basis, patience due to the power of the support,

original: thams cad kyis kyang bzod pa dang / yul thams cad de lkog gam skye bo mang po sngar yang bzod pa dang / dus thams cad de snga dro dang ; nyi ma'i gung dang / nyi ma phyed dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang /
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang bzod pa dang / yul thams cad de lkog gam skye bo mang po sngar yang bzod pa dang / dus thams cad de snga dro dang ; nyi ma'i gung dang / nyi ma phyed dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang /
translated: patience due to the power of the Dharma, patience due to the power of the object, patience due to the power of all, patience due to the power of the place, patience due to the power of the time, patience due to the power of the aspect, and patience due to the power of the mental state.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba na bzod pa dang / na ba dang / tha mal pa dang / rgud pa dang / dar ba'i tshe yang bzod pa dang / snun par mi byed pa'i phyir lus kyis bzod pa dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba na bzod pa dang / na ba dang / tha mal pa dang / rgud pa dang / dar ba'i tshe yang bzod pa dang / snun par mi byed pa'i phyir lus kyis bzod pa dang /
translated: Patience of the body means to be patient with regard to the past, future, and present, and to be patient with regard to illness, health, and neutral feelings, as well as with regard to decline and prosperity. It also means to be patient with regard to those who harm you physically.🔽Patience of speech means to be patient with regard to unpleasant words and to not speak harshly.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig mi 'byin pa'i ngag gis kyang bzod pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa dang / bsam pa rnyog pa can mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yid kyis kyang bzod pa'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig mi 'byin pa'i ngag gis kyang bzod pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa dang / bsam pa rnyog pa can mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yid kyis kyang bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience of mind means to be patient with regard to those who are mentally disturbed and to not hold grudges.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' phongs shing 'dod pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' phongs shing 'dod pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s patience that is difficult to carry out?

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of eight types.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po sdug bsngal ba rnams las slong ba'i gnod pa bzod pa dang / sems can ma rungs pa sdig pa chen po'i las byed pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni slong ba po sdug bsngal ba rnams las slong ba'i gnod pa bzod pa dang / sems can ma rungs pa sdig pa chen po'i las byed pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas /
translated: Here a bodhisattva endures the harm that is done to him or her by those who are suffering and who are petitioners. He or she also endures the harm that is done by those who are wicked persons who commit evil deeds, on the basis of the great compassion that is directed toward them.

original: kun nas mnar sems mi byed pa'i bzod pa dang / rab tu byung ba tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems mi byed pa'i bzod pa dang / rab tu byung ba tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po la brten nas /
translated: The patience of not retaliating, based on great compassion for those who are not ordained and have broken their vows,

original: kun nas mnar sems mi byed pa'i bzod pa dang / btsal ba rnam pa lnga mi brjed pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems mi byed pa'i bzod pa dang / btsal ba rnam pa lnga mi brjed pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: and the patience of not forgetting the five kinds of search.🔽The five kinds of search are the search for the Dharma, the search for the meaning, the search for the truth, the search for gnosis and the search for the path.

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad pa dang / chos rnams yongs su btsal ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub @106b pa dang ; chos de dag nyid gzhan dag la rgya cher bstan pa dang /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad pa dang / chos rnams yongs su btsal ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub @106b pa dang ; chos de dag nyid gzhan dag la rgya cher bstan pa dang /
translated: The patience of not forgetting the five kinds of search is the patience of not forgetting the five kinds of search, which are striving to dispel the suffering of suffering beings, searching for the Dharma, practicing the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, teaching those very Dharmas extensively to others and working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa rnams dang / sems can gyi bya ba rnams la yang dag pa'i grogs su 'gro ba'i btsal ba la mi brjed pa gang yin pa de ni phongs shing 'dod pa'i bzod pa rnam pa brgyad ces bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa rnams dang / sems can gyi bya ba rnams la yang dag pa'i grogs su 'gro ba'i btsal ba la mi brjed pa gang yin pa de ni phongs shing 'dod pa'i bzod pa rnam pa brgyad ces bya ste /
translated: These are called the eight kinds of patience of one who is in need and wants.

original: sems can rnams gang gis phongs par 'gyur ba de ni bzod pas yongs su spong bar byed la /
analyzed: sems can rnams gang gis phongs par 'gyur ba de ni bzod pas yongs su spong bar byed la /
translated: By means of patience, one avoids the conditions that would cause sentient beings to be deprived of anything.

original: gang 'dod pa de ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de ni sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And one accomplishes whatever they desire.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is patience that brings happiness here and in the next world?

original: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' bag yod par dge ba'i chos rnams la gnas pa na sems can rnams la snying brtse ba nyid gtso bor byas te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bag yod par dge ba'i chos rnams la gnas pa na sems can rnams la snying brtse ba nyid gtso bor byas te /
translated: It should be regarded as ninefold:

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bus zin pa dang / sha sbrang gis zin pa dang / rlung dang / nyi tshan dang / sdig sbrul gyis zin pa rnams bzod pa dang / ngal ba las byung ba'i lus dang sems dub pa dang /
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bus zin pa dang / sha sbrang gis zin pa dang / rlung dang / nyi tshan dang / sdig sbrul gyis zin pa rnams bzod pa dang / ngal ba las byung ba'i lus dang sems dub pa dang /
translated: Here a bodhisattva, while remaining heedful in virtuous qualities, is patient with cold, heat, hunger, and thirst; with being bitten by flies and mosquitoes; with wind, sun, and creeping things; with fatigue and languor; and with the pain that arises from the elements being agitated.

original: 'khrug pa bzod pa dang / 'khor ba na yod pa'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams bzod pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrug pa bzod pa dang / 'khor ba na yod pa'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams bzod pa ste /
translated: patience in enduring conflict, and patience in enduring the sufferings of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on that occur in cyclic existence.

original: de ltar bzod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang mi 'dre bar bdag nyid kyang tshe 'di la bde ba la reg par gnas shing tshe phyi ma la yang bde ba'i rgyu yang dag par blangs te 'dug la gzhan dag kyang
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang mi 'dre bar bdag nyid kyang tshe 'di la bde ba la reg par gnas shing tshe phyi ma la yang bde ba'i rgyu yang dag par blangs te 'dug la gzhan dag kyang
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is patient does not mix with sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas. He himself remains in contact with happiness in this life and, having taken up the causes of happiness in future lives, he remains in that. And he is engaged in causing others

original: tshe 'di dang / tshe phyi ma la bde bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang / tshe phyi ma la bde bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin te /
translated: to be happy in this life and in future lives.

original: de bas na 'di ni 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called “patience that leads to happiness here and in the next world.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s pure patience?

original: de ni rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as having ten aspects.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan dag gis gnod pa dang / phongs pa dang / 'gal bar byas pa na phyir gnod par yang mi byed pa dang / yid 'khrug par yang mi 'gyur ba dang / dgar bsam par yang mi 'dzin pa dang ;
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan dag gis gnod pa dang / phongs pa dang / 'gal bar byas pa na phyir gnod par yang mi byed pa dang / yid 'khrug par yang mi 'gyur ba dang / dgar bsam par yang mi 'dzin pa dang ;
translated: Here, when others harm, injure, or oppose a bodhisattva, he or she does not retaliate, does not become upset, and does not hold a grudge.

original: sngar ji lta ba bzhin du phyis kyang phan gdags pa'i phyir brtson par byed cing /
analyzed: sngar ji lta ba bzhin du phyis kyang phan gdags pa'i phyir brtson par byed cing /
translated: Just as before, he or she strives to help them later on.🔽He or she does not harm those who are engaged in helping activities, and he or she is the first to apologize to those who have harmed him or her.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba byed pa la gnod par mi byed pa dang / gnod pa byed pa rnams la yang bdag nyid kyis shad kyis byang bar byed pa dang / mi dga' bar byas na yang mi dga' bar gyur kyang rung zhes gzhan @107a * //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba byed pa la gnod par mi byed pa dang / gnod pa byed pa rnams la yang bdag nyid kyis shad kyis byang bar byed pa dang / mi dga' bar byas na yang mi dga' bar gyur kyang rung zhes gzhan @107a * //
translated: He or she does not make others apologize for displeasing him or her, saying, “It is all right if you have displeased me.”

original: dag la 'chags su mi gzhug pa dang / de nyid rkyen du byas nas mi bzod pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: dag la 'chags su mi gzhug pa dang / de nyid rkyen du byas nas mi bzod pa las brtsams te /
translated: Taking that very situation as the occasion, he or she does not give rise to impatience.

original: shas cher ngo tsha ba shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ldan pa dang / bzod pa las brtsams te ston pa la shas cher sdug par 'dzin cing gus pa dang ldan pa dang / sems can la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: shas cher ngo tsha ba shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang ldan pa dang / bzod pa las brtsams te ston pa la shas cher sdug par 'dzin cing gus pa dang ldan pa dang / sems can la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa las brtsams te /
translated: For the most part, they are endowed with a compassionate attitude toward sentient beings, beginning with nonviolence toward sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la shas cher snying rje ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / yang na mi bzod pa'i chos kyi grogs dang bcas pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la shas cher snying rje ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / yang na mi bzod pa'i chos kyi grogs dang bcas pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: Or else, they are free from the attachment of the realm of desire, having completely abandoned all the factors of impatience and their accompaniments.

original: rnam pa bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa rnam par dag cing dri ma med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa rnam par dag cing dri ma med par rig par bya'o //
translated: These ten aspects should be understood as the purity and immaculateness of the bodhisattvas patience.

original: bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa la thug pa'i bzod pa rgya che zhing tshad med la byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu 'byung ba 'di dag la brten na byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
analyzed: bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa la thug pa'i bzod pa rgya che zhing tshad med la byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu 'byung ba 'di dag la brten na byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
translated: If the bodhisattva relies on this vast, immeasurable patience, which culminates in the pure patience of the essence of reality, and so on, he will attain the fruit of great enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva will fully awaken to highest genuine full Awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las bzod pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las bzod pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on patience, the eleventh of the Yoga of the Levels of the Bodhisattva.

original: // / sdom ni /
analyzed: // / sdom ni /
translated: The summary:

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as before.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of the bodhisattva’s effort?

original: dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa bsdu ba dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa bsdu ba dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the effort of bodhisattvas to gather immeasurable virtuous qualities and to work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems mngon par spro ba sbyangs pa bar chad med pa phyin ci ma log pa dang / de las byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi yongs su g-yo ba gang yin pa ste ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems mngon par spro ba sbyangs pa bar chad med pa phyin ci ma log pa dang / de las byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi yongs su g-yo ba gang yin pa ste ;
translated: It is the bodhisattva's delight in the thought of enlightenment, the unhampered, unerring cultivation of that thought, and the physical, verbal, and mental activity that results from it.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the essence of the bodhisattva's effort.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's effort in all respects?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, it should be understood as twofold:

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
translated: that based on the stage of the ordained bodhisattva, and that based on the stage of the lay bodhisattva.

original: phyogs gnyis la brten pa de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis la brten pa de yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: This twofold effort should be understood as threefold:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'o //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'o //
translated: the armor-like effort, the effort of application to wholesome dharmas, and the effort that works for the benefit of living beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'i brtson 'grus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'i brtson 'grus ni 'di yin te /
translated: Herein, the bodhisattva's armor-like effort is as follows:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa @107b la sbyor ba'i snga rol nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa @107b la sbyor ba'i snga rol nas /
translated: In this regard, bodhisattvas, before they apply themselves to the practice of striving,

original: sems kyi mngon par spro ba sngon du 'gro ba'i go cha 'di ltar gyon par byed de /
analyzed: sems kyi mngon par spro ba sngon du 'gro ba'i go cha 'di ltar gyon par byed de /
translated: put on this armor, preceded by mental enthusiasm:

original: bdag ni gal te sems can gcig sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir yang /🔽nyin mtshan bskal pa chen po stong dang mnyam pa dag gi 'gro ba gzhan du mi gnas par sems can dmyal ba kho nar gnas pas dus ji srid cig gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par
analyzed: bdag ni gal te sems can gcig sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir yang / nyin mtshan bskal pa chen po stong dang mnyam pa dag gi 'gro ba gzhan du mi gnas par sems can dmyal ba kho nar gnas pas dus ji srid cig gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par
translated: “Even if it were for the sake of liberating just one sentient being from suffering,🔽I would not hesitate to remain in the hells for as long as it would take bodhisattvas to attain unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment, even if that time were to be multiplied a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times.

original: rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i dus de nyid bye ba phrag 'bum 'gyur srid kyis bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lta na yang bdag spro bar byed de /
analyzed: rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i dus de nyid bye ba phrag 'bum 'gyur srid kyis bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba lta na yang bdag spro bar byed de /
translated: I would be enthusiastic even if I had to remain in the hells for as long as it would take bodhisattvas to attain unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment, even if that time were to be multiplied a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir mi brtson par mi byed la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir mi brtson par mi byed la /
translated: He does not fail to strive for unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus la zhugs pa la yang 'dor bar mi byed na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la zhugs pa la yang 'dor bar mi byed na /
translated: He does not abandon those who have entered the path of striving.🔽What need is there to mention a time of shorter duration and a suffering of shorter duration?

original: dus kyi yun ches thung ba dang / sdug bsngal ches thung bas lta la ci smos snyam pa de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'i brtson 'grus yin te /
analyzed: dus kyi yun ches thung ba dang / sdug bsngal ches thung bas lta la ci smos snyam pa de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'i brtson 'grus yin te /
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s armor-like striving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha'i brtson 'grus de lta bu la mos pa tsam dang / dang ba tsam skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de yang brtan po yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha'i brtson 'grus de lta bu la mos pa tsam dang / dang ba tsam skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de yang brtan po yin te /
translated: A bodhisattva who has merely aroused interest and faith in such armor-like striving of the bodhisattvas is steadfast.

original: byang chub kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dpag tu med pa'i rgyu yongs su brtas par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa dpag tu med pa'i rgyu yongs su brtas par byed pa yin na /
translated: He causes the cause of the immeasurable striving for enlightenment to flourish.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang go cha'i brtson 'grus de lta bu nyid dang ldan pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang go cha'i brtson 'grus de lta bu nyid dang ldan pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention a bodhisattva who is endowed with such armor-like striving?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la ni byang chub kyi don dang / sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir /🔽las gang la byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la ni byang chub kyi don dang / sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir / las gang la byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because of the goal of enlightenment and the goal of sentient beings.

original: dka' ba bya dgos pa'i bya dka' ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: dka' ba bya dgos pa'i bya dka' ba ci yang med do //
translated: There is no action whatsoever that is difficult to do for the bodhisattva,🔽because of the goal of enlightenment and the goal of sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /🔽brtson 'grus gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa dang / brtson 'grus gang shes rab kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na / brtson 'grus gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa dang / brtson 'grus gang shes rab kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' effort of accumulating virtuous qualities?

original: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the effort that is applied to the perfection of generosity in order to accomplish the perfection of generosity, and it is the effort that is applied to the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom in order to accomplish the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be known that in brief it is of seven types:

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / nyon mongs @108a * //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / nyon mongs @108a * //
translated: thoughts,🔽concepts, and afflictions.🔽

original: pa dang ; nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa thams cad kyis mi g-yos pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba dang / gus par sbyor ba can yin pa'i phyir brtan pa dang / rig pa'i gnas thams cad yang dag par 'grub par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang ; nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa thams cad kyis mi g-yos pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba dang / gus par sbyor ba can yin pa'i phyir brtan pa dang / rig pa'i gnas thams cad yang dag par 'grub par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa dang /
translated: It is unshakable because it is not moved by thoughts, discursive thoughts, afflictions, secondary afflictions, adversaries, or any harm from suffering. It is firm because it is applied with respect. It is immeasurable because it is the basis for accomplishing all the sciences.

original: thob par bya ba'i don gyi lam phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir thabs dang ldan pa dang / thob par bya ba'i don dang ldan pa thob par smon pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i don gyi lam phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir thabs dang ldan pa dang / thob par bya ba'i don dang ldan pa thob par smon pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus dang /
translated: It is skillful because it is endowed with the unmistaken path for attaining the goal and for understanding equality. It is right effort because it is the aspiration to attain the goal that is to be attained.

original: rtag tu sbyor ba can yin pa'i phyir rgyas pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa des mtho bar sems pa med pa'i phyir nga rgyal med pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba can yin pa'i phyir rgyas pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa des mtho bar sems pa med pa'i phyir nga rgyal med pa ste /
translated: It is extensive because it is always applied, and it is without pride because it does not think highly of itself for undertaking that effort.

original: rnam pa bdun po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par sbyor ba ni myur du pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par sbyor ba ni myur du pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: The bodhisattvas' application of effort to gather virtuous qualities through these seven aspects quickly brings the perfections to completion and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed do //
translated: causes them to attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos rnams de ltar yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo dang mchog ni brtson 'grus kho na yin gyi gzhan ni de ltar ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos rnams de ltar yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo dang mchog ni brtson 'grus kho na yin gyi gzhan ni de ltar ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since effort alone is the principal and supreme cause for the bodhisattvas' perfect accomplishment of virtuous qualities and not any other,

original: brtson 'grus ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan pas ston par mdzad do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan pas ston par mdzad do // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: and the Tathagatas have taught that effort is what causes the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tshul khrims kyi le'u las 'byung ba bzhin du rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi le'u las 'byung ba bzhin du rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The effort of bodhisattvas in working for the benefit of beings should be understood as elevenfold, as stated in the chapter on morality.

original: der tshul khrims zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de 'dir brtson 'grus zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: der tshul khrims zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de 'dir brtson 'grus zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Whatever was called morality there should be called effort here.

original: bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: bye brag ni de yod do //
translated: But there is a difference.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas difficult effort?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as threefold.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni gos kyi 'du shes dang / zas kyi 'du shes dang / mal cha dang / stan gyi 'du shes dang / bdag tu 'du shes kyang mi byed par dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni gos kyi 'du shes dang / zas kyi 'du shes dang / mal cha dang / stan gyi 'du shes dang / bdag tu 'du shes kyang mi byed par dge ba'i chos rnams sgom pa la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva does not have the notion of clothes, the notion of food, the notion of bedding and seats, or the notion of self, and is constantly and always engaged in cultivating wholesome states.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i brtson 'grus dang po'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i brtson 'grus dang po'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s first difficult effort.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni ris mthun pa ma dor gyi bar du dus thams cad du brtson 'grus @108b rtsom pa de lta bu des zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni ris mthun pa ma dor gyi bar du dus thams cad du brtson 'grus @108b rtsom pa de lta bu des zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva is engaged in this kind of effort at all times, until the end of the class affiliate.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i brtson 'grus gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i brtson 'grus gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s second difficult effort.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa /🔽ha cang zhum pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa / ha cang zhum pa yang ma yin /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva is endowed with the quality of understanding equality.🔽He is neither too slack

original: ha cang brtun ngas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ha cang brtun ngas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: nor too tense.

original: phyin ci ma log cing don dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log cing don dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is endowed with unerring and meaningful effort.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i brtson 'grus gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i brtson 'grus gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the third bodhisattva effort that is difficult to carry out.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i brtson 'grus 'di sdud pa'i rgyu ni stobs dang / sems can rnams la snying rje ba dang / shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i brtson 'grus 'di sdud pa'i rgyu ni stobs dang / sems can rnams la snying rje ba dang / shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cause for the bodhisattvas’ gathering of this difficult effort should be known as strength, compassion for sentient beings, and wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad kyi sgo nas brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad kyi sgo nas brtson 'grus gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ effort that is applied in every way?

original: 'di ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of four types:

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnam par sdong bar byed pa dang / dkar po'i chos sgrub par byed pa dang / las yongs su dag par byed pa dang / shes rab rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnam par sdong bar byed pa dang / dkar po'i chos sgrub par byed pa dang / las yongs su dag par byed pa dang / shes rab rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: that which prevents the occurrence of defiled entities, that which accomplishes virtuous entities, that which purifies karma, and that which increases wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnam par spong bar byed pa ni kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bar byed pa dang ;🔽skyes ba rnams spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnam par spong bar byed pa ni kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bar byed pa dang ; skyes ba rnams spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: bonds, latent tendencies, secondary afflictions, and entanglements that have not yet arisen, and the elimination of those that have arisen.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus dkar po'i chos sgrub par byed pa ni dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas par byed pa dang / mi nyams par byed pa dang / 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus dkar po'i chos sgrub par byed pa ni dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas par byed pa dang / mi nyams par byed pa dang / 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's effort that accomplishes virtuous things is the effort that gives rise to virtuous things that have not yet arisen, and the effort that causes those that have arisen to abide, not degenerate, and increase and expand.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus las yongs su dag par byed pa ni las rnam pa gsum po lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las dge ba rnam par dag par byed pa dang / sdud par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
