translated: In this context, the bodhisattva's effort that purifies action is the purification and accumulation of the three kinds of action: bodily action, vocal action, and mental action.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus shes pa rnam par 'phel bar byed pa ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i shes rab yang dag par 'grub pa dang / rnam par 'phel bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //

translated: In this context, the bodhisattva's effort that increases knowledge is the accomplishment and increase of the wisdom that comes from listening, reflection, and meditation.

analyzed: rgyun du sbyor ba'i phyir rtag pa'i brtson 'grus dang ; lhur sbyor ba'i phyir gus pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus dang / so sor brtags shing brtags shing dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i brtson 'grus dang /
translated: It is constant effort since it is applied continuously, respectful effort since it is applied with devotion, natural effort since it is generated by the power of previous causes, applied effort since it is applied to virtue after careful examination,

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs shing gzhan du bsgyur du med pa'i phyir mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / khyad par thob pa chung ngu dang / ngan don tsam gyis chog mi shes pa'i phyir chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa thams cad kyis mi 'khrugs shing gzhan du bsgyur du med pa'i phyir mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus dang / khyad par thob pa chung ngu dang / ngan don tsam gyis chog mi shes pa'i phyir chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: unperturbed effort since it is not perturbed by any harm caused by suffering and since it cannot be turned back, and insatiable effort since it is not satisfied with merely a small attainment or a mere meager attainment.

original: 'di ni re zhig rnam pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig rnam pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus rnam pa drug ste /

original: de dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spro ba dang ldan pa dang / brtun pa brtan pa dang / brtson pa mi gtong ba zhes bya'o //

translated: When he has it, the bodhisattva is said to have begun striving for good qualities, to have power, to have striving, to have enthusiasm, to have firm courage, and not to give up striving.🔽Seven aspects: the bodhisattva's striving is accompanied by will, because he increases more and more his aspiration and his vow to achieve supreme enlightenment.

original: rnam pa bdun ni phyi phyir zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu shas cher 'dun pa dang / smon pa rjes su 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus 'dun pa dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus gang gis byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i chos rnams la mthun zhing rnal 'byor du gnas par 'gyur la /

analyzed: nyon mongs @109b pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas sems nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur zhing /

original: sems kun nas dkris pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de spang ba'i phyir mgo la me 'bar ba gsod pa lta bu'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus khyad par can dang / rig pa'i gnas thams cad yongs su tshol ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus tshol ba dang /

translated: The bodhisattvas' striving for the necessities and for the desired goal, and their striving for happiness in this life and in the next should be understood as explained in the chapter on patience.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /

original: der bzod pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de 'dir brtson 'grus mngon par spro ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: der bzod pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de 'dir brtson 'grus mngon par spro ba zhes brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i brtson 'grus gang zhe na /

analyzed: snyoms pa dang / byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: appropriate, cultivated, not lax, well-directed, cultivated at the appropriate time, accompanied by the realization of the signs, not low-spirited, not over-exuberant, balanced, and dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang gang gis shin tu gnod par gyur pa'i nyes pa'i nyon mongs pa de dang de spang ba'i phyir 'tsham @110a * //🔽pa'i gnyen po bsten te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dang gang gis shin tu gnod par gyur pa'i nyes pa'i nyon mongs pa de dang de spang ba'i phyir 'tsham @110a * // pa'i gnyen po bsten te /
translated: Here, whatever the bodhisattva's proximate affliction is, whatever the fault that is most harmful, for the sake of abandoning that fault, he applies the appropriate antidote.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi sdug pa sgom pa dang / gnod sems kyi gnyen por byams pa dang / gti mug gi gnyen por rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgom pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por dbugs dbyung ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi sdug pa sgom pa dang / gnod sems kyi gnyen por byams pa dang / gti mug gi gnyen por rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgom pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por dbugs dbyung ba dang /
translated: For the antidote to desire is meditation on foulness, for the antidote to malice is meditation on love, for the antidote to delusion is meditation on the dependent origination of this and that, for the antidote to discursive thought is mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation,🔽for the antidote to pride is meditation on the classification of the elements, and so on.

original: rngub pa dran pa dang / nga rgyal gyi gnyen por khams rab tu dbye ba sgom pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'tsham pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //

translated: Such is called the bodhisattva's appropriate effort.

original: 'di lta ste gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa las thog ma pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is a beginner is not endowed with the first kind of effort, that of application.

original: sbyor ba goms pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sbyor ba goms pa yin zhing /
translated: He is one who is habituated to application.

original: sbyor ba 'dris pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i goms pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'dris pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i goms pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la sems gnas pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la sems gnas pa las brtsams te /

original: sbyor ba la goms pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: sbyor ba la goms pa ma yin zhing /
translated: He is one who is habituated to application.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa nyid yin bzhin du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa nyid yin bzhin du /
translated: He is a bodhisattva who is a beginner.

original: rtag tu gus par sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag tu gus par sbyor ba'i phyir /

original: sbyor ba de la mi g-yel bar sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba de la mi g-yel bar sbyor ba yin te /
translated: He is one who is not negligent in that application.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi g-yel ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //🔽yang byang chub sems dpa' bla ma rnams las sam /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi g-yel ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o // yang byang chub sems dpa' bla ma rnams las sam /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mang du thos pa'i stobs bskyed pas phyin ci ma log par zin pas sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva, whether from the gurus or through the power of his own extensive learning, has acquired the unerring understanding that is the basis of mental stability.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i legs par zin pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i legs par zin pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s correct practice of effort.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' de ltar phyin ci ma log par zin pas zhi gnas kyi dus su ni zhi gnas sgom la /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' de ltar phyin ci ma log par zin pas zhi gnas kyi dus su ni zhi gnas sgom la /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattva, having thus correctly understood, cultivates serenity at the time of serenity,

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus su ni sems rab tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus su ni sems rab tu 'dzin cing /
translated: and he controls his mind at the time of control,

original: btang snyoms kyi dus su ni btang snyoms sgom pa 'di ni de'i dus su brtson pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dus su ni btang snyoms sgom pa 'di ni de'i dus su brtson pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: and he cultivates equanimity at the time of equanimity. This is called the effort of his effort at the appropriate time.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rnams dang ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i mtshan ma rnams shes pa dang / mi brjed pa dang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma rnams dang ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i mtshan ma rnams shes pa dang / mi brjed pa dang /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattva knows the signs of serenity, control, and equanimity, and he knows the signs of entering concentration, of abiding in concentration, and of emerging from concentration.

original: rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu byed cing /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu byed cing /
translated: He is always mindful and aware in order to understand🔽and to emerge from concentration.

original: gus par byed pa 'di ni @110b byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan mar rtogs pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gus par byed pa 'di ni @110b byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan mar rtogs pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s striving that is realized as a sign.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus rtsom pa mchog tu rgya che zhing mchog tu zab la /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus rtsom pa mchog tu rgya che zhing mchog tu zab la /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattvas hear that the bodhisattvas’ striving is taught to be supreme, vast, supreme, profound,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab cing /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab cing /
translated: inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med pa dag bstan pa thos na /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa dag bstan pa thos na /
translated: and immeasurable,

original: bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod cing /
translated: they do not disparage themselves

original: sems zhum par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: sems zhum par yang mi byed la /
translated: and do not become discouraged.

original: khyad par thob pa chung ngu tsam dang / ngan don tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: khyad par thob pa chung ngu tsam dang / ngan don tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /
translated: They do not consider themselves satisfied with just a little progress and just a little good.🔽They do not stop striving for more.

original: gong du mi 'bad par mi byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhum pa med pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong du mi 'bad par mi byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhum pa med pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s striving that is without discouragement.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' dus dus su dbang po'i sgo rnams srung zhing ;
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' dus dus su dbang po'i sgo rnams srung zhing ;
translated: Moreover, from time to time the bodhisattvas guard the doors of their senses.

original: zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar rjes su brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs rnams yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar rjes su brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs rnams yang dag par blangs te /
translated: The bodhisattva takes up the requisites of samadhi, such as moderation in eating, being diligent in the first and last periods of the night, and remaining vigilant.

original: 'dug cing de rnams la brtson par yang byed cing phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang ldan pa thams cad la 'bad pa rtsom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi ldan pa med pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //🔽yang byang chub sems dpa' ha cang yang mi zhum /
analyzed: 'dug cing de rnams la brtson par yang byed cing phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang ldan pa thams cad la 'bad pa rtsom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi ldan pa med pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o // yang byang chub sems dpa' ha cang yang mi zhum /
translated: While sitting and striving in these, he initiates effort in all that is not contrary to the aim. This is called the bodhisattva's effort that is not lacking.🔽Moreover, the bodhisattva does not become too discouraged,

original: ha cang yang brtun mi ngas par brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: ha cang yang brtun mi ngas par brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: nor does he become too tense.

original: sbyor ba snyoms par byed cing /
analyzed: sbyor ba snyoms par byed cing /
translated: He applies himself with balanced application,

original: brtsam par bya ba thams cad la snyoms par gus par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i snyoms pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtsam par bya ba thams cad la snyoms par gus par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i snyoms pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: and he is respectful in all that he undertakes. This is called the bodhisattva's balanced effort.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus rtsom pa mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ste
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus rtsom pa mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ste
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattvas apply diligence, they dedicate all their activities to unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment. This is called the bodhisattvas’ correct dedication of diligence.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus /
translated: These are the bodhisattvas’ diligence.

original: brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid nas rnam par dag pa'i bar gyi brtson 'grus 'di dag ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid nas rnam par dag pa'i bar gyi brtson 'grus 'di dag ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ste /
translated: From the essence of diligence up to pure diligence, these kinds of diligence give rise to the result of great enlightenment.

original: de la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas te /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas te / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: On the basis of that, bodhisattvas complete the perfection of diligence🔽and fully awaken to unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will fully awaken to unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: One will become fully enlightened.🔽🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa'i @111a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i @111a * //
translated: and he will fully awaken to highest genuine full Awakening.

original: sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las brtson 'grus kyi le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las brtson 'grus kyi le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twelfth chapter, on effort, in this Ornament of Mahayana Sutras.

original: // / sdom ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: // / sdom ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The summary verse should be understood as before.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa dang / bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rtse gcig pa dge ba'i sems gnas pa zhi gnas kyi phyogs sam /🔽lhag mthong gi phyogs sam /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa dang / bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rtse gcig pa dge ba'i sems gnas pa zhi gnas kyi phyogs sam / lhag mthong gi phyogs sam /
translated: What is the essence of the bodhisattvas’ meditative absorption?

original: zung du 'brel par 'jug pa'i lam de gnyi ga'i phyogs gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zung du 'brel par 'jug pa'i lam de gnyi ga'i phyogs gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the bodhisattvas’ virtuous one-pointedness of mind, preceded by listening to and reflecting on the bodhisattva collection of scriptures, which is a state of mind that is mundane or transcendent, a state of mind that is calm abiding or insight or the path that is the union of the two.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the bodhisattvas’ meditative absorption.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' meditative absorption?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as twofold:

original: 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: And each of those should be understood as threefold:

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: meditative absorption that is a basis for the attainment of the bodhisattvas' superknowledges; meditative absorption that is a basis for the attainment of the bodhisattvas' masteries; and meditative absorption that is a basis for the attainment of the bodhisattvas' powers.🔽What is the bodhisattvas' meditative absorption that is a basis for the attainment of the bodhisattvas' superknowledges?🔽It should be understood as the meditative absorption that is the cause of the attainment of the five superknowledges.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba /🔽lus dang sems kyis shin tu sbyangs ba skyed pa /🔽mchog tu rab tu zhi ba /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba / lus dang sems kyis shin tu sbyangs ba skyed pa / mchog tu rab tu zhi ba /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' meditative absorption that is a basis for the attainment of the bodhisattvas' masteries?🔽It should be understood as the meditative absorption that is the cause of the attainment of the ten masteries.

original: rlom sems dang bral ba /
analyzed: rlom sems dang bral ba /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' meditative absorption that is a basis for the attainment of the bodhisattvas' powers?🔽It should be understood as the meditative absorption that is the cause of the attainment of the ten powers of the tathagatas.

original: ro myang ba med pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba gang yin pa 'di ni de dag gi tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba med pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba gang yin pa 'di ni de dag gi tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of relishing and the absence of all signs should be known as the bodhisattvas' ease in this life.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan stobs bcu'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing tshad med pa sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang dag nyan thos dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan stobs bcu'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing tshad med pa sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang dag nyan thos dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas' meditative concentration is included in the family of the ten powers and it accomplishes the various kinds of concentration that are inconceivable and immeasurable.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ming yang mi shes na snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis non pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ming yang mi shes na snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis non pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas' meditative concentration is not shared with the disciples and solitary realizers, and the disciples and solitary realizers do not even know the names of those concentrations, let alone enter them.🔽The bodhisattvas' meditative concentration is the concentration that is the door of liberation of emptiness, the concentration that is the door of liberation of signlessness, and the concentration that is the door of liberation of wishlessness.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon gnas shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan nyan thos dang / @111b thun mong pa rnams mngon par sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon gnas shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan nyan thos dang / @111b thun mong pa rnams mngon par sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The concentration of bodhisattvas that accomplishes the qualities of meditative concentration, such as the superknowledges, the liberations, the totalities, the masteries, the supernormal powers, the fearlessnesses, the absence of confusion, the knowledge of the aspiration, and so forth, which are not shared in common with the disciples, should be understood as the bodhisattvas accomplishment of the qualities of meditative concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas concentration for the benefit of living beings is elevenfold.

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as above.

original: bsam gtan gang la brten na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gang la brten na /
translated: In dependence on which meditative concentration?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi bya ba don dang ldan pa dag la grogs su 'gro ba dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / rigs par ston pa dang / byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi bya ba don dang ldan pa dag la grogs su 'gro ba dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / rigs par ston pa dang / byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva becomes a companion to beings in their meaningful activities, removes the suffering of suffering beings, teaches the Dharma appropriately, and is grateful and appreciative.

original: phan 'dogs pa rnams la lan du phan 'dogs pa dang / 'jigs pa rnams las srung ba dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams kyi mya ngan sel ba dang / yo byad med pa rnams la yo byad stobs pa dang / yang dag pa'i 'khor legs par sdud pa dang /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa rnams la lan du phan 'dogs pa dang / 'jigs pa rnams las srung ba dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams kyi mya ngan sel ba dang / yo byad med pa rnams la yo byad stobs pa dang / yang dag pa'i 'khor legs par sdud pa dang /
translated: It is to repay the kindness of those who have helped one. It is to protect those who are afraid. It is to dispel the sorrow of those who are suffering. It is to give provisions to those who lack them. It is to gather a perfect retinue.

original: sems dang mthun par 'jug pa dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan rnams kyis dga' bar byed pa dang / legs par tshar gcod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis skrag par byed pa dang / 'dun par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang mthun par 'jug pa dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan rnams kyis dga' bar byed pa dang / legs par tshar gcod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis skrag par byed pa dang / 'dun par byed pa ste /
translated: It is to act in accord with the minds of others. It is to delight in perfect qualities. It is to be a perfect adversary. It is to frighten with miracles. It is to inspire.

original: 'di dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan thams cad ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan thams cad ces bya ste /
translated: All of these are included in what is called the bodhisattvas’ concentration.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to this.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ difficult concentration?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as threefold.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan la gnas pa mngon par sgrub pa rgya chen po rnam pa sna tshogs shin tu 'dres pa dag gis gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan la gnas pa mngon par sgrub pa rgya chen po rnam pa sna tshogs shin tu 'dres pa dag gis gnas nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having remained in the various extensive and very complex accomplishments of meditative concentration,

original: rang dgar bsam gtan gyi bde ba mchog de bzlog ste /
analyzed: rang dgar bsam gtan gyi bde ba mchog de bzlog ste /
translated: turn away from that supreme bliss of meditative concentration which they could enjoy for themselves.

original: so sor brtags nas ;
analyzed: so sor brtags nas ;
translated: Having examined it,

original: sems can rnams la snying brtse bas sems can gyi don bya ba mang po dag dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yang dag par mthong nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying brtse bas sems can gyi don bya ba mang po dag dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yang dag par mthong nas /
translated: they see the many benefits for sentient beings and the full maturation of sentient beings that come from compassion for sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa'i khams rnams su skye bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i bsam gtan dang po yin par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams rnams su skye bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i bsam gtan dang po yin par rig par bya'o//
translated: So they take birth in the desire realm. This should be known as the bodhisattvas’ first difficult meditative concentration.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas, on the basis of meditative concentration,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan dpag tu med grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa 'di ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i @112a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan dpag tu med grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i @112a * //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ meditative concentration is immeasurable, innumerable, and inconceivable. It is accomplished by transcending all the domains of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽This should be known as the bodhisattvas’

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: second difficult meditative concentration.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas, on the basis of meditative concentration,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽This should be known as the bodhisattvas’

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i bsam gtan gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i bsam gtan gsum pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: third difficult meditative concentration.

original: de la thams cad kyi sgo nas bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thams cad kyi sgo nas bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is meditative concentration in all aspects?

original: rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as having four aspects.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / tshim pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / tshim pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is associated with investigation and sustained thought, it is associated with joy, it is associated with happiness, and it is associated with equanimity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu dam pa'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu dam pa'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ meditation of the holy person?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as fivefold:

original: ro myang ba med pa dang / byams pa dang ldan pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba med pa dang / byams pa dang ldan pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'o //
translated: without relishing, associated with loving kindness, associated with compassion, associated with joy, and associated with equanimity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ meditation of all aspects?

original: de ni rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is sevenfold and sixfold,

original: gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bcu gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bcu gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: and altogether it should be known as thirteenfold.

original: dge ba'i bsam gtan dang / sprul pa sprul pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i bsam gtan dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag ma thong gi phyogs dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don legs par nges par bsam pa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa'i mthu yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam gtan dang / sprul pa sprul pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i bsam gtan dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag ma thong gi phyogs dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don legs par nges par bsam pa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa'i mthu yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: concentration of virtue, concentration of neutral states in order to emanate emanations, concentration of the serenity side, concentration of the insight side, concentration of the excellent ascertainment of the aims of self and other, concentration of the accomplishment of the qualities and powers of preternatural knowledge,

original: ming la dmigs pa dang / don la dmigs pa dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: ming la dmigs pa dang / don la dmigs pa dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang /
translated: concentration focused on names, concentration focused on meanings, concentration focused on the signs of serenity, concentration focused on the signs of complete discernment, concentration focused on the signs of equanimity, concentration for the sake of abiding in comfort in this life,

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan te /
translated: and concentration for the sake of benefiting others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan rnam pa bcu gsum po 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad kyi bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan rnam pa bcu gsum po 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad kyi bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: These thirteen kinds of concentration of bodhisattvas are called the concentration of all aspects.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i phongs shing 'dod pa'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i phongs shing 'dod pa'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s meditative absorption that is dedicated to the alleviation of poverty?

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of eight types:

original: dug dang / thog dang / rims drag po dang / 'byung po dang / gdon la sogs pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi ba sgrub pa'i gsang sngags rnams byin gyis rlob pa'i bsam gtan dang / khams 'khrugs pa las gyur @112b pa'i nad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par zhi bar byed pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: dug dang / thog dang / rims drag po dang / 'byung po dang / gdon la sogs pa'i gnod pa yang dag par zhi ba sgrub pa'i gsang sngags rnams byin gyis rlob pa'i bsam gtan dang / khams 'khrugs pa las gyur @112b pa'i nad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par zhi bar byed pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: meditative absorption that blesses the mantras that accomplish the pacification of harm from poison, lightning, severe contagious diseases, elemental spirits, and evil spirits, and so on; meditative absorption that completely pacifies the various kinds of illnesses that arise from an imbalance of the body’s elements;

original: mu ge'i ngu 'bod chen po dag 'byung ba'i tshe char sgrub par byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i 'jigs pa sna tshogs chu dang skam la yod pa rnams las legs par yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: mu ge'i ngu 'bod chen po dag 'byung ba'i tshe char sgrub par byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i 'jigs pa sna tshogs chu dang skam la yod pa rnams las legs par yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: meditative absorption that brings rain when there is a great famine; meditative absorption that completely protects from the various kinds of dangers that humans and non-humans create, whether on dry land or in the water;

original: de bzhin du 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa zas dang / skom gyis phongs pa rnams la zas dang skom nye bar sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / dbul ba longs spyod med pa rnams kyi longs spyod nye bar sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / phyogs bcu dag na sems can bag med pa rnams la legs par bskul ba'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa zas dang / skom gyis phongs pa rnams la zas dang skom nye bar sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / dbul ba longs spyod med pa rnams kyi longs spyod nye bar sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / phyogs bcu dag na sems can bag med pa rnams la legs par bskul ba'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: Similarly, there is the concentration of providing food and drink to those who are destitute of food and drink and who live in isolated, uninhabited regions; the concentration of providing wealth to the poor; the concentration of properly encouraging those who are heedless among all sentient beings in the ten directions;

original: sems can gyi bya ba byung ngo cog legs par bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: sems can gyi bya ba byung ngo cog legs par bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: and the concentration of properly accomplishing all the activities of sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ concentration that brings happiness here and in the next world?

original: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of nine types.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams gdul ba'i bsam gtan dang ; kun rjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams gdul ba'i bsam gtan dang / sdig pa byed pa rnams la ngan song gis rnams par ston pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams gdul ba'i bsam gtan dang ; kun rjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams gdul ba'i bsam gtan dang / sdig pa byed pa rnams la ngan song gis rnams par ston pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: concentration for the magical emanation of miracles in order to guide sentient beings, concentration for the magical emanation of teaching and instruction in order to guide sentient beings, concentration for revealing the lower realms to those who engage in negative actions,

original: sems can spobs pa med par gyur pa rnams la spobs pa nye bar sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can brjed ngas pa rnams la dran pa nye bar sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i bstan bcos dang /
analyzed: sems can spobs pa med par gyur pa rnams la spobs pa nye bar sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can brjed ngas pa rnams la dran pa nye bar sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i bstan bcos dang /

original: snyan dngags dang / ma mo sbyar ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i bsam gtan dang / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bzo dang las kyi gnas don dang ldan pa sems can rnams la phan pa rnams dang / yi ge dang rtsis dang shod dgod pa dang grangs dang lag rtsis la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: snyan dngags dang / ma mo sbyar ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i bsam gtan dang / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bzo dang las kyi gnas don dang ldan pa sems can rnams la phan pa rnams dang / yi ge dang rtsis dang shod dgod pa dang grangs dang lag rtsis la sogs pa dang /
translated: the concentration of poetic composition and the composition of mantras; the concentration of worldly crafts and occupations that are meaningful and helpful to sentient beings, such as writing, mathematics, accounting, sculpting,

original: khri dang khri'u dang / gdugs dang / lham la sogs pa dang / snod spyad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa mang po rnams 'byung bar byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can ngan song gi sar skyes pa rnams kyi ngan song gi sdug bsngal de'i mod la bsal ba'i phyir 'od zer 'gyed pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: khri dang khri'u dang / gdugs dang / lham la sogs pa dang / snod spyad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa mang po rnams 'byung bar byed pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can ngan song gi sar skyes pa rnams kyi ngan song gi sdug bsngal de'i mod la bsal ba'i phyir 'od zer 'gyed pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: the concentration that creates thrones, seats, parasols, shoes, and various other types of vessels; and the concentration that emits light rays in order to immediately dispel the suffering of unfortunate realms of sentient beings who have been born in the lower realms.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s pure concentration?

original: de ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of ten types:

original: 'jig rten @113a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten @113a * //
translated: the worldly,

original: pa'i dag pas rnam par dag ba ro myang ba med pa'i bsam gtan dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dag pas rnam par dag pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bsam gtan dang / sbyor ba'i dag pas dag pa dang / dngos gzhi dag pas dag pa dang /
analyzed: pa'i dag pas rnam par dag ba ro myang ba med pa'i bsam gtan dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dag pas rnam par dag pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bsam gtan dang / sbyor ba'i dag pas dag pa dang / dngos gzhi dag pas dag pa dang /
translated: The concentration of purity by means of the actual basis.🔽The concentration of purity by means of the special higher stages than the actual basis.🔽The concentration of purity by means of the purity of mastery in entering, abiding and rising from concentration.

original: dngos gzhi las khyad par gong ma rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba la dbang ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan bzlog na yang snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang ;
analyzed: dngos gzhi las khyad par gong ma rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba la dbang ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan bzlog na yang snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang ;
translated: The concentration of purity by means of the purity of mastery in entering meditative attainment even when reversing from concentration.

original: mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul pa la dbang ba dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang bral ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul pa la dbang ba dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang bral ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The concentration of purification by the purification of mastery over the magical emanations of the superknowledges, the concentration of purification by the purification of freedom from all views, and the concentration of purification by the purification of the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan dpag tu med pa 'di dag ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan dpag tu med pa 'di dag ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
translated: These are the bodhisattvas’ immeasurable concentrations, which have the result of great enlightenment.

original: de dag la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs nas /
translated: In dependence on them, bodhisattvas complete the perfection of concentration

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: and manifestly, perfectly, and completely awaken to unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: They will manifestly, perfectly, and completely awaken to unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.🔽They manifestly, perfectly, and completely awaken to unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las bsam gtan gyi le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las bsam gtan gyi le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the thirteenth chapter, on concentration, in this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.

original: // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: This concludes the thirteenth chapter, on concentration, in this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of the Noble Land.

original: sdom ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdom ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The summary is to be understood as before.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of a bodhisattva’s wisdom?

original: shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa dang / shes bya thams cad la zhugs pa dang / chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga po nang gi rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa dang / shes bya thams cad la zhugs pa dang / chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga po nang gi rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang /
translated: It is the engagement with all that is to be known, the engagement in all that is to be known, the discernment of phenomena, and the engagement in the five sciences—the inner science, the science of logic,

original: gso ba'i rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa la dmigs nas 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gso ba'i rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / bzo dang las kyi gnas kyi rig pa la dmigs nas 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the science of grammar, the science of crafts and occupations, and the science of healing—that is the essence of a bodhisattva’s wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab @113b thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab @113b thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What is the entirety of a bodhisattva’s wisdom?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in two ways:

original: 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: And this should be understood in brief as threefold:

original: shes bya la de kho na khong du chud cing rtogs par bya ba dang / ji skad bstan pa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga po rnams dang / tshogs gsum la mkhas par bya ba dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya la de kho na khong du chud cing rtogs par bya ba dang / ji skad bstan pa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga po rnams dang / tshogs gsum la mkhas par bya ba dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'o //
translated: understanding and realizing reality in regard to the knowable, becoming skilled in the five sciences as they have been taught, and working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab gang chos bdag med pa brjod du med pa las brtsams te /🔽bden pa rtogs par bya ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab gang chos bdag med pa brjod du med pa las brtsams te / bden pa rtogs par bya ba'am /
translated: The wisdom of bodhisattvas is that which, beginning with the inexpressible no self of phenomena,🔽realizes the truth,

original: bden pa rtogs pa'i dus sam /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pa'i dus sam /
translated: or is the time of realizing the truth,🔽or is the state of having realized the truth,

original: bden pa mngon par yang dag par rtogs pa yan chad mchog tu rab tu zhi bar nye bar gnas pa /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par yang dag par rtogs pa yan chad mchog tu rab tu zhi bar nye bar gnas pa /
translated: it is the state of supreme peace,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: nonconceptual, free from all conceptual elaborations,

original: chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba /
translated: and it is the state of having gone to the sameness of all phenomena.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid chen po la zhugs pa /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid chen po la zhugs pa /
translated: It is the entry into the universal characteristics.

original: shes bya'i mthar phyin pa /
analyzed: shes bya'i mthar phyin pa /
translated: It is the culmination of knowledge.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the path of the middle way, because it abandons the two extremes of imputation and negation.

original: dbu ma'i lam du 'gro ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de kho na khong du chud cing rtogs pa'i shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam du 'gro ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de kho na khong du chud cing rtogs pa'i shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas' wisdom which is the understanding and realization of reality.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa ni rgyas par snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: Skill in the five sciences is to be understood in detail as above,

original: stobs kyi rigs kyi le'u las 'byung ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi rigs kyi le'u las 'byung ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: as it occurs in the chapter on the family of power.

original: tshogs gsum ni don dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs dang don dang mi ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs dang don dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: tshogs gsum ni don dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs dang don dang mi ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs dang don dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs te /
translated: The three collections are the collection of teachings that have meaning, the collection of teachings that do not have meaning, and the collection of teachings that are neither meaningful nor meaningless.

original: gnas brgyad po 'di dag la shes rab kyis mkhas pa yongs su 'dzin na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs chen po gong na med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: gnas brgyad po 'di dag la shes rab kyis mkhas pa yongs su 'dzin na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs chen po gong na med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: When one holds the wisdom that is skilled in these eight topics, one completes the great, unsurpassed, and perfect accumulation of wisdom for the sake of perfect enlightenment.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rnam pa bcu gcig kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rnam pa bcu gcig kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: The benefit of sentient beings should be understood as being the same elevenfold as before.

original: gnas de dag gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de dag gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is present in these topics should be understood as the wisdom that benefits sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' wisdom that is difficult to carry out?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being threefold.

original: chos bdag med pa zab mo shes par dka' ba dang / sems can rnams 'dul ba'i thabs shes par dka' ba dang / shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med par shes pa mchog tu @114a * //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa zab mo shes par dka' ba dang / sems can rnams 'dul ba'i thabs shes par dka' ba dang / shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med par shes pa mchog tu @114a * //
translated: It is the wisdom that is difficult to know, such as the profound selflessness of phenomena; it is the wisdom that is difficult to know, such as the means of training sentient beings; and it is the wisdom that is difficult to know, such as the unobstructed knowledge of all objects of knowledge.

original: dka' ba'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad kyi sgo nas shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: dka' ba'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad kyi sgo nas shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's wisdom in all its forms?

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /🔽nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las brtsams te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste / nyan thos kyi sde snod dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las brtsams te /
translated: It should be regarded as being of four kinds:🔽that which comes from listening and that which comes from reflection, based on the scriptural collections of the disciples and the bodhisattvas;

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / so sor brtags nas byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba la 'jug pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / so sor brtags nas byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba la 'jug pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: that which comes from the power of discernment, in that it engages in the bodhisattva activities and turns away from what should not be done;

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i shes rab tshad med pa'o//
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i shes rab tshad med pa'o//
translated: and that which comes from the power of meditation, the immeasurable wisdom of the stage of meditative equipoise.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi skyes bu dam pa'i shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi skyes bu dam pa'i shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's wisdom of a holy being among beings?

original: de ni ram pa sngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni ram pa sngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of four kinds:

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pas yang dag par thob pa dang / so sor nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i thabs dang ldan pa dang ; chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa'i chos rnam par gnas pa phyin ci ma log pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pas yang dag par thob pa dang / so sor nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i thabs dang ldan pa dang ; chos rnams kyi chos gnas pa'i chos rnam par gnas pa phyin ci ma log pa las brtsams te /
translated: The wisdom of ascertaining the extremely pure is the wisdom that begins with the unerring establishment of the nature of phenomena and the establishment of phenomena in their variety.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab pa'i shes rab dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par spong ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la dbab pa'i shes rab dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par spong ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom of eliminating afflictions is the wisdom that eliminates the afflictions.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang shes bya ji lta bar yod pa bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir cha phra ba dang / shes bya ji snyed yod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir mkhas pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs sngar yang dag par thob pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa dang /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang shes bya ji lta bar yod pa bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir cha phra ba dang / shes bya ji snyed yod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir mkhas pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs sngar yang dag par thob pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa dang /
translated: Another explanation is that it is subtle because it engages in the way things exist, it is skilled because it engages in the extent of knowable objects, it is innate because it has previously attained the accumulation of wisdom and it is the wisdom of the noble ones because it is the wisdom of the noble ones of the great vehicle.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang dag par bstan pa'i chos dang don len cing 'dzin pa'i phyir lung dang ldan pa dang / bsam pa dag pa'i sa yan chad mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa man chad yongs su bzung ba'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang dag par bstan pa'i chos dang don len cing 'dzin pa'i phyir lung dang ldan pa dang / bsam pa dag pa'i sa yan chad mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa man chad yongs su bzung ba'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is scriptural because it takes up and holds the Dharma and its meaning as taught by the Buddhas and the bodhisattvas who have entered the great stages. It is realized because it is taken up from the stage of pure thought up to the final stage.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's wisdom of all aspects?

original: de ni rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is sixfold and sevenfold.

original: gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bcu gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bcu gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: In sum, it should be understood as thirteenfold.

original: bden pa rnams la sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / mthar thug pa zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa 'di ni shes rab rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / mthar thug pa zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa 'di ni shes rab rnam pa drug go //
translated: The six aspects of wisdom are: the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin, the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of destruction, and the knowledge of nonproduction with regard to the truths.

original: rnam pa bdun ni chos shes @114b pa dang ; rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa shes pa dang / mtshan shes pa dang / stobs bcu sngon du 'gro ba'i shes pa dang / rig pa bzhi po dag la rig pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun ni chos shes @114b pa dang ; rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa shes pa dang / mtshan shes pa dang / stobs bcu sngon du 'gro ba'i shes pa dang / rig pa bzhi po dag la rig pa shes pa'o //
translated: The seven aspects are: knowledge of phenomena, knowledge of subsequent realization, knowledge of the conventional, knowledge of the superknowledges, knowledge of the characteristics, knowledge of the ten powers, and knowledge of the four analytical knowledges.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' phongs shing 'dod pa'i shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' phongs shing 'dod pa'i shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s wisdom of need and desire?

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as eightfold:

original: chos rnams kyi rnam grangs shes pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam grangs shes pa las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the knowledge of the categories of phenomena,🔽it is the bodhisattva’s analytical knowledge of phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid shes pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid shes pa las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the knowledge of the characteristics of phenomena,🔽it is the analytical knowledge of meanings.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig shis pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig shis pa las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the knowledge of the etymological definitions of phenomena,🔽it is the analytical knowledge of explanation.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos rnams kyi rnam pa'i gzhi'i rab tu dbye ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos rnams kyi rnam pa'i gzhi'i rab tu dbye ba las brtsams te /
translated: the analytical knowledge of the meaning, the analytical knowledge of the teaching, the analytical knowledge of the expressions, and the analytical knowledge of inspired speech.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang / bdag gi smra ba rnam par gzhag pa thams cad rnam par 'jog pa'i shes rab dang / khyim brgyud legs par bskyang ba dang /
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab dang / bdag gi smra ba rnam par gzhag pa thams cad rnam par 'jog pa'i shes rab dang / khyim brgyud legs par bskyang ba dang /
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattva is the wisdom that defeats all adversaries, the wisdom that establishes all the principles of one’s own teaching, the wisdom that protects the family lineage well, and the wisdom that prospers the family economically.

original: khyim 'byor bar bya ba'i shes rab dang / rgyal po'i tshul dang / 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi tshul rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: khyim 'byor bar bya ba'i shes rab dang / rgyal po'i tshul dang / 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi tshul rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattva is the wisdom that is skilled in the methods of kingship and in worldly conventions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s wisdom that brings happiness here and in the next world?

original: de ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known as being of nine types.

original: nang gi rig pa la shin tu rnam par byang zhing rab tu gnas pa'i shes rab dang / gso ba'i rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas kyi rig pa la ni shin tu rnam par byang la /
analyzed: nang gi rig pa la shin tu rnam par byang zhing rab tu gnas pa'i shes rab dang / gso ba'i rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas kyi rig pa la ni shin tu rnam par byang la /
translated: It is the wisdom that is very pure and well-established in the inner sciences, and the wisdom that is very pure in the sciences of medicine, logic, grammar, worldly crafts and occupations, but not well-established.

original: rab tu gnas pa ni ma yin pa'i shes rab dang / rig pa rnam pa lnga po shin tu rnam par byang ba de dag nyid la brten nas /🔽gdul ba rmongs pa rnams dang / bag med pa rnams dang / zhum pa rnams dang / yar dag par zhugs pa gzhan dag la go rims bzhin du yang dag par bstan pa dang ; yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa ni ma yin pa'i shes rab dang / rig pa rnam pa lnga po shin tu rnam par byang ba de dag nyid la brten nas / gdul ba rmongs pa rnams dang / bag med pa rnams dang / zhum pa rnams dang / yar dag par zhugs pa gzhan dag la go rims bzhin du yang dag par bstan pa dang ; yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang /
translated: Based on those five kinds of very pure sciences,

original: yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab gang yin pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattva's wisdom is the teaching, the taking up, the encouragement, and the delight of others who are to be trained, who are confused, who are heedless, and who are well-established, respectively.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pure wisdom of the bodhisattvas?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as being of ten kinds:🔽In order to apprehend the two kinds of meaning of reality, namely, the way things are and the multiplicity of things,

original: @115a * // de kho na'i don ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pa bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir de kho na'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu legs par 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @115a * // de kho na'i don ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pa bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir de kho na'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu legs par 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to apprehend the two kinds of causal and resultant meanings,🔽In order to know correctly the two kinds of meanings to be adopted, namely, the erroneous and the nonerroneous,🔽In order to know correctly the two kinds of meanings to be rejected, namely, what is to be done and what is not to be done,🔽In order to know correctly the two kinds of meanings to be understood, namely, the meaning of the words and the meaning of the truth,

original: 'jug pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir len pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir thabs kyi don rnam pa gnyis dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir len pa'i don rnam pa gnyis dang / bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir thabs kyi don rnam pa gnyis dang /
translated: In order to know correctly the two kinds of meanings to be cultivated, namely, the meaning of the training and the meaning of the result of training,🔽In order to know correctly the two kinds of meanings to be purified, namely, the meaning of the obscurations and the meaning of the purification from those,🔽In order to know correctly the two kinds of meanings to be directly realized, namely, the meaning of the path and the meaning of the result of the path.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la rnam par byang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir mthar thug pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la rnam par byang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir mthar thug pa'i don kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The ultimate meaning is also twofold, because of the thorough knowledge of the thoroughly afflicted as the thoroughly afflicted and of the completely purified as the completely purified.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab rnam pa lnga po rab tu dbye ba bcu po 'di dag ni rnam par dag pa mchog gis rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab rnam pa lnga po rab tu dbye ba bcu po 'di dag ni rnam par dag pa mchog gis rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: These ten categories of the five kinds of wisdom of the bodhisattvas should be understood as the most pure of all, because of their supreme purity.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab shin tu rnam par nges shing dpag tu med pa'i 'di ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab shin tu rnam par nges shing dpag tu med pa'i 'di ni byang chub chen po'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Thus, the wisdom of the bodhisattvas, which is very certain and immeasurable, is the result of great enlightenment.

original: de la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: de la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: On the basis of that, the bodhisattvas perfect the transcendence of wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di ni mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag thor bu thor bu bstan pa rnams kyi mdor bsdus te bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag thor bu thor bu bstan pa rnams kyi mdor bsdus te bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the concise teaching of the scattered teachings of the six perfections by the Lord in this and that sutra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde gang las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde gang las sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'am /
translated: In whatever sutra the Tathagata taught the perfection of giving,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag bstan pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag bstan pa'am /
translated: or taught up to the perfection of wisdom,

original: bshad pa 'byung ba de ni sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid nas /
analyzed: bshad pa 'byung ba de ni sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid nas /
translated: that should be applied from the nature of giving

original: rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa'i bar du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: up to the pure giving.

original: de'i bsdu ba yang ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bsdu ba yang ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: And its summary should be applied as appropriate.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa shes rab la thugs pa ji skad bstan pa gzhan dag gi sbyar ba dang bsdu ba yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa shes rab la thugs pa ji skad bstan pa gzhan dag gi sbyar ba dang bsdu ba yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the application and summary of the other teachings, from morality up to wisdom, should be understood as appropriate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dag tu skyes pa'i rabs dpag tu med pa dka' ba spyod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad las sbyin pa dang ldan pa rnams ni sbyin pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dag tu skyes pa'i rabs dpag tu med pa dka' ba spyod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad las sbyin pa dang ldan pa rnams ni sbyin pa las brtsams par rig par bya'o
translated: In all the innumerable Jataka tales of the Bodhisattvas, the Tathagatas, in which they performed difficult deeds, all those associated with generosity should be understood as beginning with generosity.

original: // sbyin pa ji lta ba de @115b bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang ldan pa thams cad kyang shes rab las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: // sbyin pa ji lta ba de @115b bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang ldan pa thams cad kyang shes rab las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with generosity, all those associated with morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom should be understood as beginning with wisdom.

original: kha cig ni sbyin pa kho na las brtsams pa nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni sbyin pa kho na las brtsams pa nas /
translated: Some begin with generosity,

original: kha cig ni shes rab kho na las brtsams pa'i bar dang / kha cig ni gnyis 'dres pa dang / kha cig ni gsum 'dres pa dang / kha cig ni bzhi 'dres pa dang / kha cig ni lnga 'dres pa dang / kha cig ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni shes rab kho na las brtsams pa'i bar dang / kha cig ni gnyis 'dres pa dang / kha cig ni gsum 'dres pa dang / kha cig ni bzhi 'dres pa dang / kha cig ni lnga 'dres pa dang / kha cig ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: Some are known to be based on just one perfection, some on two perfections, some on three perfections, some on four perfections, some on five perfections, and some on all six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par thob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dkar po'i chos kyi chu chen po dang / dkar po'i chos kyi rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par thob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dkar po'i chos kyi chu chen po dang / dkar po'i chos kyi rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by means of these six perfections are called the great river of virtuous qualities and the great ocean of virtuous qualities.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu rin po che chen po sbyin pa yin no //

translated: Here, bodhisattvas speak words that are pleasing, true, in accord with the Dharma, and meaningful to sentient beings. In brief, this is the essence of pleasant speech for bodhisattvas.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snyen par smra ba thams cad gang zhe na /

translated: or who speaks in such a way as to

translated: The words of a bodhisattva are also those that bring joy, when a bodhisattva sees that some beings have not realized their own good fortune and he or she tells them about it and brings them joy, whether it is the good fortune of a son,🔽a wife,

analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa nye bar gnas pa dang / phan pa'i mchog gis phan 'dogs par gyur pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stan par smra ba rab tu dbye bas thams cad yin par rig par bya'o //

translated: The agreeable speech of the bodhisattvas should be understood as twofold:🔽that which is in accord with the ways of the world and that which is in accord with the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /

original: byang chub sems dpa' gsod pa'i dgra phyir rgol ba rnams la shin tu rnam par dag cing skyon med pa'i sems kyis so sor brtags nas yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'am /

original: kun tu dga' bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: kun tu dga' bar byed pa'am /

original: phan par bya ba'i tshig brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i snyan par smra ba dang po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan par bya ba'i tshig brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba'i snyan par smra ba dang po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the first type of difficult agreeable speech of the bodhisattva that should be known.

analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can shes cher rmongs shing dbang po rtul ba rnams @116b la so sor brtags nas /
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva, having examined those sentient beings who are very confused and have dull faculties,

analyzed: chos dang mthun pa'i gtam brjod cing skyob dang du blangs te /

analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can g-yon can dang sgyu ma mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / yon gnas slu bar byed pa /
