translated: The third kind of difficult agreeable speech on the part of bodhisattvas should be understood as the speech that is agreeable to those who are not agreeable, that is, to those who are hostile, without any ill will or anger, and that is the speech that is agreeable to those who are already agreeable, that is, to those who are friendly, with a mind of loving kindness and compassion.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad kyi sgo nas snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad kyi sgo nas snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the agreeable speech of bodhisattvas in all its forms?

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /

translated: It is the teaching of the Dharma that is to be practiced first in order to eliminate obscurations and to be reborn in the happy destinies. translated: to take up heedful conduct. He teaches the Dharma to remove their doubts and to resolve their questions.🔽What is the bodhisattvas' and noble persons' agreeable speech that is

translated: It should be regarded as fivefold:🔽Here the bodhisattvas, whether bodhisattvas or Tathagatas, teach the🔽Dharma with a basis, with an escape, with a teacher, with a challenge,

analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi chos nges par 'byung @117a * // ba dang bcas pa yin no //

analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi chos cho 'phrul dang bcas pa yin no //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /

translated: Agreeable speech is the agreeable speech that permits in regard to the things that are permitted, the agreeable speech that forbids in regard to the things that are forbidden, the agreeable speech that expresses the enumeration of the teachings, the agreeable speech that expresses the undisorted characteristics of the teachings, the agreeable speech that expresses the undisorted order of the teachings, and the agreeable speech that expresses the undisorted manner of the teachings.

translated: It is to speak pleasantly by teaching the Dharma in a way that is free of the perversions of the Dharma’s definitions and etymologies. original: 'jigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis skrag pa rnams dbugs dbyung ba'i snyan par smra ba dang / rigs pa bstan pas bsdus pa'i snyan par smra ba dang / mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis skrag pa rnams dbugs dbyung ba'i snyan par smra ba dang / rigs pa bstan pas bsdus pa'i snyan par smra ba dang / mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
translated: It is to speak pleasantly by teaching the Dharma in a way that is extensive, in order to comfort those who are frightened by various kinds of dangers. It is to speak pleasantly by teaching the Dharma in a way that is extensive, in order to lift beings out of nonvirtue and establish them in virtue.

original: dge ba'i gnas su dgod pa'i phyir legs par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa la gleng zhing smra dbab pa'i snyan par smra ba dang / gzhan nus pa la bcol te sgrub pa'i snyan par smra ba ste /

translated: It is pleasant speech that is well seen, heard, and suspected, and that is pleasant speech that is spoken and uttered in order to establish others in virtue.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi snyan par smra ba rnam pa bcu gsum yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi snyan par smra ba rnam pa bcu gsum yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be known as the thirteen kinds of pleasant speech of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phongs shing 'dod pa'i snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phongs shing 'dod pa'i snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' pleasant speech that is desired and sought?

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of eight kinds.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi la brten @117b nas ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi la brten @117b nas ;
translated: It is the speech of the bodhisattvas that is based on the four kinds of pure speech of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'phags pa'i tha snyad brgyad po dag gi ngag gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tha snyad brgyad po dag gi ngag gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is the speech of the eight kinds of noble conventional expressions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phongs shing 'dod pa'i snyan par smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phongs shing 'dod pa'i snyan par smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas' pleasant speech that is desired and sought.

original: de la ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are four kinds of pure speech:

original: brdzun du smra ba spangs pa dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / tshig 'khyal pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba spangs pa dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / tshig 'khyal pa spangs pa'o //
translated: abandoning lying, abandoning slander, abandoning harsh speech, and abandoning frivolous speech.

original: de la 'phags pa'i tha snyad brgyad ni 'di dag yin te /🔽mthong ba la mthong zhes smra ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes so zhes smra ba dang / ma mthong ba la ma mthong zhes smra ba dang / ma thos pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i tha snyad brgyad ni 'di dag yin te / mthong ba la mthong zhes smra ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes so zhes smra ba dang / ma mthong ba la ma mthong zhes smra ba dang / ma thos pa dang /
translated: There are eight noble expressions:🔽saying “I see” when one sees, saying “I hear” when one hears, saying “I sense” when one senses, and saying “I know” when one knows;

original: bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa la rnam par ma shes zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa la rnam par ma shes zhes smra ba'o //
translated: saying “I do not see” when one does not see, saying “I do not hear” when one does not hear, saying “I do not sense” when one does not sense, and saying “I do not know” when one does not know.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pleasant speech of bodhisattvas that is beneficial in this life and in future lives?

original: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of nine types:

original: nye du las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir snyan par smra ba dang / longs spyod kyis phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mya ngan bsang ba dang ; nad med pas phongs pa'i mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir snyan par smra ba dang /
analyzed: nye du las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir snyan par smra ba dang / longs spyod kyis phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mya ngan bsang ba dang ; nad med pas phongs pa'i mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir snyan par smra ba dang /
translated: It is speaking pleasantly in order to dispel the sorrow of suffering that comes from one’s relatives; in order to dispel the sorrow of suffering that comes from the lack of wealth; and in order to dispel the sorrow of suffering that comes from the lack of health.

original: tshul khrims kyis phongs pa spangs pa dang / lta bas phongs pa spang ba'i phyir snyan par smra ba dang / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa la snyan par smra ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis phongs pa spangs pa dang / lta bas phongs pa spang ba'i phyir snyan par smra ba dang / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa la snyan par smra ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is speaking pleasantly in order to abandon the lack of morality and the lack of right views; and it is speaking pleasantly about the excellence of morality, the excellence of right views, the excellence of conduct, and the excellence of livelihood.

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: It is teaching the true Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i snyan par smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a bodhisattva’s pure speaking pleasantly?

original: de ni rnam pa nyi shur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa nyi shur blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as having twenty aspects.

original: rnam pa nyi shus chos ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus chos ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is teaching the Dharma with twenty aspects.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: stobs kyi rigs kyi le'u las sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi rigs kyi le'u las sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as taught previously in the chapter on the family of powers.

original: de la don spyod pa ni snyan par smra ba ji lta ba de bzhin du yang rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la don spyod pa ni snyan par smra ba ji lta ba de bzhin du yang rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: There, the practice of altruism is like the practice of pleasant speech.

original: de las bye brag du gyur pa'i don spyod pa gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de las bye brag du gyur pa'i don spyod pa gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: But there is another kind of practice of altruism that is different from that.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa thams cad kyi snyan par smra ba des de dang ldan zhing de dang ldan pa'i don sems can rnams la kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa thams cad kyi snyan par smra ba des de dang ldan zhing de dang ldan pa'i don sems can rnams la kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, by means of that pleasant speech in all its forms, is endowed with it and practices it for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of the bodhisattvas’ practice of altruism?

original: de ltar snyan par smra bas rigs pas yang dag par bstan pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar snyan par smra bas rigs pas yang dag par bstan pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: Thus, having taught properly with pleasant speech, the bodhisattva, with a compassionate mind,

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis bslab pa rnams dang / @118a * //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis bslab pa rnams dang / @118a * //
translated: teaches the precepts with a disinterested mind.

original: don spyod pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i tshul ci rigs par yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'dul ba dang / 'dzud pa dang / 'god pa 'di ni don spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid mdor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don spyod pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i tshul ci rigs par yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'dul ba dang / 'dzud pa dang / 'god pa 'di ni don spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid mdor bstan pa yin no //
translated: The essence of altruistic practice is to cause others to take up the practice of the Dharma, to train in it, to be disciplined, to enter into it, and to be established in it, by means of any of the four ways of gathering disciples.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don spyod pa thams cad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don spyod pa thams cad gang zhe na /
translated: What is the full range of altruistic practice for bodhisattvas?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as twofold:

original: sems can yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par dgrol ba'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par dgrol ba'o //
translated: to bring to maturity those beings who are not yet mature, and to liberate those beings who are already mature.

original: de yang sgo gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang sgo gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as having three doors:

original: tshe 'di'i don yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i don yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i don yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i don yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'o //
translated: to cause them to take up the aims of this life, to cause them to take up the aims of the next life, and to cause them to take up the aims of both this life and the next.

original: de la chos dang mthun pa'i las kyi yon tan dag gis longs spyod rnams sgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / spel ba yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pas /
analyzed: de la chos dang mthun pa'i las kyi yon tan dag gis longs spyod rnams sgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / spel ba yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pas /
translated: He should encourage them to acquire, guard, and increase their wealth by means of the qualities of work that are in accord with the Dharma.

original: tshe 'di'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin par rig par bya ste /🔽des na de gzhan las bsngags pa yang thob la /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin par rig par bya ste / des na de gzhan las bsngags pa yang thob la /
translated: He should be known as one who properly engages in the aims of this life, because he causes them to acquire wealth through the qualities of actions that are in conformity with the Dharma, and because he causes them to properly take up the protection and increase of that wealth.🔽He should be known as one who properly engages in the aims of the next life, because he causes them to take up the life of a mendicant, which is based on alms and is free of the possession of wealth.

original: tshe 'di la yang yo byad kyi bde bas phan btags pas bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la yang yo byad kyi bde bas phan btags pas bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he will be praised by others and will live happily in this life, because he has benefited others with the happiness of material well-being.

original: de la longs spyod spangs nas slong mo pa'i byed tshul 'tsho ba la rag las pa'i rab tu byung ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa de ni tshe phyi ma'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la longs spyod spangs nas slong mo pa'i byed tshul 'tsho ba la rag las pa'i rab tu byung ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa de ni tshe phyi ma'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: He should be known as one who properly engages in the aims of the next life, because he causes them to take up the life of a mendicant, which is based on alms and is free of the possession of wealth.

original: des na de tshe phyi ma la gdon mi za bar bde bar 'gyur gyi tshe 'di la ni nges pa med do //🔽de la khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba yang rung /
analyzed: des na de tshe phyi ma la gdon mi za bar bde bar 'gyur gyi tshe 'di la ni nges pa med do //🔽de la khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba yang rung /
translated: Thus, he will certainly be happy in the next life, but there is no certainty in this life.

original: rim gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rim gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is to be understood as the correct engagement in the aims of this life and the next.

original: des na de tshe 'di la yang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de tshe 'di la yang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, in this life, one will have physical and mental pliancy and will abide in the bliss of touch.

original: tshe phyi ma la yang rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la yang rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: And in the next life, one will be reborn among the pure gods,

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or one will pass into complete nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ practice of the difficult?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as threefold.

original: sems can sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu ma spyad pa rnams la @118b don spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu ma spyad pa rnams la @118b don spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas' difficulty of benefiting is for those sentient beings who have not previously cultivated the roots of virtue,

original: 'di ltar de dag ni dge ba yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni dge ba yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to get them to accept virtue.

original: sems can longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa chen po la gnas shing de la lhag par zhen par gyur pa rnams la don spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa chen po la gnas shing de la lhag par zhen par gyur pa rnams la don spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas' difficulty of enjoyment is for those sentient beings who are enjoying great wealth and are attached to it,

original: 'di lta ste de dag ni bdag med pa'i gzhi dang / bag med pa'i gnas chen po la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste de dag ni bdag med pa'i gzhi dang / bag med pa'i gnas chen po la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are attached to the basis of selflessness and to the great basis of heedlessness.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa mu stegs can rnams dang / sngon mu stegs can gyi lta ba spyod spyod pa'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa mu stegs can rnams dang / sngon mu stegs can gyi lta ba spyod spyod pa'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dka' ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas' difficulty of teaching is for those sentient beings who are outside this teaching, who are non Buddhists, and who are sentient beings who have long practiced the views of non Buddhists.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni bdag nyid kyis blun pa dang / chos 'dul ba 'di la sdang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni bdag nyid kyis blun pa dang / chos 'dul ba 'di la sdang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are themselves foolish and hostile to this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad kyi sgo nas don spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad kyi sgo nas don spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' beneficial conduct in all respects?

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as fourfold:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ma dad pa ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed pa nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ma dad pa ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed pa nas /
translated: Here the bodhisattva causes the faithless to accept, and then to practice and to increase, perfect faith.🔽He causes the immoral to accept, and then to practice and to increase, perfect morality.🔽He causes the unwise to accept, and then to practice and to increase, perfect wisdom.

original: 'god pa'i bar du byed pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab 'chal pa ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems sna can ni gtong pa phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed pa nas 'god pa'i bar du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'god pa'i bar du byed pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab 'chal pa ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / sems sna can ni gtong pa phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed pa nas 'god pa'i bar du byed pa'o //
translated: He causes the stingy to accept, and then to practice and to increase, perfect generosity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu dam pa'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu dam pa'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas' beneficial conduct of the holy person?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as fivefold.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams yang dag pa'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / dus su yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / don dang ldan pa'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'jam pos yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams yang dag pa'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / dus su yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / don dang ldan pa'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'jam pos yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang /
translated: Here the bodhisattva causes sentient beings to take up the true meaning, causes them to take it up in a timely way, causes them to take up the meaningful, causes them to take it up gently,

original: byams pa'i sems kyis yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems kyis yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: and causes them to take it up with a mind of loving-kindness.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi don spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi don spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ practice of the meaning in all its aspects?

original: de ni rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug dang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is sixfold and sevenfold,

original: gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bcu gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus na rnam pa bcu gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: and if combined, it is thirteenfold.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can bsdu bar bya ba rnams legs par sdud pa dang / sems can tshar gcad par bya ba rnams yang dag par tshar gcod pa dang / sems can bstan pa dang zhe @119a * //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can bsdu bar bya ba rnams legs par sdud pa dang / sems can tshar gcad par bya ba rnams yang dag par tshar gcod pa dang / sems can bstan pa dang zhe @119a * //
translated: Here bodhisattvas gather those sentient beings who are to be gathered,🔽they properly subdue those sentient beings who are to be subdued, they remove the hostility of those sentient beings who are hostile to the teaching,

original: 'gras pa rnams kyi zhe 'gras pa sel bar byed pa dang / sems can tha mal par gnas pa rnams bstan pa 'di la 'jug par byed pa dang / sems can zhugs pa rnams theg pa gsum po dag la legs par yongs su smin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'gras pa rnams kyi zhe 'gras pa sel bar byed pa dang / sems can tha mal par gnas pa rnams bstan pa 'di la 'jug par byed pa dang / sems can zhugs pa rnams theg pa gsum po dag la legs par yongs su smin par byed pa dang /
translated: they cause those sentient beings who are neutral to enter this teaching, they ripen those sentient beings who have entered the teaching in the three vehicles,

original: sems can yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar byed pa dang / de dag kha cig 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar byed pa dang / de dag kha cig 'di lta ste /
translated: they liberate those sentient beings who are ripened, and they cause some of them to attain the result of stream enterer,

original: theg pa dman pas nges par 'byung ba las brtsams pa dang / theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: theg pa dman pas nges par 'byung ba las brtsams pa dang / theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba las brtsams te /
translated: starting from the escape through the lesser vehicle, and starting from the escape through the greater vehicle.

original: tshogs bsrung ba dang / bsags pa la yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / tshogs bsrung zhing bsags pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rab tu dben pa nyid dang / sems rtse gcig tu bya ba dang / sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang /
analyzed: tshogs bsrung ba dang / bsags pa la yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / tshogs bsrung zhing bsags pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rab tu dben pa nyid dang / sems rtse gcig tu bya ba dang / sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang /
translated: protecting the accumulations, introducing them to the accumulation of merit and knowledge, protecting the accumulations and introducing them to the accumulation of merit and knowledge, introducing them to solitude, introducing them to one-pointedness of mind, introducing them to the purification of obscurations,

original: yid la byed pa sgom pa la yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can rnams nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi theg pa la yang dag par 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa sgom pa la yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can rnams nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi theg pa la yang dag par 'dzud pa'o //
translated: introducing them to the cultivation of mental attention, introducing those of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha lineages to the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and introducing those of the tathāgata lineage to the vehicle of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: de la de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phongs shing 'dod pa'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phongs shing 'dod pa'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ practice of the aim that is desired and needed?

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of eight kinds.

original: sems can ngo tsha bar bya ba'i gnas rnams la ngo tsha ba med pa'i kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris pa rnams kyi ngo tsha med pa'i kun nas dkris pa sel bar byed /🔽spong bar byed pa dang / ngo tsha med pa'i kun nas dkris pa ji lta bde bzhin du khrel yod par bya ba rnams la khrel med pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / rmugs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / gnyid kyi kun nas dkris pa dang /
analyzed: sems can ngo tsha bar bya ba'i gnas rnams la ngo tsha ba med pa'i kun nas dkris pas kun nas dkris pa rnams kyi ngo tsha med pa'i kun nas dkris pa sel bar byed / spong bar byed pa dang / ngo tsha med pa'i kun nas dkris pa ji lta bde bzhin du khrel yod par bya ba rnams la khrel med pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / rmugs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / gnyid kyi kun nas dkris pa dang /
translated: They remove the entanglements of shamelessness in those who are entangled by the entanglement of shamelessness in regard to the things that should cause shame for sentient beings.🔽They abandon shamelessness. Just as with the entanglement of shamelessness, they remove the entanglements of lack of conscience, lethargy, sleep,

original: rgod pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / 'gyod pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / phrag dog gi kun nas dkris pa dang / ser sna'i kun nas dkris pa sel bar byed /
analyzed: rgod pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / 'gyod pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / phrag dog gi kun nas dkris pa dang / ser sna'i kun nas dkris pa sel bar byed /
translated: excitement, regret, envy, and stinginess.

original: spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: They abandon stinginess.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ practice of the aim that is beneficial in this life and in future lives?

original: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgur blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of nine types.

original: sems can gzhan dag gi lus kyi las yongs su dag par bya ba las brtsams te /🔽srog gcod pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / ma byin par len pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang @119b dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag gi lus kyi las yongs su dag par bya ba las brtsams te / srog gcod pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / ma byin par len pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang @119b dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang /
translated: Beginning with the purification of the physical actions of other sentient beings,🔽he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of killing, he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of taking what has not been given, he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of sexual misconduct,

original: 'bru'i chad dang / bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag par bya ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'bru'i chad dang / bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba bag med pa'i gnas rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / ngag gi las yongs su dag par bya ba las brtsams te /
translated: he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of false speech, he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of divisive speech, he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of harsh speech, he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of idle talk, he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of covetousness, he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of malice, and he causes them to take up the abandonment of all forms of wrong views.🔽Beginning with the purification of verbal actions,

original: brdzun du smra ba'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / phra ma'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / tshig rtsub pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang /🔽tshig kyal pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag par bya ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / phra ma'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / tshig rtsub pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / tshig kyal pa'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yid kyi las yongs su dag par bya ba las brtsams te /
translated: He or she causes them to take up the avoidance of all forms of lying, the avoidance of all forms of divisive speech, the avoidance of all forms of harsh speech,

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad spang ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: and the avoidance of all forms of idle chatter. He or she causes them to take up the avoidance of all forms of covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i don spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a bodhisattva’s pure conduct in relation to the meaning?

original: de ni rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of ten types:

original: phyi rol dag pa las brten te rnam pa lnga dang / nang dag pa las brten te rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: phyi rol dag pa las brten te rnam pa lnga dang / nang dag pa las brten te rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: five that are based upon external purity and five that are based upon internal purity.🔽What are the five that are based upon external purity?

original: de la phyi rol dag pa las brten te /
analyzed: de la phyi rol dag pa las brten te /
translated: The first of these is the pure external world.🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can rnams la don spyod pa rnam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can rnams la don spyod pa rnam pa gang zhe na /
translated: In this regard, what is the bodhisattvas’ beneficial activity for sentient beings that is based on the purity of the external world?

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / phyin ci mi ldog pa dang / rims su 'bab pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / mthun mthun du sbyor ba ste /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni nyes par spyod pa dang 'dres shing nyes par spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas shing /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / phyin ci mi ldog pa dang / rims su 'bab pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / mthun mthun du sbyor ba ste / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni nyes par spyod pa dang 'dres shing nyes par spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas shing /
translated: It is free of reproach, irreversible, regular, universal, and appropriate.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mi dge ba la sems can rnams 'dzud par mi byed de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mi dge ba la sems can rnams 'dzud par mi byed de /
translated: Here a bodhisattva does not induce sentient beings to engage in nonvirtuous actions that are mixed with misdeeds and that are preceded by misdeeds.

original: 'di ni de'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ beneficial activity for sentient beings that is free of reproach.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni thar pa ma yin pa dang / gcig tu nges par rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i gnas la 'di ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni thar pa ma yin pa dang / gcig tu nges par rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i gnas la 'di ni thar pa'o //
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva does not induce sentient beings to engage in the unliberating arts and in the impure religious austerities, saying, “This is the path to liberation.”

original: 'di ni gcig tu nges par rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gcig tu nges par rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is definitely pure.

original: zhes sems can rnams de nyid la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mi byed de 'di ni de'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa phyin ci mi ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams de nyid la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mi byed de 'di ni de'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa phyin ci mi ldog pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he does not cause sentient beings to take up that which is not beneficial. This is his infallible practice of benefiting sentient beings.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni rim gyis dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /🔽sems can byis pa'i shes rab can rnams la thog mar sla ba'i @120a * //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni rim gyis dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir / sems can byis pa'i shes rab can rnams la thog mar sla ba'i @120a * //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva, in order to gradually accomplish the side of virtue,🔽initially teaches the Dharma that is easy to practice to sentient beings who have the understanding of a child.

original: chos ston par byed cing sla ba'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa rjes su 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: chos ston par byed cing sla ba'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa rjes su 'jug par byed do //
translated: He gives easy instruction and teaching.

original: de dag shes rab 'bring dang ldan par gyur par rtogs nas /
analyzed: de dag shes rab 'bring dang ldan par gyur par rtogs nas /
translated: When he realizes that they have become endowed with middling understanding,

original: chos bstan pa 'bring dang / gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa 'bring rjes su 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'bring dang / gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa 'bring rjes su 'jug par byed do //
translated: he gives middling instruction and teaching.

original: de dag shes rab rgya chen po dang ldan par gyur par rtogs nas chos zab mo ston cing /
analyzed: de dag shes rab rgya chen po dang ldan par gyur par rtogs nas chos zab mo ston cing /
translated: When he realizes that they have become endowed with great understanding, he teaches the profound Dharma🔽and gives great instruction and teaching.

original: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa phra ba rjes su 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa phra ba rjes su 'jug par byed de /
translated: He practices the subtle instructions and follow-up teachings.

original: 'di ni de'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa rims su 'bab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa rims su 'bab pa yin no //
translated: This is his sequential engagement in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni rigs bzhi dang / lha dang mi rnams dang / sems can thams cad kyi don ci nus ci lcogs kyis spyod cing /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni rigs bzhi dang / lha dang mi rnams dang / sems can thams cad kyi don ci nus ci lcogs kyis spyod cing /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva practices the welfare of sentient beings to the best of his ability and strength in the four castes, among gods and humans, and for all sentient beings.

original: phan pa dang / bde ba yongs su tshol ba dang / de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud par byed de /
analyzed: phan pa dang / bde ba yongs su tshol ba dang / de nyid la yang dag par 'dzud par byed de /
translated: He seeks their benefit and happiness and introduces them to the Dharma.

original: 'di ni de'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa kun du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i sems can rnams la don spyod pa kun du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: This is his universal engagement in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gang dag rang gi don dge ba chung ngu'am /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gang dag rang gi don dge ba chung ngu'am /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva practices the welfare of sentient beings who are engaged in their own welfare, whether it be small or great.

original: 'bring ngam / chen po gang la yang dag par gzung bar nus pa dang / thabs gang gis yang dag par gzung bar nus pa de la de dag mthun mthun du der yang dag par 'dzud par byed de de ni re zhig byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don spyod pa'i phyi rol dag pa rnam pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: 'bring ngam / chen po gang la yang dag par gzung bar nus pa dang / thabs gang gis yang dag par gzung bar nus pa de la de dag mthun mthun du der yang dag par 'dzud par byed de de ni re zhig byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don spyod pa'i phyi rol dag pa rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: Whatever is the best, middling, or least, and whatever means is the best for taking hold of it, they cause them to take hold of it in that way. This is the fivefold external purification of the bodhisattvas' practice of the aims of others.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can rnams kyi don spyod pa nang dag pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can rnams kyi don spyod pa nang dag pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fivefold internal purification of the bodhisattvas' practice of the aims of others?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje'i bsam pa rgya chen pos nye bar gnas pas sems can rnams la don kun du spyod do //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rje'i bsam pa rgya chen pos nye bar gnas pas sems can rnams la don kun du spyod do //
translated: Here the bodhisattva, abiding in a vast attitude of compassion, practices the aims of others.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi don la sdug bsngal thams cad kyis ngal bar gyur kyang yid yongs su mi skyo zhing rab tu dga' ba kho nas sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod do //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi don la sdug bsngal thams cad kyis ngal bar gyur kyang yid yongs su mi skyo zhing rab tu dga' ba kho nas sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod do //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva, practicing the aims of others with a joyful mind, is not discouraged by the fatigue of all the sufferings of others.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni phun sum tshogs pa mchog dam pa la gnas kyang bran dang 'dra ba dang / mngag gzhug pa dang / 'dra ba dang / dbang ba dang 'dra ba dang / bu dang 'dra ba dang / gdol ba'i bu dang 'dra bar rgyags pa dang /🔽khengs pa dang / nga rgyal bcom nas dma' ba'i sems kyis sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod do //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni phun sum tshogs pa mchog dam pa la gnas kyang bran dang 'dra ba dang / mngag gzhug pa dang / 'dra ba dang / dbang ba dang 'dra ba dang / bu dang 'dra ba dang / gdol ba'i bu dang 'dra bar rgyags pa dang / khengs pa dang / nga rgyal bcom nas dma' ba'i sems kyis sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod do //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva, even though he is established in the highest, most excellent perfection, acts for the welfare of beings with a humble mind, having destroyed pride, haughtiness, and arrogance, as if he were a slave, a servant, a subject, a hired hand, a son, or a low-caste man.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni zang zing med pa dang / bcos ma @120b ma yin pa dang / mchog tu byams pas sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod do //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni zang zing med pa dang / bcos ma @120b ma yin pa dang / mchog tu byams pas sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod do //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva acts for the welfare of beings with a mind of pure, disinterested, and supremely loving altruism.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni gtan du phyir mi ldog pa'i byams pa'i sems kyis sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod de /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni gtan du phyir mi ldog pa'i byams pa'i sems kyis sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod de /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva acts for the welfare of beings with a mind of loving altruism that is permanent and irreversible.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems can rnams kyi don spyod pa nang dag pa rnam pa lnga yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems can rnams kyi don spyod pa nang dag pa rnam pa lnga yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These are the five kinds of purity in the bodhisattva’s practice of altruism.

original: phyi rol dag pa rnam pa lnga po gang yin pa dang / nang dag pa rnam pa lnga po gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i don spyod pa rnam pa bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol dag pa rnam pa lnga po gang yin pa dang / nang dag pa rnam pa lnga po gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i don spyod pa rnam pa bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: The five kinds of external purity and the five kinds of internal purity are all included in the bodhisattvas’ practice of the meaning of purity, which is of ten kinds.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i don mthun pa gang zhe na ;🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' don gang dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang la gzhan dag yang dag par 'jud pa'i don de dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de la mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i don mthun pa gang zhe na ; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' don gang dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang la gzhan dag yang dag par 'jud pa'i don de dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de la mtshungs pa'am /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ concordance of the meaning?

original: lhag par bdag nyid yang dag par ston te /
analyzed: lhag par bdag nyid yang dag par ston te /
translated: Here the bodhisattva, in regard to the meaning and the roots of virtue in which he encourages others, shows himself to be equal or superior.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan dag dang don mtshungs pa gang yin pa 'di ni don mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan dag dang don mtshungs pa gang yin pa 'di ni don mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva’s concordance of meaning with others is called the concordance of the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i don mthun pa de lta bu la gzhan dag gis mthong na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i don mthun pa de lta bu la gzhan dag gis mthong na /
translated: When others see the bodhisattva’s concordance of the meaning in this way,

original: dge ba yang dag par blangs pa de la brten cing nges te /
analyzed: dge ba yang dag par blangs pa de la brten cing nges te /
translated: It is based on and certain with regard to the correct adoption of virtue.

original: phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are certain and fixed in that wholesome state that they have taken up, and they do not turn back.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de dag 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /🔽gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gang kho na la bdag cag yang dag par bcud pa de nyid la /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te / gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gang kho na la bdag cag yang dag par bcud pa de nyid la /
translated: They think,

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang kun tu spyod par byed pa las na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang kun tu spyod par byed pa las na /
translated: “Since this bodhisattva practices himself in the very same wholesome states that he has introduced us to,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'dis bdag cag gang la yang dag par btsud pa 'di ni bdag cag la phan pa dang / 'di ni bde ba yin gor ma chag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'dis bdag cag gang la yang dag par btsud pa 'di ni bdag cag la phan pa dang / 'di ni bde ba yin gor ma chag ste /
translated: it is certain that this bodhisattva’s introduction of us to these wholesome states is for our benefit and happiness.

original: 'di ni shes bzhin du phan pa ma yin pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa la bdag nyid kun du spyod par byed pa ni mi srid do snyam du sems dpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni shes bzhin du phan pa ma yin pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa la bdag nyid kun du spyod par byed pa ni mi srid do snyam du sems dpa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible that he would practice what he knows to be harmful and unhappy for himself.”

original: don mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni pha rol smra ba de dag kyang 'di skad du khyed bdag nyid kyang dge ba yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: don mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni pha rol smra ba de dag kyang 'di skad du khyed bdag nyid kyang dge ba yang dag par blangs te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in accord with the aims of others is not told by others, “You yourself have not taken up virtue.

original: mi 'dug na ci'i phyir khyod gzhan dge ba la shin tu yang dag par gzung bar bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba dang / gdams par bya bar sems /
analyzed: mi 'dug na ci'i phyir khyod gzhan dge ba la shin tu yang dag par gzung bar bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba dang / gdams par bya bar sems /
translated: Why do you think that you should cause others to take it up, to practice it, and to be instructed in it?

original: khyod nyid kyang re zhig gzhan dag gis bstan cing gdams pa dang bcos dgos so zhes mi zer ro //
analyzed: khyod nyid kyang re zhig gzhan dag gis bstan cing gdams pa dang bcos dgos so zhes mi zer ro //
translated: You yourself need to be instructed, corrected, and advised by others.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan dag dang don mthun pa kho na yin la /🔽don mthun pa de gzhan @121a * //🔽dag la ston par mi byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan dag dang don mthun pa kho na yin la / don mthun pa de gzhan @121a * // dag la ston par mi byed pa yang yod do //
translated: The bodhisattva is only in accord with the aims of others.

original: don mthun pa kho na ni ma yin la /
analyzed: don mthun pa kho na ni ma yin la /
translated: There are those who are in accord with the aims of others but do not teach that accord to others.

original: don mthun pa ston pa yang yod do //🔽don mthun pa kho na ni yin la /
analyzed: don mthun pa ston pa yang yod do // don mthun pa kho na ni yin la /
translated: There are those who are not in accord with the aims of others but teach accord to others.

original: don mthun par ston par mi byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: don mthun par ston par mi byed pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who are in accord with the aims of others but do not teach that accord to others.

original: de la mu dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' yon tan dang mthu mnyam zhing ;
analyzed: de la mu dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' yon tan dang mthu mnyam zhing ;
translated: The first alternative is that bodhisattvas who are equal in good qualities and power

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la slob dpon du khas blangs pa rnams la /🔽byang chub sems dpa' yon tan dang mthu mnyam pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la slob dpon du khas blangs pa rnams la / byang chub sems dpa' yon tan dang mthu mnyam pas /
translated: to those who have accepted the bodhisattva path as their teacher🔽do not display their good qualities and power

original: dge ba mi spyoms pas yon tan dang mthu ston par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba mi spyoms pas yon tan dang mthu ston par mi byed pa'o //
translated: because they do not boast about their virtues.

original: mu gnyis pa ni sems can dman pa la mos shing /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni sems can dman pa la mos shing /
translated: The second alternative is that bodhisattvas, having examined sentient beings who are interested in inferior things

original: zab mo'i gnas dag la skrag pa rnams la /
analyzed: zab mo'i gnas dag la skrag pa rnams la /
translated: and are afraid of the profound topics,

original: byang chub sems dpa' so sor brtags nas sems can de dag la thabs des gdul ba'i phyir bdag nyid chos mthun par ston par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' so sor brtags nas sems can de dag la thabs des gdul ba'i phyir bdag nyid chos mthun par ston par byed de /
translated: display themselves in accordance with the Dharma by that method in order to tame those sentient beings.

original: rigs ngan yan chad dang / khyi yan chad kyi don bya bar 'dod /
analyzed: rigs ngan yan chad dang / khyi yan chad kyi don bya bar 'dod /
translated: They wish to benefit those from the lowest caste up to dogs,

original: gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar bya bar 'dod /
analyzed: gnod pa yang dag par zhi bar bya bar 'dod /
translated: they wish to completely pacify harm,

original: gdul bar bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: gdul bar bya bar 'dod de /
translated: and they wish to tame them.

original: rigs ngan yan chad dang / khyi yan chad dag dang / skal ba mnyam par bsams bzhin du skye bar byed pa'o //🔽mu gsum pa ni 'dul ba dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs par gyur pa rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' don mthun pa'am /
analyzed: rigs ngan yan chad dang / khyi yan chad dag dang / skal ba mnyam par bsams bzhin du skye bar byed pa'o // mu gsum pa ni 'dul ba dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs par gyur pa rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' don mthun pa'am /
translated: and even with those of the lowest caste, and even with dogs, he is reborn in the same place, as if he were in control of his rebirth.

original: don lhag pas don mthun par ston pa'o ;🔽; mu bzhi pa ni bdag nyid kyang bag med la /
analyzed: don lhag pas don mthun par ston pa'o ; ; mu bzhi pa ni bdag nyid kyang bag med la /
translated: The third alternative is for the bodhisattva who is teaching those who have taken up the roots of virtue, and who is teaching them with a gift of the Dharma, or with a gift of material goods, or with both.

original: gzhan gyi don yang yal bar 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yang yal bar 'dor ba'o //
translated: The fourth alternative is for the bodhisattva who is himself heedless, and who abandons the aims of others.

original: de la sbyin pa rnam pa du mar bstan pa gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims gang yin pa nas don mthun pa gang yin pa'i bar du rgya cher bstan pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis ni bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa rnam pa du mar bstan pa gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims gang yin pa nas don mthun pa gang yin pa'i bar du rgya cher bstan pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis ni bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: In this regard, the perfections, which have been taught as the many kinds of generosity, and also morality, etc., up to the sameness of purpose, which have been taught in detail, bring about the full maturation of the qualities of the Buddha in oneself.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: The means of gathering disciples bring about the full maturation of all beings.

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi las ni de yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi las ni de yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, this should be understood as the function of the bodhisattvas’ wholesome actions.

original: de la sbyin pa rnam pa du ma gang yin pa nas snga ma bzhin du don mthun pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs rnam pa du ma dpag tu med pa de dag ni rgyu gsum gyis kun du spyod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa rnam pa du ma gang yin pa nas snga ma bzhin du don mthun pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs rnam pa du ma dpag tu med pa de dag ni rgyu gsum gyis kun du spyod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The wholesome actions of the bodhisattvas, beginning with generosity and ending with the same as above, the common aim, are to be understood as being practiced for three reasons.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis phul du byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis phul du byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: They are to be understood as being preeminent for two reasons.

original: rgyu gsum gyis ni rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis ni rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /
translated: They are to be understood as being pure for three reasons.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis ni kun du spyod par rig @121b par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis ni kun du spyod par rig @121b par bya'o //
translated: They are to be understood as being practiced by means of body, speech, and mind.

original: rgya che ba'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir phul du byung ba dang / bla na med pa dang / thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i phyir dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir phul du byung ba dang / bla na med pa dang / thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are to be understood as being preeminent, unsurpassed, and unique because of their greatness and because they are not defiled.

original: de la sems can la dbye ba med pa dang / dngos po la dbye ba med pa dang / dus la dbye ba med pas ni rgya cher rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems can la dbye ba med pa dang / dngos po la dbye ba med pa dang / dus la dbye ba med pas ni rgya cher rig par bya'o //
translated: The magnanimity of the bodhisattvas should be understood as being due to the absence of discrimination with regard to beings, the absence of discrimination with regard to entities, and the absence of discrimination with regard to time.

original: de la sems can la dbye ba med pa ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la brten cing /
analyzed: de la sems can la dbye ba med pa ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad la brten cing /
translated: The absence of discrimination with regard to beings is🔽the bodhisattvas practice of the roots of virtue such as generosity, etc.

original: sems can thams cad las brtsams nas sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed kyi /
analyzed: sems can thams cad las brtsams nas sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed kyi /
translated: , which are based on all beings and which are undertaken with regard to all beings,

original: bdag kho na 'ba' zhig gi phyir ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag kho na 'ba' zhig gi phyir ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and not for the sake of just oneself alone.

original: de la dngos po la dbye ba med pa ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po la dbye ba med pa ni / byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of discrimination with regard to entities is🔽the bodhisattvas undertaking and practice of all those roots of virtue such as generosity, etc.

original: de la dus la dbye ba med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la mtshan mo'am /
analyzed: de la dus la dbye ba med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la mtshan mo'am /
translated: The absence of discrimination with regard to time is the bodhisattvas practice of the roots of virtue such as generosity, etc.

original: nyin mo rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba mi gtong zhing brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / rgyu de nyid kyis tshe phyi ma la yang phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mo rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba mi gtong zhing brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / rgyu de nyid kyis tshe phyi ma la yang phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kun du spyod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: He never abandons his practice during the day, and never gives up his effort. And for that very reason, in future lives, he will continue to practice those wholesome actions, such as generosity.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The wholesome actions of bodhisattvas are uncontaminated in four ways.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems dga' ba dang / sdug bsngal ba med pa dang / yid mi bde ba med pas dge ba'i chos de dag la rten par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems dga' ba dang / sdug bsngal ba med pa dang / yid mi bde ba med pas dge ba'i chos de dag la rten par byed de /
translated: Here a bodhisattva practices those wholesome actions with a joyful mind, without suffering, and without mental distress.

original: gzhi des 'gyod par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhi des 'gyod par yang mi byed do //
translated: And on that basis, he does not feel remorse.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur pa la mngon par zhen pa med par sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba nyes par spyod pa dang ma 'dres pa de dag kun du spyod do //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur pa la mngon par zhen pa med par sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba nyes par spyod pa dang ma 'dres pa de dag kun du spyod do //
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva practices those wholesome actions, such as generosity, without harming others and without adhering to views, and without mixing them with misconduct.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni gus pa dang / snying thag pa nas de dag nyid la yon tan du lta zhing snying por lta la zhi bar lta ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni gus pa dang / snying thag pa nas de dag nyid la yon tan du lta zhing snying por lta la zhi bar lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva is respectful and, from the depths of his heart, he sees those very perfections as virtues, sees them as the essence, and sees them as peace.

original: shin tu nges pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing /
analyzed: shin tu nges pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing /
translated: He is very certain, and he is not led by others.

original: gzhan gyis mi bkri bar sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos de dag yang dag par blangs te gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi bkri bar sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos de dag yang dag par blangs te gnas so //
translated: He is not led by others in taking up and maintaining those virtuous qualities such as generosity.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos de dag gi rnam par smin pa 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dam /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos de dag gi rnam par smin pa 'khor los sgyur ba nyid dam /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva does not hope for the evolutionary development of those virtuous qualities such as generosity, etc.

original: brgya byin nyid dam /
analyzed: brgya byin nyid dam /
translated: to be a universal monarch,🔽Śakra,

original: bdud nyid dam /🔽tshangs pa nyid du re ba med do //
analyzed: bdud nyid dam / tshangs pa nyid du re ba med do //
translated: or Brahmā.

original: gzhan las lan du phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan las lan du phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med de /
translated: He does not hope for a return from others for the help he has given.

original: @122a * // khe dang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad la rten par mi byed do //
analyzed: @122a * // khe dang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa thams cad la rten par mi byed do //
translated: He does not rely on any gain, profit, fame, or praise.

original: tha na lus dang srog la yang rten par mi byed do //
analyzed: tha na lus dang srog la yang rten par mi byed do //
translated: He does not even rely on his body or life.

original: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis dang ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / gus pa dang / mi rten par sbyin pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis dang ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / gus pa dang / mi rten par sbyin pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Thus, generosity and so forth are endowed with faith, supreme joy, absence of discouragement, respect and nonattachment.🔽

original: don mthun pa la thug pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams kun du spyod pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: don mthun pa la thug pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams kun du spyod pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Thus, by these aspects, the bodhisattva practices the wholesome states of generosity and so on, up to and culminating in the sameness of purpose, with faith, with supreme delight, without resistance, with devotion, and without reliance.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “uncontaminated.”

original: rnam par dag pa ni sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Purification should be understood as purification, non-wavering, and complete purification.

original: de la bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: de la bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: The wholesome roots of the bodhisattva who has entered the stage of pure thought are purified and unwavering.

original: de la sbyangs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the purification:

original: 'di ltar bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni so sor ma brtags par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni so sor ma brtags par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, all those wholesome states of the bodhisattva of pure thought are practiced without examination.

original: de la mi g-yo ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mi g-yo ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the non-wavering:

original: 'di ltar bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i chos ji ltar thob pa rnams dang / ji ltar bsags pa de dag las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i chos ji ltar thob pa rnams dang / ji ltar bsags pa de dag las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: In this way, a bodhisattva who has a pure attitude will never lose any of the virtuous qualities that he or she has attained and accumulated.

original: phyis kyang yongs su nyams pa'i skal ba can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis kyang yongs su nyams pa'i skal ba can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: He or she will not be subject to a loss of them in the future.

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mo de dang de dag 'das pa dang / lus de dang de dag 'das pa na zla ba yar gyi ngor gyur pa bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo de dang de dag 'das pa dang / lus de dang de dag 'das pa na zla ba yar gyi ngor gyur pa bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: As those nights and days pass and those bodies are cast off, those virtuous qualities will only increase, like the waxing moon.

original: de dag gis yongs su 'grib par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis yongs su 'grib par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not diminish.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag ni shin tu rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag ni shin tu rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The virtuous qualities of a bodhisattva who is established in the bodhisattva’s stage of the Tathāgata, a bodhisattva who is in his or her final lifetime, and a bodhisattva who is in his or her last existence should be understood as being extremely pure.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las shas cher yongs su dag pa gong na med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las shas cher yongs su dag pa gong na med do //
translated: There is no higher purification of these on the bodhisattva stages.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa nas don mthun pa la thug pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag rgyu gsum pos kun du spyod pa dang / rgyu gnyis kyis phul du byung ba dang / rgyu gsum gyis shin tu rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa nas don mthun pa la thug pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag rgyu gsum pos kun du spyod pa dang / rgyu gnyis kyis phul du byung ba dang / rgyu gsum gyis shin tu rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these virtuous qualities from generosity to reconciling others to the teaching are practiced by means of three causes, are preeminent by means of two causes, and are very pure by means of three causes.

original: de la sbyin pa thams cad dang / tshul khrims thams cad nas rgyas par don mthun pa thams cad kyi bar dag kun du brten cing shin tu rnam par dag par byas te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa thams cad dang / tshul khrims thams cad nas rgyas par don mthun pa thams cad kyi bar dag kun du brten cing shin tu rnam par dag par byas te /
translated: Therein, all generosity, all morality, and so on, up to all reconciling of others to oneself are practiced and made very pure.

original: mtha' dag kun du rtogs par byas pa las ni @122b 'bras bu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / rdo rje'i snying po'i sku dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas pa mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: mtha' dag kun du rtogs par byas pa las ni @122b 'bras bu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / rdo rje'i snying po'i sku dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas pa mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: From the realization of all of them, the result is the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, the vajra-essence body, and the long-lasting of the true teaching.

original: de la dka' ba'i sbyin pa dang / dka' ba'i tshul khrims nas /
analyzed: de la dka' ba'i sbyin pa dang / dka' ba'i tshul khrims nas /
translated: The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.

original: dka' ba'i don mthun pa'i bar du kun du brten cing shin tu rnam par dag par byas pas ni 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos mtshungs pa med pa dang ldan pa mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: dka' ba'i don mthun pa'i bar du kun du brten cing shin tu rnam par dag par byas pas ni 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos mtshungs pa med pa dang ldan pa mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.

original: de la thams cad kyi sgo nas sbyin pa dang / thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims nas rgyas par thams cad kyi sgo nas don mthun pa'i bar gyis ni 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad las gtso bor gyur pa'i sems can lha dang mi rnams kyis mchod par 'gyur ba nyid mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyi sgo nas sbyin pa dang / thams cad kyi sgo nas tshul khrims nas rgyas par thams cad kyi sgo nas don mthun pa'i bar gyis ni 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad las gtso bor gyur pa'i sems can lha dang mi rnams kyis mchod par 'gyur ba nyid mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tathāgata’s marvelous and wonderful qualities, which are unequaled.🔽The result of generosity, morality, etc.🔽is the attainment of the Tath

original: de la skyes bu dam pa'i sbyin pa dang / skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims dang / skyes bu dam pa'i don mthun pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems can gang dag su yang rung ba /
analyzed: de la skyes bu dam pa'i sbyin pa dang / skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims dang / skyes bu dam pa'i don mthun pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems can gang dag su yang rung ba /
translated: The result of the generosity of a holy being, the morality of a holy being, and so on up to the result of the equanimity of a holy being is the attainment of being the foremost of all sentient beings, of any of them,

original: rkang med dam /
analyzed: rkang med dam /
translated: who are without legs,

original: rkang gnyis pa 'am /
analyzed: rkang gnyis pa 'am /
translated: who have two legs,

original: rkang bzhi pa'am /
analyzed: rkang bzhi pa'am /
translated: who have four legs,

original: rkang mangs sam /
analyzed: rkang mangs sam /
translated: who have many legs,

original: gzugs can nam /
analyzed: gzugs can nam /
translated: who have form,

original: gzugs med pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'am /
translated: who are formless,

original: 'du shes can nam /
analyzed: 'du shes can nam /
translated: who have perception,🔽who have no perception,

original: 'du shes med pa'am /🔽'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar song ba'i sems can de dag thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur ba mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'am / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar song ba'i sems can de dag thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur ba mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: or who have neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims nas rgyas par rnam pa thams cad kyi don mthun pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi sbyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi tshul khrims nas rgyas par rnam pa thams cad kyi don mthun pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: The result of the generosity of every aspect, the morality of every aspect, and so on up to the result of the equanimity of every aspect is the attainment of the thirty-two marks of a great being of a Tathāgata,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i sku bsod nams sna tshogs dpag tu med pas yongs su bsdus pa mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i sku bsod nams sna tshogs dpag tu med pas yongs su bsdus pa mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: The body of the Tathāgata, which is endowed with the eighty minor marks, is accomplished through the accumulation of immeasurable varieties of merit.

original: de la phongs shing 'dod pa'i sbyin pa dang / phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims nas rgyas par phongs shing 'dod pa'i don mthun pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa'i bdud dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis gnod par bya ba dang /🔽tho 'tshams pa dang / bskyod par mi nus pa mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la phongs shing 'dod pa'i sbyin pa dang / phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims nas rgyas par phongs shing 'dod pa'i don mthun pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa'i bdud dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis gnod par bya ba dang / tho 'tshams pa dang / bskyod par mi nus pa mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: The result of generosity that is practiced with a sense of loss and desire, and similarly, the result of morality, etc., up to the result of sameness of purpose that is practiced with a sense of loss and desire, is the accomplishment of the Tathāgata’s seat of enlightenment, which cannot be disturbed, shaken, or harmed by any Māra or adversary.🔽The result of generosity that is practiced without a sense of loss or desire, and similarly, the result of morality, etc., up to the result of sameness of purpose that is practiced without a sense of loss or desire, is the accomplishment of the Tathāgata’s ten powers, four fearlessnesses, and eighteen special qualities.

original: de la 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa dang / 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims nas rgyas par 'di dang @123a * //
analyzed: de la 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa dang / 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims nas rgyas par 'di dang @123a * //
translated: The result of generosity that is practiced for the sake of this life is the acquisition of wealth.

original: gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i don mthun pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba'i mchog mngon par 'grub bo //🔽de la rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims nas rgyas par rnam par dag pa'i don mthun pa'i bar du kun du brten cing /🔽shin tu rnam par dag par byas te /
analyzed: gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i don mthun pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba'i mchog mngon par 'grub bo // de la rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims nas rgyas par rnam par dag pa'i don mthun pa'i bar du kun du brten cing / shin tu rnam par dag par byas te /
translated: The result of the concordant effect is the accomplishment of the supreme bliss of the tathagatas' meditative concentration, liberation, samadhi, and samapatti.

original: mtha' dag kun du rdzogs par byas pa'i 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mtha' dag kun du rdzogs par byas pa'i 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi ste /
