analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid kyis nyon mongs pa go rims bzhin du gti mug dang zhes sdang dang 'dod chags bsal ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems sgom par byed pa 'di ni de'i btang snyoms yin no
translated: The equanimity of the bodhisattva is the cultivation of a mind endowed with the intention of equanimity, which is the antidote to the three kinds of passion, respectively, in the three kinds of beings who are endowed with pleasure, endowed with suffering, and endowed with neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: // de la byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa sems can la dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag ni gzhan mu stegs can dang thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: // de la byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa sems can la dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag ni gzhan mu stegs can dang thun mong ba yin no //
translated: The immeasurables of love, etc. of the bodhisattva, which are focused on sentient beings, are shared in common with nonBuddhists.

original: chos la dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ba yin gyi /
translated: Those which are focused on dharmas are shared in common with the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: mu stegs can dang ni thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang ni thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: But those which are focused on the unapprehendable are not shared in common with the nonBuddhists.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa med pa'i tshad med pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa med pa'i tshad med pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The immeasurables of the bodhisattva are not shared in common with others.

original: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas @129b thams cad dang thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas @129b thams cad dang thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are not shared in common with any of the tirthikas, sravakas, or pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshad med pa byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba gsum ni bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshad med pa byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba gsum ni bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the three boundless states of love, compassion, and joy are to be understood as included in the superior attitude of bringing happiness.

original: tshad med pa gcig ni phan pa bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa gcig ni phan pa bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: One boundless state is to be understood as included in the superior attitude of bringing benefit.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that one?

original: btang snyoms so //
analyzed: btang snyoms so //
translated: It is equanimity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshad med pa de dag thams cad ni snying brtse bzhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshad med pa de dag thams cad ni snying brtse bzhes bya ste /
translated: All of the bodhisattvas boundless states are called “compassion.🔽”🔽Therefore, the bodhisattvas who possess them are called “compassionate.

original: de lta bas na de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying brtse ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying brtse ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas who have these are called “compassionate.”🔽

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi khams na sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu mthong bas sems can rnams la snying rje sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi khams na sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu mthong bas sems can rnams la snying rje sgom par byed do //
translated: In this regard, bodhisattvas cultivate compassion for sentient beings by seeing the one hundred and ten kinds of suffering in the realm of sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the one hundred and ten kinds of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gcig ni bye brag med par 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal las brtsams te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gcig ni bye brag med par 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal las brtsams te /
translated: The first kind of suffering is that which is experienced without distinction, beginning with suffering.

original: sems can thams cad 'jug par gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jug par gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o //
translated: All sentient beings are endowed with the suffering that is included in the process of living.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can te /
translated: The second kind of suffering is rooted in desire.

original: dga' ba'i dngos po gang dag 'gyur zhing gzhan du 'gyur ba las sdug bsngal skye ba dang / rnam par smin pa rmongs pa can gyi sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: dga' ba'i dngos po gang dag 'gyur zhing gzhan du 'gyur ba las sdug bsngal skye ba dang / rnam par smin pa rmongs pa can gyi sdug bsngal te /
translated: Suffering arises from the transformation and change of things that are liked, and from the suffering that is the deluded ripening of karma.

original: lus kyi tshor ba drag po gang dag gis thebs nas /
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba drag po gang dag gis thebs nas /
translated: When one is struck by intense physical sensations,🔽one thinks, “This is my body,”

original: lus de la bdag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: lus de la bdag ces bya ba'am /
translated: or “This is my self.”

original: bdag gi zhes bya bar rmongs nas shin tu mya ngan byed cing gang gis lus dang sems kyi tshor ba'i zug rngu gnyis myong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya bar rmongs nas shin tu mya ngan byed cing gang gis lus dang sems kyi tshor ba'i zug rngu gnyis myong ba'o //
translated: One suffers greatly, deluded by the thought This is mine! and one experiences the two kinds of pain, physical and mental.🔽The three kinds of suffering are the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of universal conditioning.🔽The four kinds of suffering are the suffering of separation,🔽which arises from being separated from what one loves;

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal lo sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi ni 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal lo sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi ni 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: the suffering of searching,🔽which arises from having to search for what one wants;🔽the suffering of not finding,🔽which arises from not finding what one wants;🔽and the suffering of change,🔽which arises from the impermanence of all conditioned things.

original: sdug pa rnams dang bral ba las skye ba gang yin pa dang / rgyun chad pa'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sdug pa rnams dang bral ba las skye ba gang yin pa dang / rgyun chad pa'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: The five kinds of suffering are the suffering of birth,🔽which arises from entering a new life;🔽the suffering of aging,

original: ris mthun pa 'dor pa 'chi ba las skye ba gang yin pa dang / rgyun gyi sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: ris mthun pa 'dor pa 'chi ba las skye ba gang yin pa dang / rgyun gyi sdug bsngal te /
translated: which arises from the decay of the body and the decline of the faculties;🔽the suffering of sickness,🔽which arises from the disturbance of the elements;🔽the suffering of death,🔽which arises from the loss of life;

original: shi ba'i 'og tu skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las skye ba gang yin pa dang / gtan du sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las skye ba gang yin pa dang / gtan du sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: and the suffering of meeting what is unpleasant,🔽which arises from encountering enemies, fear, and so forth.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi sems can rnams kyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi sems can rnams kyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates of those sentient beings who are not destined to attain nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rkyen can dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / @130a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rkyen can dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / @130a * //
translated: The five kinds of suffering are: the suffering conditioned by the fetter of desire for sense-pleasures, and the suffering conditioned by the fetters of malice,🔽sloth-and-torpor,

original: gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa'i rkyen can gyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa'i rkyen can gyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: restlessness-and-worry, and doubt.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa drug ni ngan song gi rgyu rten pa'i phyir rgyu'i sdug bsngal dang / ngan song du skyes pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i sdug bsngal dang / longs spyod las brtsams te yongs su tshol ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bsrung ba'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa drug ni ngan song gi rgyu rten pa'i phyir rgyu'i sdug bsngal dang / ngan song du skyes pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i sdug bsngal dang / longs spyod las brtsams te yongs su tshol ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bsrung ba'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: The six kinds of suffering are: the suffering of cause, because it is the cause of the miserable realms; the suffering of result, because one is born in the miserable realms; the suffering of searching for resources, because one searches for resources with suffering; the suffering of protection, because one protects what has been obtained with suffering;

original: chog mi shes pa'i sdug bsngal dang / med par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: chog mi shes pa'i sdug bsngal dang / med par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: the suffering of dissatisfaction, because one is never satisfied with what one has obtained; and the suffering of impermanence, because one suffers when one is separated from what one likes.

original: de dag bsdus pa ni sdug bsngal rnam pa drug yin no //
analyzed: de dag bsdus pa ni sdug bsngal rnam pa drug yin no //
translated: The six kinds of suffering are included in these.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa med par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa gang yin pa de yang sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun ni skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / sdug pa med par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa gang yin pa de yang sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The seven kinds of suffering are the suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of association with what is unpleasant, the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, and the suffering of not obtaining what is desired.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni grang ba'i sdug bsngal dang / tsha ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bkris pa'i sdug bsngal dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rang dbang med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bdag la gnod pa byed pa'i sdug bsngal 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni grang ba'i sdug bsngal dang / tsha ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bkris pa'i sdug bsngal dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rang dbang med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bdag la gnod pa byed pa'i sdug bsngal 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight kinds of suffering are the suffering of cold, the suffering of heat, the suffering of hunger, the suffering of thirst, the suffering of being without independence, the suffering of being harmed by oneself, the suffering of being harmed by others, and the suffering of being harmed by both.🔽The suffering of being harmed by oneself is like that of the naked ascetics who practice austerities.

original: gcer bu pa la sogs pa rnams ni lta bu dang / gnod pa gzhan las byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gcer bu pa la sogs pa rnams ni lta bu dang / gnod pa gzhan las byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'di lta ste /
translated: The suffering of being harmed by others is like that of the ascetics who practice austerities.

original: gzhan gyis lag pa dang / bong bas bsnun pa la sogs pa dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pas zin pa dang / spyod lam sna gcig gis gnas pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis lag pa dang / bong bas bsnun pa la sogs pa dang / sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pas zin pa dang / spyod lam sna gcig gis gnas pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of being struck by others with their hands, clods of earth, sticks, or knives; the suffering of being bitten by insects such as mosquitoes and flies; the suffering of remaining in one position too long.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa dgu ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa dgu ni /
translated: The nine kinds of suffering are:

original: bdag nyid rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gzhan rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang / nye du rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang / longs spyod nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / nad med pa las nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / tshul khrims nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gzhan rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang / nye du rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang / longs spyod nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / nad med pa las nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / tshul khrims nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: the suffering of one’s own misfortune, the suffering of the misfortune of others, the suffering of the misfortune of one’s relatives, the suffering of the loss of wealth, the suffering of the loss of health, the suffering of the loss of morality,

original: lta ba nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal dang / tshe phyi ma'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: lta ba nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal dang / tshe phyi ma'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering of the loss of views, the suffering of this life, and the suffering of the next life.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu ni lus kyi yo byad kha zas med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang ; gos dang / rgyan dang / snod spyad kyi yo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu ni lus kyi yo byad kha zas med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / btung ba dang / bzhon pa dang ; gos dang / rgyan dang / snod spyad kyi yo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang /
translated: The ten types of suffering are the suffering of not having physical necessities, such as food, drink, vehicles, clothing, ornaments, and utensils; the suffering of not having fragrant🔽flowers, garlands,

original: byug pa'i yo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gar dang glu dang rol mo'i sgra'i yo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / snang ba'i bo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal dang bcu pa ste /
analyzed: byug pa'i yo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gar dang glu dang rol mo'i sgra'i yo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / snang ba'i bo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal dang bcu pa ste /
translated: and ointments; the suffering of not having the necessities of dance, song, and music; and the suffering of not having the necessities of light.

original: skyes pa dang @130b bud med dag dga' dgur spyod pa'i lus kyi yo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: skyes pa dang @130b bud med dag dga' dgur spyod pa'i lus kyi yo byad med pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The tenth is the suffering of not having the necessities of men and women for sexual intercourse.

original: yang sdug bsngal ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal ni rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: Suffering should be understood as having nine types.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad dang / sdug bsngal chen po dang / thams cad kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal dang / log par zhugs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi 'dod pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad dang / sdug bsngal chen po dang / thams cad kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal dang / log par zhugs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi 'dod pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: All suffering, great suffering, suffering in every way, suffering of wrong engagement, suffering of engagement, suffering of what is not desired, suffering of want,

original: rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: suffering of association, and suffering of every aspect.

original: de la sdug bsngal thams cad ni sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba dang / da ltar gyi rkyen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal thams cad ni sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba dang / da ltar gyi rkyen las byung ba'o //
translated: Here, all suffering is that which arises from a previous cause and that which arises from present conditions.

original: de la sdug bsngal chen po ni yun ring ba dang / bzod brlag pa dang / sna tshogs pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal chen po ni yun ring ba dang / bzod brlag pa dang / sna tshogs pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Here, great suffering is that which is long-lasting, that which is unbearable, that which is varied, and that which is uninterrupted.

original: de la thams cad kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal ni sems can dmyal ba pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dags kyi 'jig rten pa dang / bde 'gror gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal ni sems can dmyal ba pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dags kyi 'jig rten pa dang / bde 'gror gtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, suffering in every way is that of beings in the hells, animals, ghosts, and those in the happy realms.

original: de la log par zhugs pa'i sdug bsngal ni tshe 'di la gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa byas pa byung ba dang / kun nas slong ba dang / kha zas mi mthun pa zos pas khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal kun nas slong ba dang /🔽tshe 'di la bdag nyid kyis mi rigs par sdug bsngal bar byas pa las bdag gi byas pa'i sdug bsngal kun nas slong pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang / de la shas cher gnas pas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: de la log par zhugs pa'i sdug bsngal ni tshe 'di la gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa byas pa byung ba dang / kun nas slong ba dang / kha zas mi mthun pa zos pas khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal kun nas slong ba dang / tshe 'di la bdag nyid kyis mi rigs par sdug bsngal bar byas pa las bdag gi byas pa'i sdug bsngal kun nas slong pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang / de la shas cher gnas pas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: The suffering that comes from engaging in these in the wrong way is the suffering that arises from being harmed by others in this life, from harming others, from the arising of agitation due to eating improper food,🔽from the arising of suffering due to one’s own actions, from improper mental activity, from the afflictions that arise from dwelling on them,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang ; lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa shas che bas phyi ma la ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang ; lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa shas che bas phyi ma la ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: and from the experience of the suffering of the entanglements of the secondary afflictions, and from the suffering of the lower realms in the next life due to the predominance of physical, verbal, and mental misdeeds.

original: de la 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal ni ma nges pa rnam pa drug las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal ni ma nges pa rnam pa drug las byung ba ste /
translated: The suffering of engagement arises from six kinds of uncertainty.

original: 'khor bar 'khor ba na lus ma nges pas rgyal por gyur pa las mi dbul por gyur pa dang / pha ma ma nges pa dang / bu dang chung ma ma nges pa dang / bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba ma nges pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor ba na lus ma nges pas rgyal por gyur pa las mi dbul por gyur pa dang / pha ma ma nges pa dang / bu dang chung ma ma nges pa dang / bran dang bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba ma nges pa dang /
translated: When you circle in samsara, your body is uncertain, so you may be a king and then become a poor person. Your parents are uncertain, your children and spouse are uncertain, and your servants, workers, and livestock are uncertain.

original: mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams ma nges pa las byung ba de 'khor bar 'khor ba na /
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams ma nges pa las byung ba de 'khor bar 'khor ba na /
translated: Your friends, companions, relatives, and family members are uncertain.

original: pha mar gyur pa @131a * //
analyzed: pha mar gyur pa @131a * //
translated: When you circle in samsara, those who were your parents🔽in the past become your friends, companions, relatives, and family members.

original: nas rgyas par mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi bar du gyur pa las dus gzhan du 'khor bar 'khor ba na /
analyzed: nas rgyas par mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi bar du gyur pa las dus gzhan du 'khor bar 'khor ba na /
translated: Later, when you circle in samsara,🔽they become your killers, adversaries, and enemies.

original: gsod pa dang / phyir rgol ba dang / dgra bor gyur pa dang / 'khor bar 'khor ba na longs spyod ma nges pas /
analyzed: gsod pa dang / phyir rgol ba dang / dgra bor gyur pa dang / 'khor bar 'khor ba na longs spyod ma nges pas /
translated: When you circle in samsara, your resources are uncertain.

original: longs spyod chen por gyur pa las phyis dus gzhan du mchog tu dbul por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod chen por gyur pa las phyis dus gzhan du mchog tu dbul por 'gyur ro //
translated: From having great wealth, later on, at another time, one becomes extremely poor.

original: de la mi 'dod pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni tshe ring bar 'dod pa la mi 'dod bzhin du tshe thung bar 'gyur ba las byung ba dang / byad bzang bar 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du byad ngan par 'gyur ba dang / rigs mthon por skye bar 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du rigs dma' bar skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la mi 'dod pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni tshe ring bar 'dod pa la mi 'dod bzhin du tshe thung bar 'gyur ba las byung ba dang / byad bzang bar 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du byad ngan par 'gyur ba dang / rigs mthon por skye bar 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du rigs dma' bar skye bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The suffering that arises from not getting what one wants is, for example, that one wants a long life but lives a short life, that one wants a good appearance but has a bad appearance, that one wants to be born into a high caste but is born into a low caste,

original: dbang phyug 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du dbul por 'gyur ba dang / stobs che bar 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du stobs chung ngur 'gyur ba las byung ba dang / shes bya shes par 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du rmongs pa'i shes pa kun du spyod pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: dbang phyug 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du dbul por 'gyur ba dang / stobs che bar 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du stobs chung ngur 'gyur ba las byung ba dang / shes bya shes par 'dod pa las kyang mi 'dod bzhin du rmongs pa'i shes pa kun du spyod pa las byung ba dang /
translated: that one wants to be powerful but is poor, that one wants to be strong but is weak, that one wants to have knowledge but is ignorant,

original: pha rol pham par 'dod pa las kyang /
analyzed: pha rol pham par 'dod pa las kyang /
translated: and that one wants to defeat others but is defeated by others.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du bdag nyid pham pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du bdag nyid pham pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of loss is the suffering that arises from the loss of wealth, relatives, and health.🔽The suffering of misfortune is the suffering that arises from the misfortune of householders due to the loss of children, spouse, and so on, and the suffering that arises from the misfortune of the increase of afflictions such as attachment in those who have gone forth.

original: de la phongs pa'i sdug bsngal ni khyim pa rnams kyi bu dang chung ma la sogs pa 'grib pa las byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'phel ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gang mu ges phongs pa'am /
analyzed: de la phongs pa'i sdug bsngal ni khyim pa rnams kyi bu dang chung ma la sogs pa 'grib pa las byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'phel ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gang mu ges phongs pa'am /
translated: It is the suffering that arises from the misfortune of famine,🔽the misfortune of being attacked by foreign armies, the misfortune of going to a wilderness or a ravine, and the suffering that arises from the misfortune of being dependent on others for one's livelihood.

original: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis phongs pa dang / dgon pa dang ; gcong rong du 'gro ba'i nyam nga bas phongs pa las byung ba dang / sdug bsngal gang pha rol la rag las pas 'tsho ba las byung ba dang / sdug bsngal gang yan lag dang nyid lag nyams pas phongs par gyur pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis phongs pa dang / dgon pa dang ; gcong rong du 'gro ba'i nyam nga bas phongs pa las byung ba dang / sdug bsngal gang pha rol la rag las pas 'tsho ba las byung ba dang / sdug bsngal gang yan lag dang nyid lag nyams pas phongs par gyur pa las byung ba dang /
translated: It is the suffering that arises from the misfortune of the loss of limbs and appendages.

original: sdug bsngal gang gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang bcad pa dang / brdeg pa dang / bskrad pa la sogs pas phongs pa las byung ba'o //🔽de la rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang bcad pa dang / brdeg pa dang / bskrad pa la sogs pas phongs pa las byung ba'o // de la rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa ste /
translated: The suffering of pain is the suffering that arises from the pain of the five senses, such as the eye, etc.🔽The suffering of change is the suffering that arises from the change of the five objects of enjoyment, such as form, etc.🔽The suffering of the conditioning of the composite is the suffering that arises from the conditioning of the five aggregates of attachment.🔽The suffering of the eight worldly conditions is the suffering that arises from the eight worldly conditions.

original: 'jig pa'i chos can 'jig pa dang / zad pa'i chos can zad pa dang / rga ba'i chos can rga ba @131b dang ; na ba'i chos can na ba dang / 'chi ba'i chos can 'chi ba dang / yang ma rnyed pa'am /🔽mi snyan pa'am /🔽smad pa las sdug bsngal 'byung ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can 'jig pa dang / zad pa'i chos can zad pa dang / rga ba'i chos can rga ba @131b dang ; na ba'i chos can na ba dang / 'chi ba'i chos can 'chi ba dang / yang ma rnyed pa'am / mi snyan pa'am / smad pa las sdug bsngal 'byung ba gang yin pa de /
translated: The eight worldly conditions are: the suffering that arises from the loss of what is desirable, the suffering that arises from the acquisition of what is undesirable, the suffering that arises from not acquiring what is desirable, the suffering that arises from not acquiring what is undesirable, the suffering that arises from the change of what is desirable, the suffering that arises from the change of what is undesirable, the suffering that arises from the change of what is desirable, and the suffering that arises from the change of what is undesirable.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag dang / 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'di rnams ni rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag dang / 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'di rnams ni rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: These eight kinds of suffering, together with the suffering of desire, are called the suffering of the eight worldly conditions.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal ni bde ba rnam pa lnga ji skad bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal ni bde ba rnam pa lnga ji skad bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa ste /
translated: Suffering as a general characteristic is the suffering that is the opposite of the five kinds of happiness as they have been presented.

original: rgyu'i sdug bsngal dang / tshor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bde ba med pa can gyi sdug bsngal dang / tshor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu'i sdug bsngal dang / tshor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bde ba med pa can gyi sdug bsngal dang / tshor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang /
translated: It is the suffering of cause, the suffering of feeling, the suffering of the absence of happiness, the suffering of the continuity of feeling, and the suffering that is the opposite of the happiness of renunciation, solitude, and complete peace.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs khyim pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / kun du sbyor ba las byung ba'i rtog pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i sdug bsngal ni lnga pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs khyim pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / kun du sbyor ba las byung ba'i rtog pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i sdug bsngal ni lnga pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The suffering of householders, the suffering of the desire realm, the suffering of thoughts that arise from fetters, and the suffering of ordinary beings should be understood as the fifth kind of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga po 'di dang gnod pa las byung ba dang / yo byad med pa las byung ba dang / khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba 'gyur ba las byung ba dang / khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lnga po de dag dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga po 'di dang gnod pa las byung ba dang / yo byad med pa las byung ba dang / khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba 'gyur ba las byung ba dang / khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lnga po de dag dang /
translated: These five types of suffering, the suffering that arises from harm, the suffering that arises from the lack of requisites, the suffering that arises from the imbalance of the elements, the suffering that arises from the change of joy, and the suffering of the negative reflex actions that are the side of the afflictions experienced in the three realms,

original: snga ma'i rnam pa lnga gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: snga ma'i rnam pa lnga gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: and the five types of suffering mentioned above,

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu ni rnam pa thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu ni rnam pa thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: are called “all types.”

original: de ltar snga ma'i rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga po dang / rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga po 'di dag gcig tu bsdus na sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcur 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar snga ma'i rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga po dang / rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga po 'di dag gcig tu bsdus na sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcur 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i dmigs pa ste /
translated: Thus, if the fifty-five types of suffering mentioned above and these fifty-five types are combined, they become one hundred and ten types of suffering, which are the objects of the bodhisattva’s compassion.

original: dmigs pa des byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje skye zhing rnam par 'phel la bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa des byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje skye zhing rnam par 'phel la bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this objective, the compassion of the bodhisattvas arises, increases, and is perfected.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po de las sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu dgu la dmigs pa las ni snying rje chen po 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po de las sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu dgu la dmigs pa las ni snying rje chen po 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: From this great mass of suffering, great compassion arises from the focus on the nineteen kinds of suffering.🔽What are the nineteen kinds of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu dgu po gang zhe na ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bcu dgu po gang zhe na ;
translated: The suffering of the ripening of delusion, the suffering included in the suffering of conditioned existence, the suffering of the ultimate, the suffering of the cause, the suffering of birth, the suffering of harm done by oneself,🔽the suffering of harm done by others, the suffering of harm done by both, the suffering of the destruction of what is dear,

original: rnam par smin pa rmongs pa can gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gtan du sdug bsngal dang / rgyu'i sdug bsngal dang / skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bdag nyid kyis gnod pa byas pa'i sdug bsngal dang /🔽tshul khrims nyams pa'i sdug @132a * //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rmongs pa can gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gtan du sdug bsngal dang / rgyu'i sdug bsngal dang / skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bdag nyid kyis gnod pa byas pa'i sdug bsngal dang /🔽tshul khrims nyams pa'i sdug @132a * //

original: bsngal dang / lta ba nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal chen po dang / sems can dmyal ba pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bde 'gror gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / log par zhugs pa rnams las byung ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang /
analyzed: bsngal dang / lta ba nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sngon gyi rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal chen po dang / sems can dmyal ba pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bde 'gror gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / log par zhugs pa rnams las byung ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang /
translated: the suffering of pain, the suffering of change, the suffering of conditionality, the suffering of separation from what is attractive, the suffering of not obtaining what is desired, the suffering of the five perpetuating aggregates, the suffering of views, the suffering of the decline of virtue, the suffering that arises from past causes, the great suffering, the suffering of the hells, the suffering of the higher realms, the suffering that arises from all wrong unwholesome activities,

original: 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang / mi shes pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rgyas pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / tshor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang / mi shes pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rgyas pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / tshor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering of engagement, the suffering of ignorance, the suffering that arises from expansion, the suffering that arises from connection, the suffering of feeling, and the suffering of negative propensities.

original: de la snying rje ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis snying rje chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la snying rje ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis snying rje chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Compassion is called great compassion for four reasons.

original: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zab cing cha phra ba la rtogs par dka' ba la dmigs nas skyes pa yin /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zab cing cha phra ba la rtogs par dka' ba la dmigs nas skyes pa yin /
translated: It arises on the basis of observing the profound and subtle suffering of sentient beings, which is difficult to realize.

original: bskal pa 'bum phrag du ma nas goms pas yun ring po nas 'dris pa yin /
analyzed: bskal pa 'bum phrag du ma nas goms pas yun ring po nas 'dris pa yin /
translated: It is familiar from long ago, since it has been cultivated for many hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: rtsol ba drag pos dmigs pa la zhugs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rtsol ba drag pos dmigs pa la zhugs pa yang yin te /
translated: It is engaged in the object of meditation with intense effort.🔽The bodhisattva who has such effort and is imbued with compassion,

original: rtsol ba 'di lta bu dang ldan zhing snying rjes zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsol ba 'di lta bu dang ldan zhing snying rjes zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to remove the suffering of sentient beings,

original: bdag nyid kyi srog brgya yang yongs su gtong na srog gcig lta ci smos /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi srog brgya yang yongs su gtong na srog gcig lta ci smos /
translated: would give up even a hundred of his own lives, let alone a single life.

original: lus kyi yo byad lta yang ci smos te /
analyzed: lus kyi yo byad lta yang ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention material things?

original: sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyang nyams su len par byed pa yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyang nyams su len par byed pa yin /
translated: He would even undergo all the aspects of harm from suffering.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa yang yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa yang yin te /
translated: It is extremely pure.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: mthar thug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa yang rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yang rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa yang rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yang rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The bodhisattva levels of the ultimate bodhisattvas are pure and the tathagata level of the tathagatas is pure.

original: ; byang chub sems dpa' gang dag sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu po 'dis sems can rnams la snying rje sgom par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje thams cad bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: ; byang chub sems dpa' gang dag sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu po 'dis sems can rnams la snying rje sgom par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje thams cad bsgom pa yin no //
translated: Those bodhisattvas who cultivate compassion for sentient beings through these one hundred and ten forms of suffering are cultivating all the bodhisattva’s compassion.

original: de dag gis ni bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang myur ba nyid du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bsam pa dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang myur ba nyid du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will quickly attain the pure attitude of compassion that is entered upon the stage of pure attitude.

original: sems can rnams la yang sems shin tu mnyen pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang / byed 'dod pa'i sems dang / skyo pa med pa'i sems dang / sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i sems dang / las su rung zhing dbang @132b du gyur pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang sems shin tu mnyen pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang / byed 'dod pa'i sems dang / skyo pa med pa'i sems dang / sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i sems dang / las su rung zhing dbang @132b du gyur pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They will have a very tender mind, a loving mind, a helpful mind, an unwearying mind, a mind that accepts suffering, and a mind that is fit and controlled for sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa mthar thug pa skyo ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyud thag ring du song bar gyur pa yang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la snying rje chen po sngon du
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa mthar thug pa skyo ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyud thag ring du song bar gyur pa yang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la snying rje chen po sngon du
translated: Noble śrāvakas who have realized the truth of suffering, who are at the end of the continuum, whose minds are filled with disgust, and who have gone far away, also have great compassion for sentient beings.🔽

original: 'gro ba'i sems kyis sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rnam pa brgya rtsa bcur 'dus pa yang dag par mthong nas 'jug pa de ltar mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sems kyis sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rnam pa brgya rtsa bcur 'dus pa yang dag par mthong nas 'jug pa de ltar mi 'jug go //
translated: The noble disciple who has realized the truth of suffering, who has reached the end, whose mind is filled with disgust, whose stream of consciousness has gone far, does not engage in the great mass of suffering in the same way that the bodhisattva does, who sees the hundred and ten kinds of suffering of beings and engages in them with a mind preceded by great compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar snying rjes yid yongs su bsgos pa ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po gang ci yang yongs su mi gtong ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar snying rjes yid yongs su bsgos pa ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po gang ci yang yongs su mi gtong ba med do //
translated: The bodhisattva, whose mind is completely suffused with compassion, does not hold back anything at all, either inner or outer, that he should not give.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gang yang dag par len par mi byed pa de med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gang yang dag par len par mi byed pa de med do //
translated: There is nothing at all that he should not take up as a vow of morality.

original: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la gang mi bzod pa de ci yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la gang mi bzod pa de ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing at all that he should not endure when others do harm.

original: brtson 'grus gang mi rtsom pa de med do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang mi rtsom pa de med do //
translated: There is nothing at all that he should not strive for.

original: bsam gtan gang la snyoms par mi 'jug pa de med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gang la snyoms par mi 'jug pa de med do //
translated: There is no concentration in which he does not become absorbed.

original: shes rab gang la mi 'jug pa de med do //
analyzed: shes rab gang la mi 'jug pa de med do //
translated: There is no wisdom in which he does not become engaged.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub gang la gnas zhes zhus na /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub gang la gnas zhes zhus na /
translated: Therefore, when asked, “In what does the enlightenment of the bodhisattvas in the buddha-families consist? ”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub ni snying rje la gnas so zhes yang dag par lung ston pas lung ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub ni snying rje la gnas so zhes yang dag par lung ston pas lung ston par mdzad do //
translated: the Tathāgatas give the following answer: “The enlightenment of the bodhisattvas consists in compassion. ”

original: de la 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i tshad med pa re re zhing ji skad bstan pa ni tshad med pa phun sum tshogs pas phun sum tshogs par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i tshad med pa re re zhing ji skad bstan pa ni tshad med pa phun sum tshogs pas phun sum tshogs par 'jug ste /
translated: Here, each of the bodhisattvas’ immeasurables is taught as being fulfilled by the fulfillment of the immeasurables.

original: sdud pa'i 'bras bu tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin cing rnam pa gcig tu nges par dge zhing kha na ma tho ba med pa tshad med pa dag gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdud pa'i 'bras bu tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin cing rnam pa gcig tu nges par dge zhing kha na ma tho ba med pa tshad med pa dag gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He enters them by embracing the immeasurable results of their accumulation and by engaging in them with immeasurable, single-minded, virtuous, and irreproachable actions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshad med bsgom pa la brtson pa la ni phan yon bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /🔽de tshad med pa sgom pa de ni thog ma kho nar tshe 'di la bde ba mchog la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bsam pa brtan par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar tshad med bsgom pa la brtson pa la ni phan yon bzhi yod par rig par bya ste / de tshad med pa sgom pa de ni thog ma kho nar tshe 'di la bde ba mchog la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bsam pa brtan par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: One should know that the bodhisattva who is thus striving to cultivate the immeasurables has four benefits.

original: sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir 'khor ba na sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su len par 'gyur ba'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las mchod pa dang / bsten pa dang / tshad med pa'i le'u ste bcu drug pa'o /🔽// / bam po @133a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir 'khor ba na sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su len par 'gyur ba'o // byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las mchod pa dang / bsten pa dang / tshad med pa'i le'u ste bcu drug pa'o / // / bam po @133a * //
translated: That cultivation of the immeasurables is, to begin with, a state of supreme happiness in this life; it is the acquisition and increase of immeasurable stores of merit; it is the firm intention for unexcelled perfect enlightenment; and it is the undertaking of all suffering in cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa /
translated: This concludes the chapter on worship, service, and the immeasurables, the sixteenth in the section on yogic practice that is the foundation of the bodhisattva training, from the Treatise on the Stages of the Bodhisattva’s Cultivation of Bodhicitta.

original: sdom ni / ngo tsha brtan dang mi skyo dang // de bzhin bstan bcos 'jig rten shes //
analyzed: sdom ni / ngo tsha brtan dang mi skyo dang // de bzhin bstan bcos 'jig rten shes //
translated: The summary verse: Shame, firmness, indefatigability, and likewise knowledge of the treatises and the world,🔽skill in liberative art, and likewise the four knowledges, the equipment, the factors of enlightenment,🔽calmness and insight, skill in the means, the powers, the strengths, the factors of enlightenment,

original: legs par ston par byed pa dang // de bzhin so so yang dag rig / tshogs dang byang chub phyogs rnams dang // zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong dang // thabs la yang ni mkhas pa dang // gzungs rnams dang ni smon lam dang // ting 'dzin gsum du shes par bya //
analyzed: legs par ston par byed pa dang // de bzhin so so yang dag rig / tshogs dang byang chub phyogs rnams dang // zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong dang // thabs la yang ni mkhas pa dang // gzungs rnams dang ni smon lam dang // ting 'dzin gsum du shes par bya //
translated: the perfections, the stages, the vows, the superknowledges, and the three knowledges.

original: chos kyi mdo ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: chos kyi mdo ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The summary verse: The Dharma is fourfold.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the shame and abashment of the bodhisattvas?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as twofold:

original: ngo bo nyid dang gnas so ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gnas so ;
translated: natural and conventional.

original: ; byang chub sems dpa' kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pa na bdag gi cha ma yin par shes nas 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
analyzed: ; byang chub sems dpa' kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pa na bdag gi cha ma yin par shes nas 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
translated: When the bodhisattva, engaging in some misdeed, recognizes it as unseemly for himself, that is shame.

original: de nyid la gzhan dag la 'jigs shing gus pas 'dzem pa ni khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gzhan dag la 'jigs shing gus pas 'dzem pa ni khrel yod pa'o //
translated: Shame is the fear of and respect for others, and the avoidance of evil because of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dzem pa de yang rang bzhin gyis shas che ba yin na goms pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dzem pa de yang rang bzhin gyis shas che ba yin na goms pa lta ci smos te /
translated: And that shame of the bodhisattva is by nature very strong, not to speak of when it is cultivated.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the nature of the bodhisattva's shame and embarrassment.

original: gnas ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The basis is fourfold in brief.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba la nan tan mi byed pa la 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni gnas dang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba la nan tan mi byed pa la 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni gnas dang po'o //
translated: The first basis is the shame of not applying oneself to the bodhisattva deeds.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ma yin pa la nan tan byed pa la 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni gnas gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ma yin pa la nan tan byed pa la 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni gnas gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second basis is the shame of applying oneself to what is not the bodhisattva deeds.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi sdig pa 'chab pa la 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni gnas gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi sdig pa 'chab pa la 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni gnas gsum pa'o //
translated: The third basis is the shame of concealing one's own evil.🔽The fourth basis is the shame of not enduring suffering.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa skyes pa ston pa dang bcas pa zhar las byung ba la 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni gnas bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa skyes pa ston pa dang bcas pa zhar las byung ba la 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni gnas bzhi pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the bodhisattva's shame in the arising of desire for his own self and in the arising of the faults that accompany it is the fourth abode.

original: gnas de ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the way in which the four abodes should be understood.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's generation of the power of firmness?

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as twofold:

original: ngo bo nyid dang gnas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gnas so //
translated: in its intrinsic nature and in its basis.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems yang dag par sdom pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i ngang tshul can nyid dang / 'jigs shing skrag pa rnam pa sna tshogs mang po mi bzad pa mngon du byung ba dag gis kyang yang dag par sbyor ba las mi g-yo ba dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems yang dag par sdom pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i ngang tshul can nyid dang / 'jigs shing skrag pa rnam pa sna tshogs mang po mi bzad pa mngon du byung ba dag gis kyang yang dag par sbyor ba las mi g-yo ba dang /
translated: It is the restraint of the defiled mind, the non-subjection to the passions, the attitude of accepting suffering, the unshakability of right practice by the occurrence of many kinds of fear and terror,

original: rang bzhin gyis snying stobs dang @133b ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis snying stobs dang @133b ldan pa'am /
translated: and the natural possession of courage.

original: so sor brtags pas brtan pa 'di ni brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas brtan pa 'di ni brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This steadfastness through analysis should be known as the essence of the bodhisattva's power of steadfastness.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa de'i gnas ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa de'i gnas ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The bases of the bodhisattva's power of steadfastness are to be known in brief as fivefold.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang phrad pa dang ; 'dul ba las gyur pa'i log par 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / yun ring por sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir 'khor ba khas blangs pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba dag gis nyams bskyod kyang 'khor phal po che'i nang du chos ston pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang phrad pa dang ; 'dul ba las gyur pa'i log par 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / yun ring por sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir 'khor ba khas blangs pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba dag gis nyams bskyod kyang 'khor phal po che'i nang du chos ston pa dang /
translated: They are the various sufferings of samsara that one encounters, the various wrongdoings that occur in the process of disciplining oneself, the long duration of samsara that one accepts for the sake of beings, the teaching of the Dharma in the midst of a great assembly even when one is disturbed by adversaries,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad khas blangs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad khas blangs te /
translated: and the acceptance of all the bases of training of the bodhisattvas.

original: rgya che zhing zab pa'i chos nyan pa ni gnas lnga par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya che zhing zab pa'i chos nyan pa ni gnas lnga par rig par bya'o //
translated: Listening to the extensive and profound Dharma should be known as the fifth base.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad la rgyu lngas yid yongs su mi skyo bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad la rgyu lngas yid yongs su mi skyo bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattvas’ indefatigability should be understood as fivefold in its causes,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis stobs dang ldan pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis stobs dang ldan pa yin te ;
translated: Here the bodhisattva is naturally strong,

original: des na yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore does not become fatigued.

original: yang des yid yongs su mi skyo ba de nyid yang dang yang du goms par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: yang des yid yongs su mi skyo ba de nyid yang dang yang du goms par byas pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, he has repeatedly cultivated that very indefatigability,

original: des na yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore does not become fatigued.

original: yang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is endowed with the practice of effort that is supported by means,

original: des na snga phyi bye brag yang dag par mthong bas yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na snga phyi bye brag yang dag par mthong bas yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore does not become fatigued, seeing the difference between former and later.

original: shes rab kyis so sor rtog pa'i stobs drag po dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis so sor rtog pa'i stobs drag po dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He is endowed with the power of discernment through wisdom,

original: des na yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore does not become fatigued.

original: sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' de'i snying rje'i sems dang snying brtse ba'i sems drag po rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' de'i snying rje'i sems dang snying brtse ba'i sems drag po rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva’s mind of compassion and mind of loving kindness remain constantly and uninterruptedly present for sentient beings.

original: des na yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he does not become weary.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bstan bcos shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bstan bcos shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s knowledge of the treatises?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag las brtsams te /
translated: Here the bodhisattva, beginning with the five sciences,

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i chos gzhan las legs par bzung ste /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i chos gzhan las legs par bzung ste /
translated: learns the Dharma that is endowed with the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters.

original: kha don legs par byang ba yin /
analyzed: kha don legs par byang ba yin /
translated: He recites it well.

original: chos kyi don de nyid kyang gzhan las legs par thos pa yin /
analyzed: chos kyi don de nyid kyang gzhan las legs par thos pa yin /
translated: He hears the meaning of the Dharma well from another.

original: yang na bdag nyid kyis lags par bsams shing /
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyis lags par bsams shing /
translated: Or he himself thinks well and

original: legs par brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: legs par brtags pa yin te /
translated: examines well.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos shes shing don shes pas chos dang don @134a * //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos shes shing don shes pas chos dang don @134a * //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, knowing the Dharma and knowing the meaning,

original: de nyid mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir dang / chos dang don gyi bye brag sar pa sar pa dag gong nas gong du shes par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba mi gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir dang / chos dang don gyi bye brag sar pa sar pa dag gong nas gong du shes par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba mi gtong ba yin no //
translated: In order not to forget that, and in order to know more and more of the particulars of the Dharma and its import, he does not give up the application.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i mthar thug pa des chos dang don de la dus gzhan na yongs su smin par byas pa'i dad pa thob pa yang yin te /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i mthar thug pa des chos dang don de la dus gzhan na yongs su smin par byas pa'i dad pa thob pa yang yin te /
translated: By the culmination of his hearing and reflection, he attains faith in that Dharma and its import, which is matured over a period of time.

original: rnam pa de dag gis na byang chub sems dpa'i bstan bcos shes pa tshad med pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis na byang chub sems dpa'i bstan bcos shes pa tshad med pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: By these aspects, the bodhisattva's knowledge of the treatises should be known as immeasurable, complete, and unerring.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'jig rten shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i 'jig rten shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's knowledge of the world?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi 'jig rten las brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi 'jig rten las brtsams nas /
translated: Here the bodhisattva, beginning with the world of sentient beings,

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: knows it as it is in reality.

original: kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni nyam nga bar zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni nyam nga bar zhugs pa ste /
translated: Alas, this world has entered a narrow path,

original: 'di ltar skye yang skye /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye yang skye /
translated: for it is born and born again.

original: rga yang rga /🔽'chi yang 'chi /
analyzed: rga yang rga / 'chi yang 'chi /
translated: They age and age,🔽they die and die,

original: 'chi 'pho yang 'chi 'pho /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho yang 'chi 'pho /
translated: they transmigrate and transmigrate,

original: skye yang skye mod kyi /
analyzed: skye yang skye mod kyi /
translated: they are born and are born.

original: 'on kyang sems can 'di dag ni rga shi'i 'og tu nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so snyam mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can 'di dag ni rga shi'i 'og tu nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so snyam mo //
translated: But these beings do not know the definite escape from old age and death as it really is.

original: yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, he knows as it really is the time of the world when the five degenerations are predominant, the time of the world when there is no degeneration, and the time of the world when there is a little degeneration.

original: tshe'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / dus kyi snyigs ma ste /
analyzed: tshe'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma dang / nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / dus kyi snyigs ma ste /
translated: The five degenerations are the degeneration of life, the degeneration of sentient beings, the degeneration of afflictions, the degeneration of view, and the degeneration of time.

original: snyigs ma lnga po dag las brtsams nas sems can gyi 'jig rten nyid kyi snyigs ma shas che ba'i dus dang / snyigs ma med pa'i dus dang / snyigs ma shas chung ba'i dus kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga po dag las brtsams nas sems can gyi 'jig rten nyid kyi snyigs ma shas che ba'i dus dang / snyigs ma med pa'i dus dang / snyigs ma shas chung ba'i dus kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te / 'di lta ste /
translated: He knows as it really is the time of the world when the five degenerations are predominant, the time of the world when there is no degeneration, and the time of the world when there is a little degeneration.

original: da ltar gyi mi rnams ni 'tsho ba'i yun thung ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi mi rnams ni 'tsho ba'i yun thung ste /
translated: For example, the lifespan of humans now is short.

original: gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des kyang lo brgya thub par zad do //
analyzed: gang yun ring du 'tsho ba des kyang lo brgya thub par zad do //
translated: Those who live a long time live one hundred years.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: da ltar gyi sems can dag ni phal cher phar mi 'dzin pa /🔽mar mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: da ltar gyi sems can dag ni phal cher phar mi 'dzin pa / mar mi 'dzin pa /
translated: Most sentient beings of the present day do not hold their fathers as authorities.🔽They do not hold their mothers as authorities.

original: dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa /🔽bram zer mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa / bram zer mi 'dzin pa /
translated: They do not hold ascetics as authorities.🔽They do not hold brahmins as authorities.

original: rigs kyi gtso bo la rim gro mi byed pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi gtso bo la rim gro mi byed pa /
translated: They do not honor the chief of the clan.

original: don du 'gyur bar mi byed pa /
analyzed: don du 'gyur bar mi byed pa /
translated: They do not act for the benefit of others.

original: bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa /
analyzed: bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa /
translated: They do not do what is right.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par mi lta ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs par mi lta ba /
translated: They do not see the faults of this world and the next world.

original: sbyin pa dag mi byed pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa dag mi byed pa /
translated: They do not give gifts.

original: bsod nams dag mi byed pa /🔽bsnyen te gnas pa la nye bar mi gnas pa /
analyzed: bsod nams dag mi byed pa / bsnyen te gnas pa la nye bar mi gnas pa /
translated: They do not make merit.🔽They do not live in the presence of a spiritual teacher.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te mi 'dug pa sha stag go //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te mi 'dug pa sha stag go //
translated: They do not sit down after taking up ethical discipline.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: da ltar phal cher chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pa dang / mi mthun @134b pas chags pa dang / mtshon cha thogs pa dang / dbyig pa thogs pa dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / rtsod pa dang /
analyzed: da ltar phal cher chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pa dang / mi mthun @134b pas chags pa dang / mtshon cha thogs pa dang / dbyig pa thogs pa dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / rtsod pa dang /
translated: Now, most people are attached to what is not Dharma, attached to what is not in accord, carry weapons, carry sticks, fight, find fault, quarrel, dispute,

original: g-yo ba dang / 'drid pa dang / mi srun pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / lag pa'i chos su gtogs pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma dag snang ngo //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang / 'drid pa dang / mi srun pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / lag pa'i chos su gtogs pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma dag snang ngo // 'di lta ste /
translated: are deceitful, deceptive, untamed, lie, and engage in many kinds of sinful, non-virtuous activities.

original: da ltar dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur ba dang / dam pa'i chos nub par 'gyur ba'i dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa mang po log pa'i chos kyi don dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba dag byung ngo //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: da ltar dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur ba dang / dam pa'i chos nub par 'gyur ba'i dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa mang po log pa'i chos kyi don dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba dag byung ngo // 'di lta ste /
translated: Now, many counterfeit Dharmas have appeared, which are not the Dharma but seem to be the Dharma, and which are preceded by the analysis of the meaning of false Dharma.

original: da ltar mu ge'i bar gyi bskal pa dag nye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar mu ge'i bar gyi bskal pa dag nye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Now, the eon of famine is approaching.

original: mu ge phal cher snang ngo //
analyzed: mu ge phal cher snang ngo //
translated: Famine is mostly seen.

original: nad kyi bar gyi bskal pa yang nye bar 'gyur te nad rnams phal cher snang ngo //🔽mtshon gyi bar gyi bskal pa yang nye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nad kyi bar gyi bskal pa yang nye bar 'gyur te nad rnams phal cher snang ngo // mtshon gyi bar gyi bskal pa yang nye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The intermediate aeon of sickness is approaching, for sickness is becoming more and more prevalent.

original: mtshon chas byas pa'i srog gcod pa dag phal cher snang ste sngon ni de lta bu ma byung ngo zhes bya ba ste /🔽de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gyi 'jig rten las brtsams te /🔽'jig rten shes pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshon chas byas pa'i srog gcod pa dag phal cher snang ste sngon ni de lta bu ma byung ngo zhes bya ba ste / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gyi 'jig rten las brtsams te / 'jig rten shes pa yin no //
translated: The intermediate aeon of weapons is approaching, for killing by weapons is becoming more and more prevalent, whereas it did not exist before.🔽Thus the bodhisattva knows the world of beings in terms of the world of the container.🔽Moreover, the bodhisattva knows the world of the container in terms of the destruction and evolution of the world of the container.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten ji ltar 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten ji ltar 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the destruction and evolution of the world of the container as it really is.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten kun 'byung dang / 'jig rten 'gog pa dang / 'jig rten kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam dang / 'jig rten 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam dang / 'jig rten gyi ro myang ba dang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten kun 'byung dang / 'jig rten 'gog pa dang / 'jig rten kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam dang / 'jig rten 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam dang / 'jig rten gyi ro myang ba dang /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva knows the world, the origin of the world, the cessation of the world, the path leading to the cessation of the world, the enjoyment of the world,

original: nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so ;
analyzed: nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so ;
translated: the danger in the world, and the escape from the world, just as they are.

original: ; yang byang chub sems dpa'i mig dang yid kyi bar dang / phung po gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa ni mi'i lus te de tsam la mi nyid ces bya'o //🔽de la bdag gam /
analyzed: ; yang byang chub sems dpa'i mig dang yid kyi bar dang / phung po gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa ni mi'i lus te de tsam la mi nyid ces bya'o // de la bdag gam /
translated: Moreover, the human body is the eye and the mind of the bodhisattva, the non-material aggregates, and what is derived from the four great elements. That much is called “human.”

original: sems can zhes bya ba'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni 'du shes tsam kho nar zad do //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni 'du shes tsam kho nar zad do //
translated: In that regard, the notion of “self” or “sentient being” is just a notion.

original: de la bdag gis ni mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la bdag gis ni mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo //
translated: In that regard, “I see forms with the eye.”

original: yid kyis chos rnams shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du dam 'cha' ba gang yin pa 'di ni dam 'cha' ba tsam kho nar zad do //
analyzed: yid kyis chos rnams shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du dam 'cha' ba gang yin pa 'di ni dam 'cha' ba tsam kho nar zad do //
translated: The claim that the mind cognizes phenomena is nothing but a claim.

original: de la 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa de ming ni 'di zhes bya /🔽rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa de ming ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: In this regard, the claim that the venerable one is named thus,🔽belongs to such and such a caste,

original: rus ni 'di @135a * //
analyzed: rus ni 'di @135a * //
translated: has such and such a family lineage,

original: zhes bya / kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: zhes bya / kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: eats such and such food,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /🔽tshe ni 'di tsam du ring /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong / tshe ni 'di tsam du ring /
translated: experiences such and such happiness and suffering,🔽has such and such a long life,

original: yun ni 'di srid du gnas gnas /
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid du gnas gnas /
translated: remains for such and such a long time,🔽and has such and such a life span—all of these are mere conventions.

original: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam mo zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gang yin pa 'di ni tha snyad tsam kho nar zad do zhes thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam mo zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gang yin pa 'di ni tha snyad tsam kho nar zad do zhes thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way, everything is known as it truly is, as mere conventions.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' des sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten rtag pa'i don brgyad dang / 'jig rten gyi don dam pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' des sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten rtag pa'i don brgyad dang / 'jig rten gyi don dam pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva knows the engagement of the world of sentient beings, the engagement of the world of the physical cosmos, the eight topics of the world, and the ultimate truth of the world just as it is.

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang byang chub sems dpa' ni ches rgan pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya'o // yang byang chub sems dpa' ni ches rgan pa'am /
translated: Therefore, he is called the one who knows the world.

original: ches yon tan gyis khyad par du 'phags pa zhig mthong na legs par kun tu smra bar byed /
analyzed: ches yon tan gyis khyad par du 'phags pa zhig mthong na legs par kun tu smra bar byed /
translated: Moreover, when the bodhisattva sees someone who is much older than himself or who is superior in terms of good qualities,🔽he greets him with proper words.

original: langs te stan stobs par byed /
analyzed: langs te stan stobs par byed /
translated: He stands up and offers him a seat.

original: gus par smra zhing phyag 'tshal ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang ; 'dud pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: gus par smra zhing phyag 'tshal ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang ; 'dud pa'i las byed do //
translated: He speaks respectfully and bows down to him, rises up to greet him, puts his palms together in respect, and bows to him.

original: yang na na tshod dang yon tan dag gis mtshungs pa zhig mthong na ni /🔽'jam pa dang / mnyen pa'i tshig gis lags par smra bar byed /
analyzed: yang na na tshod dang yon tan dag gis mtshungs pa zhig mthong na ni / 'jam pa dang / mnyen pa'i tshig gis lags par smra bar byed /
translated: When he sees someone who is equal to him in age and good qualities,🔽he greets him with gentle and soft words.

original: kun du smra bar byed /
analyzed: kun du smra bar byed /
translated: He speaks to him and converses with him.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed kyi /🔽nga rgyal la brten nas /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed kyi / nga rgyal la brten nas /
translated: He or she is truly joyful.🔽But he or she does not, on the basis of pride,

original: de dang bdag yongs su dpog par ni mi byed do //
analyzed: de dang bdag yongs su dpog par ni mi byed do //
translated: compete with others.

original: yang na na tshod dang yon tan dag gis dma' ba zhig mthong na yon tan skyed pa las brtsams te nus pa bzhin du spro ba skyed par byed /
analyzed: yang na na tshod dang yon tan dag gis dma' ba zhig mthong na yon tan skyed pa las brtsams te nus pa bzhin du spro ba skyed par byed /
translated: Or, if he or she sees someone who is younger or who has fewer good qualities, he or she encourages him or her to develop good qualities, as is appropriate, and generates enthusiasm.

original: de'i yang dag pa'i yon tan chung ngu yang brjod par byed /
analyzed: de'i yang dag pa'i yon tan chung ngu yang brjod par byed /
translated: He or she mentions even small good qualities that the other person has.

original: gang gis de gnod par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yang dag pa yang 'chab par byed de /
analyzed: gang gis de gnod par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa yang dag pa yang 'chab par byed de /
translated: He or she conceals the other’s genuine faults, which might cause the other to be harmed,

original: sgrogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: sgrogs par mi byed do //
translated: and does not make them public.

original: de la brnyas par yang mi byed do //🔽chos dang zang zing 'ga' zhig 'dod na yang de shes nas /
analyzed: de la brnyas par yang mi byed do // chos dang zang zing 'ga' zhig 'dod na yang de shes nas /
translated: He or she does not despise the other.

original: phyir phyogs shing khro gnyer mi byed do //🔽de la 'khrul pa la yang 'phyas mi byed /
