analyzed: phyir phyogs shing khro gnyer mi byed do // de la 'khrul pa la yang 'phyas mi byed /
translated: If the other person wants something, whether it is Dharma teachings or material things, he or she does not turn the other away or show an angry face.🔽He or she does not mock the other’s mistakes.

original: dmas pa la yang brnyas par mi byed do //
analyzed: dmas pa la yang brnyas par mi byed do //
translated: He or she does not despise the other for being weak.

original: de bzhin du dma' ba dang / mtshungs pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems can thams cad la yang gsong por smra zhing tshur shog / bde bar 'ongs so zhes smras la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dma' ba dang / mtshungs pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems can thams cad la yang gsong por smra zhing tshur shog / bde bar 'ongs so zhes smras la /
translated: In the same way, he speaks pleasantly to all sentient beings, whether they are inferior, equal, or superior to him.

original: legs par ngal sor 'jug ste /
analyzed: legs par ngal sor 'jug ste /
translated: He welcomes them and makes them feel at ease.

original: yang dag par chos dang zang zing gis ci nus kyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par chos dang zang zing gis ci nus kyis sdud par byed do //
translated: He gathers them together with the Dharma and material things, to the best of his abilities.

original: sems can rnams la gya gyus drod mi zin pa dang ldan par mi byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gya gyus drod mi zin pa dang ldan par mi byed /
translated: He does not deceive sentient beings.

original: @135b thos pa'i khyad par 'ga' tsam gyis kyang 'gying bar mi byed do //🔽sems can bsdus pa bzhin du nad pa'am /
analyzed: @135b thos pa'i khyad par 'ga' tsam gyis kyang 'gying bar mi byed do // sems can bsdus pa bzhin du nad pa'am /
translated: He does not become arrogant because of some slight distinction in learning.🔽He does not neglect to help anyone, whether sick or well,

original: tha mal pa la yang rung ste /
analyzed: tha mal pa la yang rung ste /
translated: whether they are sentient beings who are gathered together or not.

original: yo byad thams cad dang mthun pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyis kyang yal bar mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: yo byad thams cad dang mthun pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyis kyang yal bar mi 'dor ro //
translated: He does not neglect to help anyone, whether through physical or verbal actions, with any kind of material support.

original: 'dris pa la ji lta ba bzhin du ma 'dris pa la yang de kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dris pa la ji lta ba bzhin du ma 'dris pa la yang de kho na bzhin no //
translated: He is friendly to those who are not friendly, just as he is to those who are friendly.

original: thams cad kyang mdza' bo dang 'grogs par byed de /
analyzed: thams cad kyang mdza' bo dang 'grogs par byed de /
translated: He is friendly to all.

original: phyir rgol ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: like a person who has no enemies.

original: sems can mgon med cing rten pa med pa thams cad kyis bya ba ci nus ci lcogs kyis byed do //
analyzed: sems can mgon med cing rten pa med pa thams cad kyis bya ba ci nus ci lcogs kyis byed do //
translated: He does whatever he can to help all those who are helpless and without a protector.

original: 'di dag thang cig tsam yang mi bde bar gnas kyang ci ma rung snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di dag thang cig tsam yang mi bde bar gnas kyang ci ma rung snyam nas /
translated: He thinks, “How wonderful it would be if they were not unhappy even for a moment!”

original: rnam grangs gang gis kyang gzhan dag la sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba sgrub par mi byed do //🔽de nyid rkyen du byas te gnas dag dang dgod par byed na yang ran par dgod par byed kyi /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis kyang gzhan dag la sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba sgrub par mi byed do // de nyid rkyen du byas te gnas dag dang dgod par byed na yang ran par dgod par byed kyi /
translated: He does not cause suffering or unhappiness to others by any means.🔽Even when he is angry, he does not say anything that is not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ma 'ongs par dgod par mi byed do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs par dgod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not speak in a way that is disagreeable to others.

original: skyon mi 'byung zhing mchog tu yid brtan par gyur pa'i grogs po dag la yang tshogs par mi dbyung ba'i tshig rjod par mi byed do //
analyzed: skyon mi 'byung zhing mchog tu yid brtan par gyur pa'i grogs po dag la yang tshogs par mi dbyung ba'i tshig rjod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not speak words that are divisive even to his closest friends.

original: gzhan dag la yun ring du khro bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yun ring du khro bar yang mi byed do //
translated: He does not remain angry with others for a long time.

original: khros su zin kyang gzhan dag gi mtshang sgrogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: khros su zin kyang gzhan dag gi mtshang sgrogs par mi byed do //
translated: Even when he is angry, he does not reveal the faults of others.

original: gzhan dag gis lus dang ngag gis bstings su zin kyang so sor brtags nas chos nyid la ston tam /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis lus dang ngag gis bstings su zin kyang so sor brtags nas chos nyid la ston tam /
translated: Others, even though they are honored with body and speech, are taught the Dharma after being examined.

original: yang na bdag nyid kyi lan bon yin par lta bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyi lan bon yin par lta bar byed do //
translated: Or they are regarded as their own disciples.

original: sems brtan zhing mi rgod pa yin /
analyzed: sems brtan zhing mi rgod pa yin /
translated: They have a stable mind, not a fickle mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi rgyu ba brtan pa yin /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi rgyu ba brtan pa yin /
translated: They have a stable movement of body, speech, and mind.🔽They are free from the fourteen impure activities.

original: dri ma'i las kyi mtha' bcu bzhi dang bral ba yin phyogs drug gis bkab pa yin /
analyzed: dri ma'i las kyi mtha' bcu bzhi dang bral ba yin phyogs drug gis bkab pa yin /
translated: They are covered by the six directions.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po bzhis spangs pa yin /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po bzhis spangs pa yin /
translated: They are free from the four bad friends.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzhis yongs su bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzhis yongs su bzung ba yin te /
translated: They are taken care of by the four good friends.

original: de dag thams cad kyang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these should be understood as they are described in the sutras.

original: tshe 'di la phan pa'i phyir longs spyod dang ldan pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la phan pa'i phyir longs spyod dang ldan pa las brtsams te /
translated: For the sake of benefiting this life, they begin with the enjoyment of wealth.

original: sgrub phod pa dang / kun nas bsrung ba dang ldan pa dang / mthun pas 'tsho ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas rnams la mkhas par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub phod pa dang / kun nas bsrung ba dang ldan pa dang / mthun pas 'tsho ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang / las kyi gnas rnams la mkhas par gyur pa yin no //
translated: He is capable of practice, he is a protector, he lives in harmony, and he is skilled in worldly crafts and occupations.

original: g-yo dang sgyu med pa yin te /
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu med pa yin te /
translated: He is without deceit and guile.

original: pha rol 'drid pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol 'drid pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin no //
translated: He does not deceive others.

original: kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pa rnams la yang ngo tsha dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pa rnams la yang ngo tsha dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is ashamed of engaging in any wrongdoing.

original: spyod pa de lhur len cing bsrung bas na spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa @136a * //
analyzed: spyod pa de lhur len cing bsrung bas na spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa @136a * //
translated: He is perfect in conduct because he is intent on and protects that conduct.

original: yin no // gzhan gyi rdzas yid brtan te gtams pa la g-yo mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: yin no // gzhan gyi rdzas yid brtan te gtams pa la g-yo mi byed pa yin /
translated: He does not deceive about the property of others that is entrusted to him.

original: gzhan gyi bu lon chags pa la dor mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bu lon chags pa la dor mi byed pa yin /
translated: He does not deceive about debts owed to others.

original: bgo skal gcig pa la mi 'drid pa yin /🔽rin po che'am /
analyzed: bgo skal gcig pa la mi 'drid pa yin / rin po che'am /
translated: He does not deceive about a shared inheritance.

original: rin po cher smos pa man chad k'ar sh'a pa na yan chad la rmongs pa de la /
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa man chad k'ar sh'a pa na yan chad la rmongs pa de la /
translated: He does not deceive about gems or anything else that is valuable, from a precious gem down to a mere kārṣāpaṇa coin.

original: bslu ba dag gis mi bslu ba yin /
analyzed: bslu ba dag gis mi bslu ba yin /
translated: He does not deceive by cheating with weights and measures.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi tshul 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pa rnams la g-yar ba yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi tshul 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pa rnams la g-yar ba yin /
translated: In the same way, he borrows the ways of the world in order to help the world.

original: don bya ba de dang de dag la gzhan dag gis bcol na grogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: don bya ba de dang de dag la gzhan dag gis bcol na grogs su 'gro ste /
translated: When others ask him to do this or that, he goes to help them.

original: mi 'gyur zhing gtam rlung la skur bar mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhing gtam rlung la skur bar mi byed pa yin /
translated: He does not change his mind and does not send the message, “I won’t do it.”

original: las kyi mtha' bzang po dang ldan te /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' bzang po dang ldan te /
translated: He has good conduct.

original: las kyi mtha' ngan pa dang ldan pa ma yin /🔽yang rgyal po byed na yang chos bzhin du byed kyi /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ngan pa dang ldan pa ma yin / yang rgyal po byed na yang chos bzhin du byed kyi /
translated: He does not have bad conduct.🔽If he is a king, he acts according to the Dharma and not contrary to the Dharma.

original: chos ma yin pas mi byed pa dang / chad pas gcod pa la dga' bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas mi byed pa dang / chad pas gcod pa la dga' bar mi byed cing /
translated: He does not enjoy punishing people.

original: skye bo phal po che 'chal ba'i tshul khrims las bzlog nas /
analyzed: skye bo phal po che 'chal ba'i tshul khrims las bzlog nas /
translated: He turns many people away from immorality

original: tshul khrims dag la yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dag la yang dag par 'dzud par byed do //
translated: and establishes them in pure morality.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i tha snyad brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i tha snyad brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He has the eight noble ways of speaking.

original: mthong ba la mthong ngo zhes smra ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes so zhes smra ba dang / ma mthong ba la mthong ngo zhes smra ba dang / ma thos pa dang /
analyzed: mthong ba la mthong ngo zhes smra ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes so zhes smra ba dang / ma mthong ba la mthong ngo zhes smra ba dang / ma thos pa dang /
translated: It is to say I see when one sees, and to say I hear, I discriminate, and I cognize when one hears, discriminates, and cognizes, and to say I do not see when one does not see, and to say I do not hear, I do not discriminate, and I do not cognize when one does not hear, discriminate, and cognize.

original: bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa la rnam par ma shes so zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa la rnam par ma shes so zhes smra ba ste /
translated: To say I see when one sees, and to say I hear, I discriminate, and I cognize when one cognizes; and to say I do not see when one does not see, and to say I do not hear, I do not discriminate, and I do not cognize when one does not cognize.

original: de dag dang de lta bu dang mthun pa chos rnams dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten ji ltar shes par bya ba dang 'jig rten na ji ltar gnas par bya ba de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu
analyzed: de dag dang de lta bu dang mthun pa chos rnams dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten ji ltar shes par bya ba dang 'jig rten na ji ltar gnas par bya ba de dag thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses these and similar qualities knows the world as it truly is and abides in the world in a manner that is in accord with the world.

original: shes te / de lta bas na 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes te / de lta bas na 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the one who knows the world.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ston pa bzhi po dag la ji ltar sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ston pa bzhi po dag la ji ltar sbyor zhe na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva apply himself to the four modes of interpretation?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni don 'dod pa'i phyir gzhan las chos nyan par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni don 'dod pa'i phyir gzhan las chos nyan par byed kyi /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva listens to the Dharma from another person in order to understand the meaning,

original: tshig 'bru legs par sbyar bar 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig 'bru legs par sbyar bar 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: not in order to understand the verbal expression.

original: de don 'dod pa'i phyir chos nyan gyi /
analyzed: de don 'dod pa'i phyir chos nyan gyi /
translated: Because he listens to the Dharma in order to understand the meaning,

original: tshig 'bru 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin pas na /
analyzed: tshig 'bru 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin pas na /
translated: not in order to understand the verbal expression,

original: phal pa'i skad kyis chos ston na yang byang chub sems dpa' don la rton pa ni gus par byas te nyan par byed do //
analyzed: phal pa'i skad kyis chos ston na yang byang chub sems dpa' don la rton pa ni gus par byas te nyan par byed do //
translated: even if the Dharma is taught in a vulgar language, the bodhisattva who relies on the meaning listens respectfully.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva understands the teaching of the dark and the teaching of the great just as it is.

original: rab tu shes nas kyang rigs pa la ston par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab tu shes nas kyang rigs pa la ston par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Having understood, he teaches in accordance with reason,

original: gnas brtan @136b nam ;
analyzed: gnas brtan @136b nam ;
translated: not relying on the person,🔽thinking, “This Dharma was taught by the elder,

original: shes pa'i gang zag gam /
analyzed: shes pa'i gang zag gam /
translated: the one who has knowledge,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'am /🔽dge 'dun gyis chos 'di dag bshad do zhes gang zag la rton pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'am /🔽dge 'dun gyis chos 'di dag bshad do zhes gang zag la rton pa ma yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata,🔽or the Saṅgha.”

original: de ltar rigs pa la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa de ni de kho na'i don las mi g-yo zhing chos rnams la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa de ni de kho na'i don las mi g-yo zhing chos rnams la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus, one who relies on reasoning and not on the person does not stray from the meaning of reality and does not depend on others with regard to phenomena.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa zhen cing dga' ba zhen te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa zhen cing dga' ba zhen te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva has faith in and delights in the Tathagata.

original: gsung la gcig tu nges par mngon par dga' ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi /
analyzed: gsung la gcig tu nges par mngon par dga' ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi /
translated: He delights in the Tathagata's teachings with single-pointed certainty, and relies on the Tathagata's sutras of definitive meaning,

original: drang ba'i don la ma yin te /
analyzed: drang ba'i don la ma yin te /
translated: and not on those of provisional meaning.

original: nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton na /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton na /
translated: Relying on the sutras of definitive meaning,

original: chos 'dul ba 'di las mi 'phrogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'di las mi 'phrogs par 'gyur te /
translated: he is not carried away from this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: 'di ltar drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni sgo sna tshogs nas zhugs pa'i don gyi rnam par dbye ba ma nges pas the tshom skyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ni sgo sna tshogs nas zhugs pa'i don gyi rnam par dbye ba ma nges pas the tshom skyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the sutras of provisional meaning give rise to doubt because their meaning is not certain, since they are entered by way of various doors.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la yang nges pa med par gyur na ni de ltar na de chos 'dul ba 'di las 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la yang nges pa med par gyur na ni de ltar na de chos 'dul ba 'di las 'phrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a bodhisattva is not certain about the sutras of definitive meaning, then he is deprived of this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni rtogs pa'i ye shes la snying po lta ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni rtogs pa'i ye shes la snying po lta ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva views the wisdom of realization as the essence,

original: thos pa dang bsams pas chos dang don rnam par shes pa tsam la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pas chos dang don rnam par shes pa tsam la ni ma yin no //
translated: not just the knowledge of the Dharma and its meaning through hearing and reflection.

original: des bsgoms pa'i shes pas shes par bya ba gang yin pa de ni thos pa dang bsams pas don rnam par shes pa tsam gyis rnam par shes par mi nus par rig nas /
analyzed: des bsgoms pa'i shes pas shes par bya ba gang yin pa de ni thos pa dang bsams pas don rnam par shes pa tsam gyis rnam par shes par mi nus par rig nas /
translated: Knowing that what is to be known through the wisdom of meditation cannot be known through just the knowledge of the meaning of what is heard and reflected upon,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos mchog tu zab pa dag thos na yang spong bar mi byed cing skur pa mi 'debs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos mchog tu zab pa dag thos na yang spong bar mi byed cing skur pa mi 'debs te /
translated: even when hearing the extremely profound Dharmas taught by the Tathagata, he does not reject them or denigrate them.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ston pa bzhi po dag la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ston pa bzhi po dag la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva applies himself to these four teachers.

original: de ltar na legs par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na legs par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he is well-established.

original: ston pa bzhi po de dag las ni /🔽mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: ston pa bzhi po de dag las ni / mdor bsdu na /
translated: These four teachers🔽are summarized as four kinds of valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma nyid bzhi bstan te bstan pa'i don dang / rigs pa dang / ston pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i rtogs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid bzhi bstan te bstan pa'i don dang / rigs pa dang / ston pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i rtogs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: In brief, they are the valid knowledge of the teaching, the valid knowledge of reasoning, the valid knowledge of the teacher, and the valid knowledge of the wisdom arisen from meditation.

original: ston pa bzhi po thams cad kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i sbyor ba brtson pa la zhugs pa'i nges par 'byin par 'khrul pa med pa mngon par gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa bzhi po thams cad kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i sbyor ba brtson pa la zhugs pa'i nges par 'byin par 'khrul pa med pa mngon par gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: All four teachers make manifest the unerring deliverance of the bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of correct application.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na /🔽chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs thams cad la ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pas bsgoms pa las byung @137a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na / chos thams cad kyi rnam grangs thams cad la ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pas bsgoms pa las byung @137a * //
translated: What are the four kinds of correct understanding of the bodhisattvas?

original: ba'i shes pa thogs pa med cing mi zlogs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i shes pa thogs pa med cing mi zlogs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The unhindered and unobstructed knowledge arisen from meditation that knows all the categories of all phenomena, both as they are and as many as there are,🔽is the bodhisattvas’ correct understanding of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid thams cad la ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa thogs pa med cing mi zlogs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //🔽chos thams cad kyi nges pa'i ngag thams cad la ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa thogs pa med cing mi zlogs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid thams cad la ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa thogs pa med cing mi zlogs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi don so so yang dag par rig pa'o // chos thams cad kyi nges pa'i ngag thams cad la ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa thogs pa med cing mi zlogs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas that arises from meditation and is unobstructed and unimpeded with regard to all the characteristics and all the aspects of all things is their correct understanding of the meaning of all things.🔽The knowledge of the bodhisattvas that arises from meditation and is unobstructed and unimpeded with regard to all the etymologies of all things is their correct understanding of the etymologies of all things.

original: chos thams cad nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba thams cad la ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa thogs pa med cing mi zlogs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba thams cad la ji snyed yod pa dang / ji ltar yod pas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa thogs pa med cing mi zlogs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas that arises from meditation and is unobstructed and unimpeded with regard to all the aspects and all the divisions of all things is their correct understanding of the eloquence of all things.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po de dag la brten na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po de dag la brten na /
translated: Based on these four kinds of thorough knowledge of the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas lnga la mkhas pa dpag tu med par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas lnga la mkhas pa dpag tu med par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that the bodhisattvas’ expertise in the five topics becomes infinite.

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are expertise in the aggregates, expertise in the constituents and sensefields, expertise in dependent origination, and expertise in what is correct and incorrect.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni chos rnam pa 'di bzhis chos thams cad bdag nyid kyis legs par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni chos rnam pa 'di bzhis chos thams cad bdag nyid kyis legs par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur la /
translated: By means of these four topics, the bodhisattvas themselves fully and perfectly realize all phenomena,

original: gzhan dag la yang rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rab tu bstan te /
translated: and they also teach them to others.

original: de las gong na bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang med na /
analyzed: de las gong na bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang med na /
translated: There is nothing higher than this for them to realize themselves,

original: pha rol dag la rab tu bstan pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: pha rol dag la rab tu bstan pa lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could they teach others anything higher than this?

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ accumulation for enlightenment?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in two ways:

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //🔽tshogs rnam pa de gnyis kyi rgyas par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so // tshogs rnam pa de gnyis kyi rgyas par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of wisdom.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The detailed classification of these two accumulations should be understood as it is described in the chapter on the benefits of the bodhisattva collection.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs de yang bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la ni chung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs de yang bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la ni chung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva’s accumulation of merit and wisdom should be understood as small in the first incalculable eon,

original: gnyis pa la ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni 'bring ngo //
translated: medium in the second,

original: gsum pa la ni che bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni che bar rig par bya'o //
translated: and great in the third.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag la ji ltar sbyor bar byed ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag la ji ltar sbyor bar byed ce na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva apply him or herself to the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment?

original: 'di @137b la byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po dag la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di @137b la byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi po dag la brten nas /
translated: Here the bodhisattva, relying on the four kinds of analytical knowledge of the bodhisattva,

original: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i ye shes kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i ye shes kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: The wisdom that is embraced by skillful means correctly understands the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment just as they are.

original: de dag mngon sum du ni mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag mngon sum du ni mi byed do //
translated: But it does not actualize them.

original: des theg pa'i tshul rnam pa gnyis po nyan thos kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis kyang de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: des theg pa'i tshul rnam pa gnyis po nyan thos kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis kyang de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: It also correctly understands them by means of the two vehicles, the Śrāvaka Vehicle and the Great Vehicle.

original: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The correct understanding of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment by means of the Śrāvaka Vehicle is as follows.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las thams cad ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las thams cad ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: All of it should be understood just as it is taught in the Śrāvaka Levels.

original: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ji ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does a bodhisattva correctly understand the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment by means of the Great Vehicle?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas kyang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas kyang /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas observe the body in the body, but

original: lus la lus kyi dngos por rnam par rtog par mi byed la /
analyzed: lus la lus kyi dngos por rnam par rtog par mi byed la /
translated: they do not conceptualize the body as a real thing.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du med par yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du med par yang 'di lta ste /
translated: They do not even think that it is completely nonexistent.

original: lus brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos nyid de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa de ni de'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa don dam pa'o //
analyzed: lus brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos nyid de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa de ni de'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa don dam pa'o //
translated: They know the body’s reality, which is the inexpressible nature of things, just as it is. This is the ultimate form of the application of mindfulness that observes the body in the body.

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul du ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul du tshad mad pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul du ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul du tshad mad pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In terms of the relative, it should be understood that the application of mindfulness that observes the body in the body is the valid cognition that is possessed by bodhisattvas.

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the application of mindfulness that observes the body in the body,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa lhag ma rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //🔽de ni lus la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sdug bsngal lam /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa lhag ma rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o // de ni lus la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sdug bsngal lam /
translated: The remaining applications of mindfulness and the remaining factors of awakening should be understood in the same way.🔽He does not conceptualize the phenomena of the body, etc. as suffering,

original: kun 'byung bar yang rnam par mi rtog la /
analyzed: kun 'byung bar yang rnam par mi rtog la /
translated: or as the origin of suffering.

original: nges byas pa'i spong ba la yang 'gog par mi rtog go //
analyzed: nges byas pa'i spong ba la yang 'gog par mi rtog go //
translated: He does not conceptualize the abandonment that is accomplished as cessation.

original: de 'thob pa'i rgyu la yang lam du mi rtog la /
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i rgyu la yang lam du mi rtog la /
translated: He does not conceptualize the cause for attaining that as the path.

original: brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi chos nyid dang / kun 'byung gi chos nyid dang / 'gog pa'i chos nyid dang / lam gyi chos nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi chos nyid dang / kun 'byung gi chos nyid dang / 'gog pa'i chos nyid dang / lam gyi chos nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He also knows just as it is the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, the reality of cessation, and the reality of the path, which are the inexpressible essence of the phenomena of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: de ni de'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgoms pa don dam pa la brten nas bden pa bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgoms pa don dam pa la brten nas bden pa bsgom pa yin no //
translated: This is the cultivation of the truths based on the ultimate, the cultivation of the factors of awakening.

original: kun rdzob tu ni byang chub @138a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni byang chub @138a * //
translated: In terms of the conventional, the bodhisattva

original: sems dpa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i bsgom pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul tshad med pa shes pa dang ldan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i bsgom pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul tshad med pa shes pa dang ldan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is endowed with the knowledge of the immeasurable ways of positing the cultivation of the bodhisattva's meditative realization that takes the truths as its object.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag la de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa de ni de'i zhi gnas yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dag la de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa de ni de'i zhi gnas yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's non-discursive thought with regard to those dharmas should be regarded as his calm.

original: chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa don dam pa gang yin pa de dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul tshad med pa shes pa gang yin pa de ni de'i lhag mthong yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa don dam pa gang yin pa de dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul tshad med pa shes pa gang yin pa de ni de'i lhag mthong yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the ultimate, which is the correct understanding of dharmas just as they are, and the knowledge of the immeasurable ways of positing should be regarded as his insight.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's calm should be understood as being, in brief, of four kinds.

original: don dam pa dang ; brdar btags pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / don dam pa dang / brdar btags pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / spros pa'i 'du shes thams cad la lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa dang / brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam de la yang /
analyzed: don dam pa dang ; brdar btags pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / don dam pa dang / brdar btags pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / spros pa'i 'du shes thams cad la lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa dang / brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam de la yang /
translated: It is preceded by ultimate and conventional cognition, it is the result of ultimate and conventional cognition, it engages spontaneously with all conceptual notions of conceptual elaboration, and it is the nonconceptual gnosis that is the ultimate result of the path.🔽

original: mtshan ma med pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems zhi bas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig par 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems zhi bas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig par 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: It is preceded by ultimate and conventional cognition, it is the result of ultimate and conventional cognition, it is spontaneously engaged in all the discriminations of conceptual thought, and it is the nonconceptual mind of peace, which is the single taste of the equality of all phenomena, because of the absence of signs in that mere inexpressible thing.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas kyi lam ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes gzigs pa yongs su 'grub pa dang / yang dag par grub pa'i bar du 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas kyi lam ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes gzigs pa yongs su 'grub pa dang / yang dag par grub pa'i bar du 'jug go //
translated: These four aspects cause the bodhisattvas’ path of sustained calm to lead to the attainment of the vision of gnosis that is the unsurpassable, perfect, complete enlightenment and to the attainment of perfect buddhahood.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, bodhisattvas’ profound insight should be understood as being of four kinds.

original: zhi gnas sngon du 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi po de nyid dang / chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs par 'dzin pa'i ngan pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par 'dzin pa ngan pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs pa dang ; chos rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i lhag mthong yin te /
analyzed: zhi gnas sngon du 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi po de nyid dang / chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs par 'dzin pa'i ngan pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par 'dzin pa ngan pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs pa dang ; chos rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i lhag mthong yin te /
translated: These four kinds of insight are preceded by serenity, and they are insight endowed with the immeasurable modes of the arrangement of the differentiation of all things.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong gi lam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes gzigs pa yongs su 'grub pa dang / yang dag par 'thob pa'i bar du 'jug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong gi lam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes gzigs pa yongs su 'grub pa dang / yang dag par 'thob pa'i bar du 'jug ste /
translated: By means of these four aspects, the bodhisattvas enter into the path of insight, which is the cause for the attainment of the knowledge and vision of the supreme enlightenment.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mdor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mdor bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the brief teaching on the serenity and insight of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ skill in means?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha

original: nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub pa las brtsams te /
translated: and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha

analyzed: rnam pa drug @138b dang ; phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las brtsams te /
translated: and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha

original: rnam pa drug nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa drug nyid do //
translated: and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha

original: de la nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub pa las brtsams te /
translated: and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha🔽and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha🔽and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha🔽and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.

original: thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha🔽and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan par lta ba gang yin pa dang ; 'du byed thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes 'dod pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can thams cad la snying rje dang ldan par lta ba gang yin pa dang ; 'du byed thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes 'dod pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha

original: sems can la lta ba la brten nas /
analyzed: sems can la lta ba la brten nas /
translated: and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.🔽What is skill in means?🔽In brief, it is twelvefold.🔽It is sixfold in terms of the accomplishment of inner qualities of the Buddha🔽and sixfold in terms of the maturation of sentient beings.

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba gang yin pa dang / 'du byed rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba gang yin pa dang / 'du byed rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa la brten nas /
translated: It is the non-abandonment of samsara, and the wandering in samsara with a mind that is not defiled, on the basis of the correct knowledge of the conditioned forces.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor ba gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa la brten nas brtson 'grus 'bar ba gang yin pa ste /🔽'di ni nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor ba gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa la brten nas brtson 'grus 'bar ba gang yin pa ste / 'di ni nang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub pa las brtsams te /
translated: It is the blazing of effort on the basis of the desire for the knowledge of the Buddha.

original: thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de la phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug yin par rig par bya'o // de la phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba las brtsams te /
translated: This is the sixfold skill in means beginning with the internal accomplishment of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sixfold skill in means beginning with the external, the development of living beings?

original: thabs la mkhas pa gang gis byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu yang 'bras bu tshad med par sgyur bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du tshegs chung dus dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che zhing tshad med pa dag yang dag par skyed par byed cing nye bar sgrub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa gang gis byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu yang 'bras bu tshad med par sgyur bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du tshegs chung dus dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che zhing tshad med pa dag yang dag par skyed par byed cing nye bar sgrub par byed pa dang /
translated: Similarly, they cause them to correctly produce and accomplish vast and immeasurable roots of virtue with little difficulty.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi khong khro ba sel bar byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi khong khro ba sel bar byed la /
translated: Similarly, they eliminate the hostility of sentient beings toward the Buddha's teachings.

original: tha mal pa rnams ni 'dzud par byed /🔽zhugs pa rnams ni yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: tha mal pa rnams ni 'dzud par byed / zhugs pa rnams ni yongs su smin par byed /
translated: They cause ordinary beings to enter the teachings.🔽They ripen those who have entered the teachings.

original: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: And they liberate those who have been ripened.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du rnams 'bras bu tshad med par ji ltar sgyur bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du rnams 'bras bu tshad med par ji ltar sgyur bar byed ce na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas cause the roots of virtue of sentient beings to become immeasurable results even though they are small?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang su yang rung bas dngos po thams cad las tha na phye khyor gang tsam yang zhing tha chad kho na la spyin du 'jug cing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can gang su yang rung bas dngos po thams cad las tha na phye khyor gang tsam yang zhing tha chad kho na la spyin du 'jug cing /
translated: Here, any bodhisattva should cause any sentient being to give even as little as a handful of flour to the most wretched of fields.

original: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags 'byung po la sbyin du 'jug cing /🔽sbyin du bcug nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @139a * //
analyzed: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags 'byung po la sbyin du 'jug cing / sbyin du bcug nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @139a * //
translated: He should cause them to give even to a living being born in the animal realm.

original: tu yongs su bsngor 'jug ste /
analyzed: tu yongs su bsngor 'jug ste /
translated: Having caused them to give, he should cause them to dedicate the goodness to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dngos po dang zhing gis kyang chung mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba de dngos po dang zhing gis kyang chung mod kyi /
translated: In that way, although that wholesome root is small in terms of the thing and the field,

original: de yang yongs su bsngo ba'i dbang gis 'bras bu tshad med par bsgyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang yongs su bsngo ba'i dbang gis 'bras bu tshad med par bsgyur ba yin no //
translated: it is transformed into an immeasurable result by the power of the dedication.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshegs chung dus sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che zhing tshad med pa ji ltar skyed ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshegs chung dus sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che zhing tshad med pa ji ltar skyed ce na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas cause the wholesome roots of sentient beings to increase greatly with little difficulty?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can zla bar smyung zhing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can zla bar smyung zhing /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva should cause sentient beings to fast for a month.

original: kha zas mi za ba la sogs pa la mos pa rnams la 'phags pa'i bsnyen te gnas pa yan lag brgyad pa ston par byed de /🔽tshegs che zhing mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu can gyi bsnyen te gnas pa de las 'dun pa bzlog cing yang dag par blang ba tshegs chung zhing /
analyzed: kha zas mi za ba la sogs pa la mos pa rnams la 'phags pa'i bsnyen te gnas pa yan lag brgyad pa ston par byed de / tshegs che zhing mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu can gyi bsnyen te gnas pa de las 'dun pa bzlog cing yang dag par blang ba tshegs chung zhing /
translated: He teaches the eight-factored fast of the noble ones to those who are devoted to not eating food and so on.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i bsnyen te gnas pa la yang dag par 'dzud do //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i bsnyen te gnas pa la yang dag par 'dzud do //
translated: He turns them away from the fast which is difficult to practice and has an unattractive result, and he correctly introduces them to the fast which is easy to practice and has a great result.

original: de bzhin du sems can bdag nyid dub par bya ba'i sbyor ba la brtson pa /🔽thar pa 'dod la /🔽log par zhugs pa rnams la dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis dang bral ba ston cing de la 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can bdag nyid dub par bya ba'i sbyor ba la brtson pa / thar pa 'dod la / log par zhugs pa rnams la dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis dang bral ba ston cing de la 'dzud par byed do //

original: log par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba dang / phyi ma la yang tshegs med pa kho nar bde ba dang bcas /
analyzed: log par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba dang / phyi ma la yang tshegs med pa kho nar bde ba dang bcas /
translated: For sentient beings who have entered the wrong path, they will abide in happiness in this life and in the next life they will be endowed with happiness without difficulty.

original: yid bde ba dang bcas pas mtho ris su skye bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang bcas pas mtho ris su skye bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan yang dag par ston to //
translated: He teaches concentration to sentient beings who have entered wrongly, so that they will dwell in happiness in this life and, in the next life, will be born in the higher realms, with happiness and mental pleasure, and with no difficulty.

original: yang rig byed las 'byung ba'i gsang tshig lung nod cing kha ton du bya bas dag pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur bar mos pa'i sems can rnams sangs rgyas kyi bka' lung nod pa dang ; kha don bya ba dang / don sems pa la yang dag par 'dzud do //
analyzed: yang rig byed las 'byung ba'i gsang tshig lung nod cing kha ton du bya bas dag pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur bar mos pa'i sems can rnams sangs rgyas kyi bka' lung nod pa dang ; kha don bya ba dang / don sems pa la yang dag par 'dzud do //
translated: He correctly introduces sentient beings who believe that they will reach the ultimate purity by reciting and chanting the secret words of the Vedas to the Buddha’s words, to reciting and chanting them, and to reflecting on their meaning.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i chos rnams gzhan dag gis thos na ci nas shas cher skyo ba dang / ci nas shas cher dad pa skyed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar gsal bar byed cing ston par byed de /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i chos rnams gzhan dag gis thos na ci nas shas cher skyo ba dang / ci nas shas cher dad pa skyed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar gsal bar byed cing ston par byed de /
translated: He elucidates and teaches the profound Dharma of emptiness, which was taught by the Tathāgata, in such a way that others, when they hear it, will generate a great deal of disillusionment and a great deal of faith.

original: skad cig gcig tsam zhig skyo ba dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems de yang /
analyzed: skad cig gcig tsam zhig skyo ba dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa'i sems de yang /
translated: Even a single moment of a mind that is sad or happy

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po sdud pa'i grogs su 'gro na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po sdud pa'i grogs su 'gro na /
translated: if it becomes a support for gathering vast roots of virtue,

analyzed: rgyun chags su byung ba lta ci smos / yang byang chub sems dpa' ni dad pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas phyogs bcu dag gi 'jig rten @139b na me tog phreng dang / spos rnam pa sna tshogs rab mchog gya nom pa gang ci yang rung ba yod pa de dag gis sangs rgyas dang chos dang /
translated: what need is there to mention [a mind] that occurs continuously?

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog gsum la mchod par mos pa byed pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog gsum la mchod par mos pa byed pa /
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva, with a superior intention that is endowed with faith, imagines that whatever flowers, garlands, and various excellent supreme fragrances exist in the worlds of the ten directions are offerings to the Three Jewels of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: gzhan dag kyang mos pa byed du 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mos pa byed du 'jug go //
translated: He causes others to imagine that as well.

original: yang phyogs thams cad du dad pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de nyid kyis rgyas par byas nas /
analyzed: yang phyogs thams cad du dad pa dang ldan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de nyid kyis rgyas par byas nas /
translated: Having expanded that very superior intention that is endowed with faith in all directions,

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa thams cad la mngon par rjes su yi rang la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa thams cad la mngon par rjes su yi rang la /
translated: he rejoices in all offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: gzhan dag kyang rjes su yi rang bar byed du 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rjes su yi rang bar byed du 'jug go //
translated: He also causes others to rejoice.

original: yang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa'i bar du rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sgom par byed pa ;
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa'i bar du rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sgom par byed pa ;
translated: He always cultivates mindfulness of the Buddha, mindfulness of the Dharma, and so on up to mindfulness of the gods.

original: gzhan dag kyang yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: He also causes others to take up these practices.

original: yang yid la brjod pa dag gis dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal bas dus don yod par byed cing byed du 'jug go //
analyzed: yang yid la brjod pa dag gis dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal bas dus don yod par byed cing byed du 'jug go //
translated: He also causes others to make meaningful the time of those who pay homage to the Three Jewels with mental expressions.

original: yang sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar byed cing /
analyzed: yang sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar byed cing /
translated: He also rejoices in the merit of all sentient beings.

original: rjes su yi rang du 'jug go //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang du 'jug go //
translated: He also causes others to rejoice.

original: yang snying rje chen po la zhugs pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad bdag nyid kyis yang dag par len par byed la /
analyzed: yang snying rje chen po la zhugs pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad bdag nyid kyis yang dag par len par byed la /
translated: He also takes upon himself all the sufferings of all sentient beings, with a superior intention that is imbued with great compassion.

original: gzhan yang de nyid la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: He also causes others to take up this practice.

original: yang 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'khrul pa thams cad dang ; nyes pa thams cad dge zhing bslab par 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyogs thams cad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la so sor 'chags par byed la gzhan dag kyang de nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: yang 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'khrul pa thams cad dang ; nyes pa thams cad dge zhing bslab par 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis phyogs thams cad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la so sor 'chags par byed la gzhan dag kyang de nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: Moreover, with a mind that is virtuous and desirous of training, he confesses all his past and present errors and faults to the Blessed Buddhas in all directions, and he causes others to take up this very practice.

original: de de ltar rgyun mi 'chad par 'khrul pa so sor bshags na /
analyzed: de de ltar rgyun mi 'chad par 'khrul pa so sor bshags na /
translated: When he thus continuously confesses his errors,

original: tshegs chung dus las kyi sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshegs chung dus las kyi sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he is quickly freed from all karmic veils.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul can sems la dbang thob pa ni phyogs thams cad du sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la brten zhing /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul can sems la dbang thob pa ni phyogs thams cad du sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la brten zhing /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva who has attained magical power and mastery of mind causes immeasurable merit to be gathered by means of various kinds of emanations in all directions, in dependence upon the Buddha, the Dharma, and the religious community,

original: sems can la brten te /🔽sprul pa mang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsod nams dpag tu med pa sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sems can la brten te /🔽sprul pa mang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsod nams dpag tu med pa sdud par byed do //
translated: and in dependence upon sentient beings.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms sgom par byed la /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms sgom par byed la /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva cultivates loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: gzhan yang de nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /🔽de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni tshegs chung dus dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po @140a * //🔽dpag tu med pa'i 'bras bu can dag mngon par 'grub par byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni tshegs chung dus dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po @140a * // dpag tu med pa'i 'bras bu can dag mngon par 'grub par byed /
translated: Moreover, he causes others to take up these very practices.

original: yang dag par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub par byed do //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva accomplishes and causes others to accomplish the roots of virtue that have great results, immeasurable results, and results that are beyond compare.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi khong khro ba ni sel bar byed /🔽tha mal pa rnams ni 'dzud par byed /🔽zhugs pa rnams ni yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi khong khro ba ni sel bar byed / tha mal pa rnams ni 'dzud par byed / zhugs pa rnams ni yongs su smin par byed /
translated: How does the bodhisattva eliminate the hostility of beings who are hostile?🔽How does he cause those who are neutral to enter the Dharma?🔽How does he ripen those who have entered the Dharma?

original: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he liberate those who have been ripened?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems can gyi don rnam pa bzhi mngon par 'grub par byed pa 'di la yang mdor bsdu na thabs rnam pa drug kho na yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i sems can gyi don rnam pa bzhi mngon par 'grub par byed pa 'di la yang mdor bsdu na thabs rnam pa drug kho na yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: In this accomplishment of the four kinds of benefit for sentient beings by the bodhisattva, one should know that there are just six kinds of means in brief.

original: mthun pa dang / 'khyig cing sdod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i bsam pa dang / nan thur las byung ba dang / byams pa la lan glon pa dang / dag pa ni thabs drug pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa dang / 'khyig cing sdod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i bsam pa dang / nan thur las byung ba dang / byams pa la lan glon pa dang / dag pa ni thabs drug pa'o //
translated: They are the means of agreement, of coaxing and waiting, of having the same attitude, of arising from the same commitment, of repaying kindness, and of purity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i mthun pa'i thabs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i mthun pa'i thabs ni 'di yin te /
translated: The means of agreement is as follows.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gang dag la chos ston par 'dod pa de dag la thog ma kho nar lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa 'jam zhing mnyen pa dag dang / nye bar rab tu sbyin pa dang / mthun par 'jug pa'i kun du spyod pa dag gis bdag la spyod pa de dag gi khong khro ba sel bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gang dag la chos ston par 'dod pa de dag la thog ma kho nar lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa 'jam zhing mnyen pa dag dang / nye bar rab tu sbyin pa dang / mthun par 'jug pa'i kun du spyod pa dag gis bdag la spyod pa de dag gi khong khro ba sel bar byed de /
translated: Here the bodhisattva, in order to teach the Dharma to those sentient beings, first of all, by means of gentle and soft conduct of body and speech, by means of giving and by means of agreeable conduct, dispels their hostility toward himself.

original: khong khro ba bsal nas dga' ba dang gus pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: khong khro ba bsal nas dga' ba dang gus pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Having dispelled their anger, he generates their joy and respect.

original: dga' ba dang gus pa bskyed nas chos la 'dod pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: dga' ba dang gus pa bskyed nas chos la 'dod pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Having generated their joy and respect, he generates their desire for the Dharma.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag la chos ston par byed do //
translated: Then he teaches the Dharma to them.

original: chos de yang ci rigs pa dang legs par 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / brda phrad par dus su rim gyis phyin ci ma log pa dang / don dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: chos de yang ci rigs pa dang legs par 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / brda phrad par dus su rim gyis phyin ci ma log pa dang / don dang ldan par ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in a way that is appropriate, well-ordered, coherent, and timely, and in a way that is not disordered, and that is meaningful.

original: 'khrug pa yang mi 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: 'khrug pa yang mi 'byed par byed do //
translated: He does not create disharmony.

original: sems can 'dul ba la mchog tu byed 'dod pa dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba la mchog tu byed 'dod pa dang / snying brtse ba'i sems dang yang ldan no //
translated: He is also endowed with a mind that is desirous of the highest training of sentient beings and a mind of loving kindness.

original: de rdzu 'phrul dang sems kun brjod pa dang / rigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan pas sam /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul dang sems kun brjod pa dang / rigs pa'i tshul gyis chos bstan pas sam /
translated: He trains sentient beings by means of his supernatural knowledge, his reading of their minds, and his teaching of the Dharma in a way that is appropriate,

original: gzhan la bcol bas sam /
analyzed: gzhan la bcol bas sam /
translated: or by means of his exhortations to others,

original: sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag gis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do ;
analyzed: sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag gis sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do ;
translated: or by means of his many different kinds of emanations.

analyzed: ; don dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos mdor bsdus pa rnams rab tu rgyas par byed pa dang / ha cang rgya che ba rnams mdor bsdus pa dang / de bzhin du lung dbog pa dang / zlos su gzhug pa dang / 'dri ba'i skabs dbye ba dang / chos bzung ba rnams dang / blangs pa rnams kyi don legs par @140b 'grel pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i sgo rnams dang mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs shing sems can rnams kyi don kun du spyod do //
