original: sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa'i don ma shes te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa'i don ma shes te /
translated: He or she also teaches the profound sūtras that were spoken by the Tathāgata, the sūtras that are endowed with emptiness,

original: mdo sde gang dag las chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med par ston pa dang / chos rnams dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur ston pa de dag gi don ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes nas /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag las chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med par ston pa dang / chos rnams dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur ston pa de dag gi don ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes nas /
translated: Those who do not understand the meaning of the sūtras that teach the lack of essence of phenomena, the non-existence of phenomena, their non-arising, their non-ceasing, their similarity to space, and their illusoriness and dream-like quality,

original: sems skrag ste /
analyzed: sems skrag ste /
translated: are frightened by them.

original: 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin no zhes mdo sde de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spong bar byed pa'i sems can de dag la yang byang chub sems dpa' des mthun par byed pa'i thabs la mkhas pas mdo sde de dag gi
analyzed: 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin no zhes mdo sde de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spong bar byed pa'i sems can de dag la yang byang chub sems dpa' des mthun par byed pa'i thabs la mkhas pas mdo sde de dag gi
translated: Those sentient beings who completely reject those sūtras, saying, “These were not spoken by the Tathāgata,” the bodhisattva, through skill in means, causes them to engage with those sūtras.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par byed cing /
translated: He causes them to engage with the meaning of the Tathāgata’s thought just as it is.

original: sems can de dag kyang 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: He causes those sentient beings to take up those sūtras.

original: 'di lta bur yang mthun par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta bur yang mthun par byed do //
translated: He causes them to engage in the following way.

original: 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In this way, these phenomena are not completely and totally nonexistent.

original: 'di dag la ni brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: 'di dag la ni brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: However, they do not have an identity that is the nature of expressions.

original: de'i phyir de dag ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be “identityless.”

original: gang la brten nas brjod pa 'jug pa'i brjod pa'i dngos po yod pa de yang brjod pa gang dag gi ngo bo nyid gang brjod pa yang dag pa de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la brten nas brjod pa 'jug pa'i brjod pa'i dngos po yod pa de yang brjod pa gang dag gi ngo bo nyid gang brjod pa yang dag pa de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: The things that are the bases for the engagement of expressions and that exist do not have the nature of the expressions that express them.

original: de lta bas na dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be “nonexistent.”

original: de lta yin pas chos rnams kyi brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid de dag kyang thog ma nyid nas thams cad kyi thams cad du med na /
analyzed: de lta yin pas chos rnams kyi brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid de dag kyang thog ma nyid nas thams cad kyi thams cad du med na /
translated: Since that is the case, the identity that is the object of expression of phenomena does not exist from the very beginning in any way at all.

original: de dag ci zhig skye ba'am /
analyzed: de dag ci zhig skye ba'am /
translated: What is there to arise or

original: 'gag par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ram /
translated: cease?

original: de lta bas na mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be “non-arisen” and “non-ceasing.”

original: dper na nam mkha' la gzugs rnams dang / gzugs kyi bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag snang bas na gzugs rnams dang gzugs kyi bya ba de dag thams cad kyi 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'phar ba dang /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la gzugs rnams dang / gzugs kyi bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag snang bas na gzugs rnams dang gzugs kyi bya ba de dag thams cad kyi 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'phar ba dang /
translated: For example, since various forms and the various activities of forms appear in space, space provides the opportunity for all those forms and the activities of forms to come, go, stand, jump,

original: ltung ba dang / rkyang pa la sogs pa'i go skabs 'byed la gang @141a * //
analyzed: ltung ba dang / rkyang pa la sogs pa'i go skabs 'byed la gang @141a * //
translated: fall, run, and so on.

original: gi tshe gzugs de dag dang / gzugs kyi bya ba de dag gsal ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gi tshe gzugs de dag dang / gzugs kyi bya ba de dag gsal ba'i tshe /
translated: When those forms and the activities of forms are clarified,

original: gzugs med pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kho nas nam mkha' yongs su dag par snang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs med pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kho nas nam mkha' yongs su dag par snang ba bzhin du /
translated: space appears as the pure nature of mere non-form.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i brjod du med pa'i dngos po la brjod pa sna tshogs kyis byas pa'i 'du shes rnams dang / rnam par rtog pa spros pa la chags pa dang ldan pa gzugs dang las lta bu rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i brjod du med pa'i dngos po la brjod pa sna tshogs kyis byas pa'i 'du shes rnams dang / rnam par rtog pa spros pa la chags pa dang ldan pa gzugs dang las lta bu rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Likewise, in the inexpressible entity that is like space, the various conceptions created by various expressions and the various conceptual elaborations that are attached to conceptual thoughts arise like forms and actions.

original: brjod pas byas pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par rtog pa spros pa la chags pa dang ldan pa dang / gzugs dang las lta bu rnam pa sna tshogs de dag thams cad kyi go skabs kyang brjod du med pa'i dngos po nam mkha' lta bu des 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: brjod pas byas pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par rtog pa spros pa la chags pa dang ldan pa dang / gzugs dang las lta bu rnam pa sna tshogs de dag thams cad kyi go skabs kyang brjod du med pa'i dngos po nam mkha' lta bu des 'byed par byed de /
translated: The opportunity for all of those various things, such as form and action, is opened up by that inexpressible thing, which is like space.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes 'phags pas brjod pa skyes pa'i log pa'i 'du shes dang rnam par rtog pa spros pa la chags pa dang ldan pa de dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du bsal ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes 'phags pas brjod pa skyes pa'i log pa'i 'du shes dang rnam par rtog pa spros pa la chags pa dang ldan pa de dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du bsal ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the noble wisdom of the bodhisattvas eliminates all those wrong ideas and conceptual thoughts that are attached to the elaborations of expression, then

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i mchog de dag gi ye shes 'phags pa des brjod du med pa'i dngos po de brjod pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa tsam du nam mkha' lta bur yongs su dag par snang mod kyi 'on kyang de'i pha rol tu
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i mchog de dag gi ye shes 'phags pa des brjod du med pa'i dngos po de brjod pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa tsam du nam mkha' lta bur yongs su dag par snang mod kyi 'on kyang de'i pha rol tu
translated: the noble wisdom of those bodhisattvas, the supreme noble ones, will see that inexpressible thing as completely pure like space, as the mere absence of the nature of all expressions.

original: de'i rang bzhin gzhan tshol bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gzhan tshol bar mi byed de /
translated: One does not seek its nature elsewhere.

original: de lta bas na chos rnams ni nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos rnams ni nam mkha' lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, phenomena are said to be like space.

original: dper na sgyu ma ni ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma ni ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: For example, an illusion is not existent in the way it appears.

original: sgyu ma byas pa de thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du chos 'di dag kyang brjod pa dang / 'dris pa'i dbang gis byis pa rnams la ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa de thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du chos 'di dag kyang brjod pa dang / 'dris pa'i dbang gis byis pa rnams la ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: However, the creation of an illusion is not completely nonexistent. In the same way, these phenomena are not existent in the way they appear to the childish due to the power of their expressions and familiarity.

original: don dam pa brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du thams chad kyi thams cad du med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du thams chad kyi thams cad du med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: However, they are not completely nonexistent in the nature of the inexpressible ultimate.

original: de dag kyang 'jug pa'i tshul 'dis sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'jug pa'i tshul 'dis sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Moreover, they are not existent in this way by this mode of engagement.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are also not nonexistent.

original: gnyis su med pa de'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa de'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are nondual, they are said to be like an illusion.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings thams cad la ci yang dbri bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings thams cad la ci yang dbri bar yang mi byed /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva does not subtract anything from the entire realm of phenomena,

original: snon par yang mi byed /
analyzed: snon par yang mi byed /
translated: nor does he add anything to it.

original: nyung ngur yang mi byed /🔽lhag par yang mi byed /
analyzed: nyung ngur yang mi byed / lhag par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not make it smaller,🔽nor does he make it larger.

original: rnam par 'jug par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: rnam par 'jug par yang mi byed de /
translated: He does not cause it to enter anywhere,

original: yang dag pa la yang dag par rab tu shes la /
analyzed: yang dag pa la yang dag par rab tu shes la /
translated: but he knows the real in a real way,

original: de kho na bzhin du yang dag par ston pa 'di ni byang @141b chub sems dpa'i mthun pa'i thabs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du yang dag par ston pa 'di ni byang @141b chub sems dpa'i mthun pa'i thabs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and he teaches the real in just that way. This should be known as the bodhisattva’s skillful means.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'khyig cing sdod pa'i thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'khyig cing sdod pa'i thabs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva’s skillful means of remaining silent?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can zas dang skom la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad bcu 'dod pa rnams la gal te khyed par 'dzin pa dang mar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa nas snga ma bzhin du rgyas par gal te khyed rnams tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i bar du byed na ni de lta na ngas khyed cag la zas dang /🔽skom la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad rnams las ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin par bya'i /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can zas dang skom la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad bcu 'dod pa rnams la gal te khyed par 'dzin pa dang mar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa nas snga ma bzhin du rgyas par gal te khyed rnams tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i bar du byed na ni de lta na ngas khyed cag la zas dang / skom la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad rnams las ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin par bya'i /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas say to sentient beings who want the ten physical necessities such as food and drink, “If you respect your mother, respect your father, respect ascetics and respect brahmins, and so on, up to if you take up the practice of correct conduct, then I will give you as much food, drink and so on as you want.🔽If you do not do that, I do not want to give you anything.”

original: de lta ma yin na ni sbyin mi 'dod zhes 'khyig cing sdod par byed do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni sbyin mi 'dod zhes 'khyig cing sdod par byed do //
translated: They stay like that, holding back.

original: de bzhin du zhing gi dngos po dang / khyim gyi dngos po dang / zong dgram pa'i khang pa'i dngos po dang / rgyal srid kyi dngos po dang / yul gyi dngos po dang / nor gyi dngos po dang / 'bru'i dngos po 'dod pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhing gi dngos po dang / khyim gyi dngos po dang / zong dgram pa'i khang pa'i dngos po dang / rgyal srid kyi dngos po dang / yul gyi dngos po dang / nor gyi dngos po dang / 'bru'i dngos po 'dod pa rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, those who desire the things of the fields, the things of the house, the things of the shops, the things of the kingdom, the things of the country, the things of wealth, the things of grain,

original: de bzhin du bzo dang / las kyi gnas kyi rig pa 'dod pa rnams dang / de bzhin du des grogs bya bar 'dod pa rnams dang / bag ma len pa dang / bag ma gtong bar 'dod pa rnams dang / lhag par za ba rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzo dang / las kyi gnas kyi rig pa 'dod pa rnams dang / de bzhin du des grogs bya bar 'dod pa rnams dang / bag ma len pa dang / bag ma gtong bar 'dod pa rnams dang / lhag par za ba rnams dang /
translated: and similarly, those who desire the knowledge of the arts and the places of work, and similarly, those who desire to be friends, those who desire to take a wife and give a daughter in marriage, those who desire to eat special foods,

original: 'du zhing za bar 'dod pa rnams dang / bya ba'i grogs 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la gal te khyed rnams par 'dzin par byed na ni /
analyzed: 'du zhing za bar 'dod pa rnams dang / bya ba'i grogs 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la gal te khyed rnams par 'dzin par byed na ni /
translated: those who desire to gather and eat, and those sentient beings who desire a companion for their work, if you take them as your friends,

original: 'di ltar ngas khyed cag la zhes bya ba nas rgyas par bya ba dag la grogs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngas khyed cag la zhes bya ba nas rgyas par bya ba dag la grogs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: then I will be your companion in all your activities, as before.

original: bya ba la 'khyig cing sdod par byed do //
analyzed: bya ba la 'khyig cing sdod par byed do //
translated: He or she is slow to act and remains inactive.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can nyes pa byung ba su na 'byin pa gnod par byed pa gzhan dag gis gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / gcad pa dang / brdeg pa dang / smad pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / bskrad pa'i phyir zin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can nyes pa byung ba su na 'byin pa gnod par byed pa gzhan dag gis gsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / gcad pa dang / brdeg pa dang / smad pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / bskrad pa'i phyir zin pa rnams dang /
translated: Moreover, when sentient beings who have committed offenses are seized by others who are hostile, who are intent on killing, binding, cutting, beating, abusing, threatening, or banishing them;

original: spu gta' dang / gta' dang / btsod pa'i phyir zin pa rnams la gal te phar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin par byed na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: spu gta' dang / gta' dang / btsod pa'i phyir zin pa rnams la gal te phar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin par byed na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
translated: or when they are seized for the sake of a fine, a ransom, or a reward, the bodhisattva thinks, “If they are made to respect their mothers, their fathers, and so on, as described above,

original: de ltar na ngas khyed cag sdug bsngal 'de las thar bar bya'o zhes nus shing mthu yod bzhin du 'khyig cing stod par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na ngas khyed cag sdug bsngal 'de las thar bar bya'o zhes nus shing mthu yod bzhin du 'khyig cing stod par byed do //
translated: then I will be able to free them from this suffering.” Thus, the bodhisattva is slow to act and remains inactive, even though he or she has the ability and the means.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / chu dang / me dang mi dang mi ma yin @142a * //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / chu dang / me dang mi dang mi ma yin @142a * //
translated: Moreover, when sentient beings are seized by kings, thieves, water, fire, humans, or non-humans,

original: pa dang ; 'tsho ba med pa dang / mi snyan pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa rnams la gal te phar 'dzin par byed na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: pa dang ; 'tsho ba med pa dang / mi snyan pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa rnams la gal te phar 'dzin par byed na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
translated: If I were to accept you, he says, then you would be afraid of the dangers of poverty, lack of livelihood, and disrepute, and so on, as before.

original: de ltar na ngas khyed cag 'jigs pa 'di las yongs su bskyab par bya'o zhes 'khyig cing sdod par byed do ;
analyzed: de ltar na ngas khyed cag 'jigs pa 'di las yongs su bskyab par bya'o zhes 'khyig cing sdod par byed do ;
translated: Thus, I will protect you from this danger.

original: ; yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can sdug pa dang phrad par 'dod pa rnams dang / mi sdug pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams gal te phar 'dzin par byed na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /🔽de ltar na ngas khyed cag sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / mi sdug pa dang bral bar bya'o//
analyzed: ; yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can sdug pa dang phrad par 'dod pa rnams dang / mi sdug pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams gal te phar 'dzin par byed na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te / de ltar na ngas khyed cag sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / mi sdug pa dang bral bar bya'o//
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattvas see that sentient beings want to meet with what is attractive and to separate from what is unattractive, he says, If I were to accept you, and so on, as before.

original: zhes 'khyig cing sdod par byed do //
analyzed: zhes 'khyig cing sdod par byed do //
translated: Thus, I will bring it about that you meet with what is attractive and separate from what is unattractive.🔽 Thus, he says, I will protect you from this danger.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can nad kyis thebs te na ba rnams la gal te phar 'dzin par byed na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can nad kyis thebs te na ba rnams la gal te phar 'dzin par byed na ni zhes bya ba nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattvas see that sentient beings are afflicted by disease, they do not immediately give them what they want, as described above.

original: de ltar na ngas khyed cag nad kyi sdug bsngal 'di las thar bar bya'o zhes 'khyig cing sdod par byed do //🔽sems can de dag kyang sdig pa spang ba dang / dge ba yang dag par blang ba de la myur ba myur bar byang chub sems dpa' de ltar 'khyig cing sdod pa'i dga' mgur byed par 'gyur ba de ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khyig cing sdod pa'i thabs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na ngas khyed cag nad kyi sdug bsngal 'di las thar bar bya'o zhes 'khyig cing sdod par byed do // sems can de dag kyang sdig pa spang ba dang / dge ba yang dag par blang ba de la myur ba myur bar byang chub sems dpa' de ltar 'khyig cing sdod pa'i dga' mgur byed par 'gyur ba de ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khyig cing sdod pa'i thabs zhes bya ste /
translated: They say, “I will free you from this suffering of disease.”🔽And those sentient beings, in order to abandon evil and take up virtue, quickly do what that bodhisattva wants by acting in accordance with his or her wishes.

original: sems can gang dag ji skad brjod pa'i dngos po rnams la /
analyzed: sems can gang dag ji skad brjod pa'i dngos po rnams la /
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ method of delay.

original: myur ba myur bar byang chub sems dpa' de ltar 'khyig cing sdod pa'i dga' mgur 'jug par mi byed pa de dag la ni byang chub sems dpa' ji skad brjod pa'i dngos po rnams 'dod pa dag la phan par 'dod pa'i phyir dngos po de dag sbyin par
analyzed: myur ba myur bar byang chub sems dpa' de ltar 'khyig cing sdod pa'i dga' mgur 'jug par mi byed pa de dag la ni byang chub sems dpa' ji skad brjod pa'i dngos po rnams 'dod pa dag la phan par 'dod pa'i phyir dngos po de dag sbyin par
translated: The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act, who are not eager to act, who are not quick to act, who are not ready to act, who are not inclined to act, who are not inclined to act quickly, who are not inclined to act with joy.🔽The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act, who are not eager to act, who are not quick to act, who are not ready to act, who are not inclined to act, who are not inclined to act quickly, who are not inclined to act with joy.

original: mi byed de /🔽sbyin par mi 'dod pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi byed de / sbyin par mi 'dod pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act, who are not eager to act, who are not quick to act, who are not ready to act, who are not inclined to act, who are not inclined to act quickly, who are not inclined to act with joy.🔽The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act, who are not eager to act, who are not quick to act, who are not ready to act, who are not inclined to act, who are not inclined to act quickly, who are not inclined to act with joy.🔽The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act, who are not eager to act, who are not quick to act, who are not ready to act, who are not inclined to act, who are not inclined to act quickly, who are not inclined to act with joy.🔽The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act, who are not eager to act, who are not quick to act, who are not ready to act, who are not inclined to act, who are not inclined to act quickly, who are not inclined to act with joy.

original: sems can sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams dang / skrag pa rnams dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams dang / nad kyi sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa rnams la phan par 'dod pa'i phyir re zhig yal bar 'jog ste /🔽yal bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang ; yongs su bskyab par mi bya ba'i bsam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams dang / skrag pa rnams dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams dang / nad kyi sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa rnams la phan par 'dod pa'i phyir re zhig yal bar 'jog ste / yal bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang ; yongs su bskyab par mi bya ba'i bsam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act, who are not eager to act, who are not quick to act, who are not ready to act, who are not inclined to act, who are not inclined to act quickly, who are not inclined to act with joy.🔽The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act, who are not eager to act, who are not quick to act, who are not ready to act, who are not inclined to act, who are not inclined to act quickly, who are not inclined to act with joy.

original: sems can de dag kyang de ltar byang chub sems dpa' las drag po la 'jug la /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang de ltar byang chub sems dpa' las drag po la 'jug la /
translated: The bodhisattva does not give those things to those who are slow to act,

original: snying nas ni mi byed na sdig pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snying nas ni mi byed na sdig pa spang ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blang ba'i phyir /
translated: If you do not do this from the heart, you will not be able to give up sin and take up the roots of virtue.

original: phyis dga' dgur byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis dga' dgur byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not do it with all one's heart, one will later do it at will in order to eliminate evil and take up the roots of virtue.

original: sems @142b can gang dag byang chub sems dpa' la slong ba yang med la /
analyzed: sems @142b can gang dag byang chub sems dpa' la slong ba yang med la /
translated: Those beings who do not ask for anything from the bodhisattva,

original: sdug bsngal bar gnas pa yang ma yin ba nas rgyas par nad kyis thebs pa'i bar dag kyang ma yin la de dag de dang 'dris shing /🔽mdza' ba de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gnas pa yang ma yin ba nas rgyas par nad kyis thebs pa'i bar dag kyang ma yin la de dag de dang 'dris shing / mdza' ba de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'di lta ste /
translated: who are not in a state of suffering, and so on, up to who are not afflicted by disease, but who are acquainted with him and are his friends,

original: phar 'dzin pa nas rgyas par tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te /🔽gnas par bya ba'i bar gyi phyir /
analyzed: phar 'dzin pa nas rgyas par tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te / gnas par bya ba'i bar gyi phyir /
translated: the bodhisattva causes them to take up the roots of virtue in order that they might have🔽the virtues of a bodhisattva, that is, in order that they might take up the morality of restraint and the morality of collecting virtuous factors,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: and in order that they might abide in the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'dzin du bcug kyang gal te 'gyur zhing 'jug par mi byed na /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'dzin du bcug kyang gal te 'gyur zhing 'jug par mi byed na /
translated: Even though the bodhisattva has thus caused them to take up the roots of virtue, if they do not change and engage in virtue,

original: de dag yang byang chub sems dpas phan par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag yang byang chub sems dpas phan par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: then the bodhisattva, in order to benefit them,

original: bdag nyid 'khrug par yang ston te /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'khrug par yang ston te /
translated: He also shows himself to be angry,

original: snying nas 'khrug pa ni ma yin no //🔽bya ba rnams la yang phan par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying nas 'khrug pa ni ma yin no // bya ba rnams la yang phan par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: but not from the heart.

original: rgyab kyis lta bar ston te /
analyzed: rgyab kyis lta bar ston te /
translated: He also shows himself to be averse,

original: snying nas rgyab kyis lta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snying nas rgyab kyis lta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from the heart.

original: phan par 'dod pa'i phyir de la 'jig rten pa'i gnod pa 'ga' yang byed de /
analyzed: phan par 'dod pa'i phyir de la 'jig rten pa'i gnod pa 'ga' yang byed de /
translated: He also shows himself to be indifferent,

original: snying nas gnod par 'dod pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: snying nas gnod par 'dod pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: but not from the heart.🔽He does not do any of these things from the heart.🔽He does not do any of these things from the heart.

original: ; byang chub sems dpa' de'i bsam pa de dang / spyod pa de ni sems can de dag la mi mthun par byed de /
analyzed: ; byang chub sems dpa' de'i bsam pa de dang / spyod pa de ni sems can de dag la mi mthun par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva's attitude and conduct toward those beings is not in accord with theirs.

original: des kyang sems can de dag sdig pa spong ba dang / dge ba yang dag par blang ba de la yang dag par 'dzud do //
analyzed: des kyang sems can de dag sdig pa spong ba dang / dge ba yang dag par blang ba de la yang dag par 'dzud do //
translated: However, he does cause those beings to give up evil and take up virtue.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i sems can 'dul ba'i thabs 'di ni mi mthun pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i sems can 'dul ba'i thabs 'di ni mi mthun pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this method of the bodhisattva for disciplining beings is called the attitude of non-accord.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i nan tur las byung ba'i thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i nan tur las byung ba'i thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's method that arises from punishment?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni jo bor gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni jo bor gyur pa'am /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva is like a master.🔽

original: rgyal por gyur pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: rgyal por gyur pa yang rung ste /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva is the master or the king.

original: bdag por gyur nas /🔽bdag gi bran gnyug ma'am /🔽phab ste khugs pa la yang rung ba la 'di skad du nga'i 'bangs gnyug ma'am /
analyzed: bdag por gyur nas / bdag gi bran gnyug ma'am / phab ste khugs pa la yang rung ba la 'di skad du nga'i 'bangs gnyug ma'am /
translated: Having become the lord,🔽he says to his own servants,🔽whether they are born into the family or have been purchased,

original: phab ste khugs pa su yang rung ste /
analyzed: phab ste khugs pa su yang rung ste /
translated: “Whoever of my servants, whether born into the family or purchased,🔽does not do what I say,

original: phar mi 'dzin pa nas rgyas par 'chal ba'i tshul khrims blangs nas /
analyzed: phar mi 'dzin pa nas rgyas par 'chal ba'i tshul khrims blangs nas /
translated: up to takes up corrupt morality,

original: 'dug pa de la ngas thang gis dbang ba'i zas dang gos kun gcad dam gcod du gzhug go //
analyzed: 'dug pa de la ngas thang gis dbang ba'i zas dang gos kun gcad dam gcod du gzhug go //
translated: I will cut off all his food and clothing, or have it done.

original: yang na de la brdeg tu gzhug go //🔽yang na nor thams cad dang nga dbral lo //
analyzed: yang na de la brdeg tu gzhug go // yang na nor thams cad dang nga dbral lo //
translated: Or I will have him beaten.🔽Or I will separate him from all his wealth.

original: yang na thams cad kyi thams cad du yul nas spyug go zhes yang dag par 'chos par byed do //
analyzed: yang na thams cad kyi thams cad du yul nas spyug go zhes yang dag par 'chos par byed do //
translated: Or I will banish him from the country in every way.”

original: las de la yang zho shas 'tsho ba mkhas pa dang / shes nyen can ngag sgo bar byed do //
analyzed: las de la yang zho shas 'tsho ba mkhas pa dang / shes nyen can ngag sgo bar byed do //
translated: He also appoints skilled and capable officials to that task.

original: sems can de dag kyang chad pa chen po des skrag nas /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang chad pa chen po des skrag nas /
translated: And those sentient beings, frightened by that great threat,

original: sdig pa yang spong @143a * //
analyzed: sdig pa yang spong @143a * //
translated: They also give up evil and

original: zhing dge ba yang dag par blangs te gnas so //
analyzed: zhing dge ba yang dag par blangs te gnas so //
translated: take up virtue.

original: sems can de dag mi 'dod bzhin du yang nan gyis gnas pa de dang / thabs des dge ba'i las la 'dzud par byed de /
analyzed: sems can de dag mi 'dod bzhin du yang nan gyis gnas pa de dang / thabs des dge ba'i las la 'dzud par byed de /
translated: Even if those sentient beings do not want to, they are forced to do so, and by that means are led to virtuous actions.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni nan tur las byung ba'i thabs zhes bya'o /🔽// / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni nan tur las byung ba'i thabs zhes bya'o / // / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: Therefore, this is called the method that arises from force.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byas pa la lan ldon pa'i thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i byas pa la lan ldon pa'i thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ method of repaying kindness?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas sems can gang dag la sngon sbyin pa'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'i skyabs sam /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas sems can gang dag la sngon sbyin pa'am / sdug bsngal ba'i skyabs sam /
translated: Here bodhisattvas, in regard to those sentient beings to whom they have given help in the past,🔽whether it be protection from fear,

original: 'jigs pa'i skyabs sam /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i skyabs sam /
translated: protection from suffering,

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang bral bar byas pa'am /
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang bral bar byas pa'am /
translated: or help in being united with what is attractive and being separated from what is unattractive,

original: nad zhi bar bya ba'i phan pa nyung yang rung /
analyzed: nad zhi bar bya ba'i phan pa nyung yang rung /
translated: whether it be little or much,

original: mang yang rung ba byas la byas pa gzo zhing byas pa shes te /
analyzed: mang yang rung ba byas la byas pa gzo zhing byas pa shes te /
translated: are grateful and appreciative.

original: phyir lan du phan gdags par 'dod pa de dag la byang chub sems dpas dge ba yang dag par blangs pa kho nar lan du 'chol bar byed la /
analyzed: phyir lan du phan gdags par 'dod pa de dag la byang chub sems dpas dge ba yang dag par blangs pa kho nar lan du 'chol bar byed la /
translated: In return for the benefit they desire to give, the bodhisattva asks them to take up virtue alone.

original: khas len te /
analyzed: khas len te /
translated: He promises to do so.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing ni cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing ni cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: He does not ask for any worldly goods at all.

original: de skad du gal te khyed kyis phar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin pa nas rgyas par tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba'i bar du byas na /
analyzed: de skad du gal te khyed kyis phar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin pa nas rgyas par tshul khrims yang dag par blang ba'i bar du byas na /
translated: He says, “If you take up the practice of honoring your father and mother, and so on up to taking up the practice of the moral precepts,

original: de nyid khyed kyis nga la lan du phan btags pa chen po yin no zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: de nyid khyed kyis nga la lan du phan btags pa chen po yin no zhes zer zhing /
translated: that alone will be a great benefit to me.”

original: byas pa'i lan glon pa dge ba yang dag par blangs pa gzhan las re bar byed la /
analyzed: byas pa'i lan glon pa dge ba yang dag par blangs pa gzhan las re bar byed la /
translated: He asks for another virtue in return, the virtue of repaying the benefit.

original: thabs des gzhan dag dge ba de la yang dag par 'dzud par byed de /
analyzed: thabs des gzhan dag dge ba de la yang dag par 'dzud par byed de /
translated: By this means he causes others to take up that virtue.

original: de lta bas na thabs de ni byas pa la lan glon pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na thabs de ni byas pa la lan glon pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this means is called “repaying the benefit.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s pure means?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas shing /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas who are on the bodhisattva level that is the ultimate🔽and who have thoroughly trained in the bodhisattva path think,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' che ge mo zhig dga' ldan gyi lha'i rigs su skyes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' che ge mo zhig dga' ldan gyi lha'i rigs su skyes te /
translated: “So-and-so bodhisattva has been born in the Tuṣita god realm.

original: de ni ring po mi thogs par 'dzam bu'i gling du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyis /🔽bdag cag gis de mnyes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni ring po mi thogs par 'dzam bu'i gling du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyis / bdag cag gis de mnyes par bya ste /
translated: Before long, he will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in the human world.

original: mi mnyes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyes par mi bya'o //
translated: We should please him and not displease him.🔽We should be born in the presence of that bodhisattva.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i drung du yang bdag cag skye bar gyur cig snyam du sems par 'gyur bar sems can dpag tu med pa'i yang dag pa'i 'dun pa bskyed pa dang / 'dun pa che bar bya ba'i phyir dga' ldan gyi lha'i rigs su skye @143b ba'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i drung du yang bdag cag skye bar gyur cig snyam du sems par 'gyur bar sems can dpag tu med pa'i yang dag pa'i 'dun pa bskyed pa dang / 'dun pa che bar bya ba'i phyir dga' ldan gyi lha'i rigs su skye @143b ba'o ;
translated: In order to generate the correct aspiration of countless sentient beings and to increase their aspiration, they are born in the Tuṣita god realm.

original: ; yang byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi lha'i rigs nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: ; yang byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi lha'i rigs nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva, after passing away from the Tuṣita gods,

original: rigs mthon po'am /
analyzed: rigs mthon po'am /
translated: is born in a high caste,

original: kun gyis bkur ba'i khyim 'di lta ste /🔽rgyal po'i pho brang ngam /
analyzed: kun gyis bkur ba'i khyim 'di lta ste / rgyal po'i pho brang ngam /
translated: in a family that is honored by all,🔽such as the royal family

original: mdun na 'don gyi khyim du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdun na 'don gyi khyim du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: or the family of a high official.

original: der sems can rnams kyis gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir 'dod pa rgya chen po dag spangs nas mngon par 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: der sems can rnams kyis gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir 'dod pa rgya chen po dag spangs nas mngon par 'byung bar byed do //
translated: There, in order to generate affection among sentient beings, he renounces vast pleasures and goes forth from the home life.

original: yang sems can dka' ba spyod pa la mos pa rnams kyi 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir dka' ba spyod pa nyams su len par byed do //
analyzed: yang sems can dka' ba spyod pa la mos pa rnams kyi 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir dka' ba spyod pa nyams su len par byed do //
translated: Moreover, in order to turn away the desire of sentient beings who are devoted to the practice of austerities, he practices austerities.

original: yang de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams byang chub dang rnam par grol ba thun mong du 'gyur ba'i 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams byang chub dang rnam par grol ba thun mong du 'gyur ba'i 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to generate the desire for awakening and liberation in other sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed do //
translated: he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Moreover, after fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment,

original: da ltar gang la chos bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshangs pa nyid bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba 'debs pa las na /
analyzed: da ltar gang la chos bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshangs pa nyid bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba 'debs pa las na /
translated: he now teaches the Dharma to those who request it, and Brahmā himself is requesting the Lord to teach the Dharma.

original: kye ma chos bstan pa 'di ni ngan ngon tsam ma yin no snyam ste sems can de dag chos la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kye ma chos bstan pa 'di ni ngan ngon tsam ma yin no snyam ste sems can de dag chos la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, these sentient beings should generate respect for the Dharma.

original: re zhig sems can rnams la chos mi ston par tshangs pas gsol ba btab pa la gzhes par mdzad do //
analyzed: re zhig sems can rnams la chos mi ston par tshangs pas gsol ba btab pa la gzhes par mdzad do //
translated: For that reason, he does not teach the Dharma to sentient beings right away, but rather he accepts Brahmā’s request.

original: yang 'dis ni tshangs pas gsol ba btab pa kho nas tshangs pa'i ngor bya ba dang / gzhan gyis bskul ba'i phyir chos ston par zad kyi /
analyzed: yang 'dis ni tshangs pas gsol ba btab pa kho nas tshangs pa'i ngor bya ba dang / gzhan gyis bskul ba'i phyir chos ston par zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, he teaches the Dharma only because Brahmā requests it, and he teaches the Dharma because others request it,

original: bdag nyid sems can rnams la snying rje'i sems dang / bdag nyid kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no snyam du shes nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid sems can rnams la snying rje'i sems dang / bdag nyid kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no snyam du shes nas /
translated: but not because he himself has a compassionate attitude toward sentient beings, or because he himself wants to.

original: sems can kha cig de ltar log par 'dzin pa btsal pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can kha cig de ltar log par 'dzin pa btsal pa'i phyir /
translated: Some sentient beings are like this, holding wrong views.🔽

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs so //
translated: He looks upon the world with the eye of a Buddha in order to find some sentient being who has such a wrong view.

original: yang chos kyi 'khor lo 'jig rten du sngon ma bskor ba bskor bar mdzad de /
analyzed: yang chos kyi 'khor lo 'jig rten du sngon ma bskor ba bskor bar mdzad de /
translated: He sets in motion the wheel of the Dharma in the world which has never been set in motion before.

original: de ltar chos ston par mdzad /
analyzed: de ltar chos ston par mdzad /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in that way.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi dag kyang 'cha' bar mdzad do /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi dag kyang 'cha' bar mdzad do /
translated: He establishes the bases of training.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i thabs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i thabs zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the pure method of the bodhisattvas.

original: thabs 'di las gong na thabs ches lhag pa dang / ches gya nom pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: thabs 'di las gong na thabs ches lhag pa dang / ches gya nom pa gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other method that is higher, more excellent, or more sublime than this method.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa rnam pa drug po 'di dag mdo dang / rgyas par bstan pas /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa rnam pa drug po 'di dag mdo dang / rgyas par bstan pas /
translated: Thus, through the brief and extensive teachings on these six types of skillful means of the bodhisattvas,

original: sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi khong khro ba ni sel /
analyzed: sems can zhe 'gras pa rnams kyi khong khro ba ni sel /
translated: the hostility of hostile sentient beings is removed,

original: tha mal pa rnams ni 'dzud @144a * //
analyzed: tha mal pa rnams ni 'dzud @144a * //
translated: the neutral are caused to enter the Dharma,

original: par byed / zhugs pa rnams ni yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: par byed / zhugs pa rnams ni yongs su smin par byed /
translated: and those who have entered are brought to full maturity.

original: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar byed do /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar byed do /
translated: Those who are fully ripened are liberated.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ skill in means.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ dhāraṇī?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be seen as being of four types:

original: chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / gsang sngags kyi gzungs dang / byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa 'thob par byed pa'i gzungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs dang / gsang sngags kyi gzungs dang / byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa 'thob par byed pa'i gzungs so //
translated: the dhāraṇī of the Dharma, the dhāraṇī of meaning, the dhāraṇī of spells, and the dhāraṇī that causes the bodhisattva to attain acceptance.

original: de la chos kyi gzungs gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de la chos kyi gzungs gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the dhāraṇī of the Dharma?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gis thos pa tsam kho nas ma goms shing kha ton byang bar ma byas pa'i ming dang / tshig dang yi ger gtogs pa rim bzhin du bsdebs shing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gis thos pa tsam kho nas ma goms shing kha ton byang bar ma byas pa'i ming dang / tshig dang yi ger gtogs pa rim bzhin du bsdebs shing /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, merely by hearing something once, without becoming familiar with it and without memorizing it, can arrange the names, phrases, and syllables in the correct sequence.

original: rim bzhin du sbyar ba'i yi ge tshad med pa dag tu tshad med par 'dzin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dran pa dang / shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim bzhin du sbyar ba'i yi ge tshad med pa dag tu tshad med par 'dzin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dran pa dang / shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He attains the power of memory and wisdom that can hold the limitless letters of the teachings in their sequence, and can hold them in an unlimited way.

original: de la don gyi gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la don gyi gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the retention of meaning?

original: snga ma dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: snga ma dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: It is as above.

original: de'i khyad par ni 'di yod do //🔽chos de dag nyid kyi don tshad med pa dag ma goms shing /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni 'di yod do // chos de dag nyid kyi don tshad med pa dag ma goms shing /
translated: But there is this difference.

original: yid kyis byang par ma byas par dus tshad med pa dag tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis byang par ma byas par dus tshad med pa dag tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the retention of the limitless meanings of those teachings, without having become familiar with them, and without having mentally rehearsed them.

original: de la gsal sngags kyi gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gsal sngags kyi gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the retention of spells?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gis gsang sngags kyi gzhi gang dag sems can rnams kyi yams kyi nang yang dag par zhi bar bya ba'i phyir byin gyis rlob par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gis gsang sngags kyi gzhi gang dag sems can rnams kyi yams kyi nang yang dag par zhi bar bya ba'i phyir byin gyis rlob par byed de /
translated: Here a bodhisattva is one who blesses the recitation of the spells that bring about the pacification of epidemics among living beings.

original: yams kyi nad rnam pa du ma yang dag par zhi bar bya ba la /
analyzed: yams kyi nad rnam pa du ma yang dag par zhi bar bya ba la /
translated: He is one who brings about the pacification of many kinds of epidemics.

original: de dag grub cing mchog tu grub la don yod pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dag grub cing mchog tu grub la don yod pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They are accomplished, supremely accomplished, and meaningful.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gsang sngags kyi gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i gsang sngags kyi gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisatvas’ dhāraṇī of mantra.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa 'thob par byed pa'i gzungs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa 'thob par byed pa'i gzungs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisatvas’ dhāraṇī that brings about the attainment of the bodhisatvas’ acceptance?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyi rgyu la shin tu spyad pa /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyi rgyu la shin tu spyad pa /
translated: Here, the bodhisatvas are well-practiced in their own causes,

original: shes rab dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa /
translated: are endowed with insight,

original: dben pa na gnas shing /
analyzed: dben pa na gnas shing /
translated: and live in solitude.

original: tshig kyal pa mi smra la /
analyzed: tshig kyal pa mi smra la /
translated: They do not speak idly,

original: su dang yang mi phrad cing /
analyzed: su dang yang mi phrad cing /
translated: do not associate with anyone,🔽and

original: de bzhin du ran par za ba dang / bab col du mi za ba dang / kha zas sna gcig za ba dang / sems pa lhur byed pa dang / mtshan mo yun thung du nyal zhing @144b yun ring du mi nyal ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par 'gyur ba'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi gang dag de bzhin gshegs bas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du ran par za ba dang / bab col du mi za ba dang / kha zas sna gcig za ba dang / sems pa lhur byed pa dang / mtshan mo yun thung du nyal zhing @144b yun ring du mi nyal ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par 'gyur ba'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi gang dag de bzhin gshegs bas gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, eating in moderation, not eating thoughtlessly, eating only one kind of food, being intent, sleeping for a short time at night and not sleeping for a long time are the mantra bases for attaining patience that were taught by the Tathāgata.

original: tad ya th'a /
analyzed: tad ya th'a /
translated: The mantra bases are:🔽tad yathā:

original: ai ti / mi ti /
analyzed: ai ti / mi ti /
translated: iti, miti,

original: ki ti / bhi: kshan ti /
analyzed: ki ti / bhi: kshan ti /
translated: kiti, bhikṣaṇi,

original: pa d'a ni sr'a h'a /
analyzed: pa d'a ni sr'a h'a /
translated: kṣānti, padāni sarva.

original: zhes bya ba'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi de dag gi don sems shing 'jal la nye bar rtogs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi de dag gi don sems shing 'jal la nye bar rtogs te /
translated: One should contemplate, measure, and understand the meaning of those mantra bases.

original: de gsang sngags kyi gzhi 'di dag la yang dag par zhugs te /
analyzed: de gsang sngags kyi gzhi 'di dag la yang dag par zhugs te /
translated: Having correctly entered those mantra bases,

original: su las kyang ma thos par bdag nyid kyis 'di ltar gsang sngags kyi gzhi 'di dag la ni don yongs su grub pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: su las kyang ma thos par bdag nyid kyis 'di ltar gsang sngags kyi gzhi 'di dag la ni don yongs su grub pa ci yang med de /
translated: without having heard from anyone, one should think: 'In these mantra bases, there is absolutely no established meaning.

original: 'di dag ni don med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni don med pa kho na'o //
translated: They are meaningless alone.

original: 'di dag gi don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of these is as follows:

original: don med pa 'di kho na nyid do snyam du de lta bu'i don khong du chung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don med pa 'di kho na nyid do snyam du de lta bu'i don khong du chung par 'gyur te /
translated: He thinks, “This is the meaninglessness of just this.”

original: de'i pha rol du don gzhan tsho la bar yang mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i pha rol du don gzhan tsho la bar yang mi byed de /
translated: He does not go beyond that to any other meaning.

original: de tsam gyis na des gsang sngags gzhi de dag gi don legs par khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na des gsang sngags gzhi de dag gi don legs par khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: To that extent, he has understood the meaning of those mantra bases.

original: des gsang sngags gzhi de dag gi don yang dag par khong du chud nas /
analyzed: des gsang sngags gzhi de dag gi don yang dag par khong du chud nas /
translated: Having understood the meaning of those mantra bases,

original: don de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang bas chos thams cad kyi don yang legs par khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang bas chos thams cad kyi don yang legs par khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: he follows that meaning and thus understands the meaning of all dharmas.

original: gzhan las ma thos par bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: gzhan las ma thos par bdag nyid kyis /
translated: Without having heard it from anyone else,

original: don 'di lta bu yang khong du chud par 'khyur te /
analyzed: don 'di lta bu yang khong du chud par 'khyur te /
translated: he understands this kind of meaning by himself.

original: brjod pa thams cad kyis chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi don yongs su grub pa med do //
analyzed: brjod pa thams cad kyis chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi don yongs su grub pa med do //
translated: “All expressions are without the established meaning of the intrinsic nature of all dharmas.

original: de dag gi brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyi don yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: de dag gi brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyi don yin no snyam mo //
translated: The inexpressible intrinsic nature of those is the meaning of their intrinsic nature.”

original: des de ltar chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi don legs par khong du chud nas /
analyzed: des de ltar chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi don legs par khong du chud nas /
translated: Having thus well understood the meaning of the reality of all things,

original: de las don gzhan mi tshol la don de khong du chud pas dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las don gzhan mi tshol la don de khong du chud pas dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he does not seek any other meaning than that, and by understanding that meaning, he attains great joy and supreme joy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des gzungs kyi tshig thob pa de dag la brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des gzungs kyi tshig thob pa de dag la brten nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, on the basis of those dhāraṇī-words that he has attained,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is said to have attained the bodhisattva’s patience.

original: de thob pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' de ring por mi thogs par lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa thob par 'gyur zhing mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i bzod pa chen po la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de thob pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' de ring por mi thogs par lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa thob par 'gyur zhing mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i bzod pa chen po la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: By attaining that, the bodhisattva will soon attain the pure superior intention and will abide in the great patience of the stage of practice through devoted interest.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gzungs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gzungs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the bodhisattvas’ dhāraṇī that causes the attainment of the bodhisattva’s patience.

original: de la chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs ni byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa grangs med pa dang po 'das nas /🔽lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i @145a * //
analyzed: de la chos kyi gzungs dang / don gyi gzungs ni byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa grangs med pa dang po 'das nas / lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i @145a * //
translated: The Dharma retention and the meaning retention are obtained by the bodhisattva after the first incalculable eon has passed,

original: sa la zhugs pa'i tshe thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i tshe thob par 'gyur te /
translated: when he has entered the stage of pure universal responsibility.

original: nges pa dang / brtan pa dang / rgya che ba yin no //🔽de tshun chad ni smon lam gyi dbang ngam /
analyzed: nges pa dang / brtan pa dang / rgya che ba yin no // de tshun chad ni smon lam gyi dbang ngam /
translated: They are certain, firm, and vast.🔽From that time on, they are obtained by the power of vow or

original: bsam gtan la brten nas thob par 'gyur te /🔽nges pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas thob par 'gyur te / nges pa yang ma yin /
translated: in dependence on meditative concentration.🔽They are not certain,

original: brtan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: brtan pa yang ma yin /
translated: not firm,

original: rgya che ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgya che ba yang ma yin no //
translated: and not vast.

original: chos dang don gyi gzungs ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: chos dang don gyi gzungs ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the Dharma retention and the meaning retention,

original: gsang sngags kyi gzungs kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi gzungs kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: the mantra retention should be understood in the same way.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gzungs ni ji skad brjod pa de kho na bzhin du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob par byed pa'i gzungs ni ji skad brjod pa de kho na bzhin du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva obtains the retention that causes the attainment of tolerance just as it is described.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yon tan bzhi dang ldan na gzungs 'di dag thams cad 'thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yon tan bzhi dang ldan na gzungs 'di dag thams cad 'thob ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses four qualities obtains all these retentions.

original: gang yang rung ba ma tshang bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba ma tshang bas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that any one of them is missing.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'dod pa rnams la lhag par zhen pa med pa dang / gzhan ma thos pa dag la phrag dog mi skyed de /🔽phrag dog med pa dang / bslangs pa thams cad rab tu sbyin zhing 'gyod pa med par sbyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dam sde snod kyi ma mo las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la lhag par zhen pa med pa dang / gzhan ma thos pa dag la phrag dog mi skyed de / phrag dog med pa dang / bslangs pa thams cad rab tu sbyin zhing 'gyod pa med par sbyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dam sde snod kyi ma mo las brtsams te /
translated: They are: not being attached to desires; not being jealous of others’ gains;

original: chos la kun du dga' zhing /🔽chos la dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: chos la kun du dga' zhing / chos la dga' ba yin no //
translated: giving everything asked for without regret; and delighting in the Dharma and taking pleasure in the Dharma, having begun the Bodhisattva Canon or the Mother of the Buddhas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s aspiration?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar ba lta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar ba lta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be regarded as fivefold:

original: sems bskyed pa'i smon lam dang / skye ba'i smon lam dang / spyod yul gyi smon lam dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / smon lam chen po'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i smon lam dang / skye ba'i smon lam dang / spyod yul gyi smon lam dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / smon lam chen po'o //
translated: the aspiration to arouse the enlightenment mind; the aspiration for rebirth; the aspiration for the sphere of activity; the aspiration for accomplishment; and the great aspiration.

original: de la dang po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni /
translated: The first is the generation of the Thought of supreme complete enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa'i smon lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa'i smon lam zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the Bodhisattva's vow of generating the Thought.

original: phyi ma la sems can gyi don dang mthun pa'i 'gro ba rnams su skye bar smon pa ni /
analyzed: phyi ma la sems can gyi don dang mthun pa'i 'gro ba rnams su skye bar smon pa ni /
translated: The vow to be born in the future in the destinies that are suitable for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba'i smon lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba'i smon lam zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the Bodhisattva's vow of birth.

original: chos yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed par smon pa dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos bsgom pa'i yul la smon pa ni /
analyzed: chos yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed par smon pa dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos bsgom pa'i yul la smon pa ni /
translated: The vow to discriminate the Dharma well, and the vow to cultivate the object of the wholesome dharmas such as the immeasurables,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul gyi smon lam zhes bya'o//🔽phyi ma la mdo'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul gyi smon lam zhes bya'o// phyi ma la mdo'am /
translated: this is called the Bodhisattva's vow of the sphere of action.🔽The vow to explain in the future the Bodhisattva's wholesome dharmas in brief or in detail,

original: rgyas par byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba thams cad bsdus pa dang / yon tan thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir smon pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba thams cad bsdus pa dang / yon tan thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir smon pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam zhes bya'o //
translated: and to gather all the virtues, this is called the Bodhisattva's true vow.

original: byang chub sems da'i smon lam chen po ni yang dag pa'i smon lam de nyid las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems da'i smon lam chen po ni yang dag pa'i smon lam de nyid las rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's great vow should be understood from that very correct vow.

original: @145b de yang rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: @145b de yang rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: And that is tenfold:

original: phyi ma la de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad dpag tu med par bya ba ni smon lam chen po dang po yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma la de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad dpag tu med par bya ba ni smon lam chen po dang po yin no //
translated: The first great vow is to make immeasurable offerings and services to the Tathagatas in the future, in all forms.🔽The second great vow is to protect and preserve the holy Dharma of the Blessed Buddhas and to uphold the way of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung zhing bsrung bar bya ba dang / chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam chen po dang / dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung zhing bsrung bar bya ba dang / chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam chen po dang / dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa nas /
translated: The third great vow is to purify one's own buddha land in order to mature beings.

original: snga ma bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi smon lam chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad legs par spyad par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang ; sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar gyi smon lam chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad legs par spyad par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang ; sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang /
translated: the great aspiration to attain complete nirvāṇa as before, the great aspiration to practice all the aspects of bodhisattva conduct, the great aspiration to bring all sentient beings to full maturity,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / theg pa chen po la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / theg pa chen po la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang /
translated: the great aspiration to reveal all world systems, the great aspiration to purify all buddha realms, the great aspiration to enter the Great Vehicle,

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad 'bras bu yod par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i smon lam chen po'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba gcig par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / yang dag pa'i sbyor ba thams cad 'bras bu yod par bya ba'i smon lam chen po dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i smon lam chen po'o //
translated: the great vow to act with the same thought and practice; the great vow to make all right practices fruitful; and the great vow to fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s concentration on emptiness?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i brjod pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i brjod pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva sees that all expressions are free from the nature of being a self-entity,

original: brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po mthong nas /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po mthong nas /
translated: and that the nature of things is inexpressible.

original: sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: The mind that rests in this way is called “the concentration on emptiness.”

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration on wishlessness?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de nyid la log par rnam par brtags pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags par yang dag par mthong nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de nyid la log par rnam par brtags pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags par yang dag par mthong nas /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva sees that this inexpressible reality is beset by many faults, because it is seized by the afflictions and suffering that arise from false imagination.

original: phyis de la mi smon pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de'i smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis de la mi smon pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de'i smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Later, the bodhisattva's mental stability, preceded by the wish not to have that, is called the concentration of wishlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration of signlessness?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de nyid kyi rnam par @146a * //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po de nyid kyi rnam par @146a * //
translated: Here, the bodhisattva sees that this inexpressible reality is free from the signs of all signs, because it is free from the signs of all signs.

original: rtog pa dang / spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad bsal nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhi bar zhi bar yid la byed pas sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad bsal nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhi bar zhi bar yid la byed pas sems gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de'i mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Having eliminated all conceptual thoughts and signs of conceptual elaboration, the mental attention that is pacified, completely pacified, just as it is, in reality, is called the samādhi of signlessness.

original: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum po 'di dag gzhag gi /'di las gong na yang med la 'di las lhag pa yang med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum po 'di dag gzhag gi /'di las gong na yang med la 'di las lhag pa yang med ce na /
translated: Why are these three samādhis established? There is nothing higher than this, and nothing more than this.

original: yod pa dang med pa 'di gnyis yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa 'di gnyis yin te /
translated: There are two: existence and nonexistence.

original: de la 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas ni yod pa'o //
translated: Among them, the conditioned and the unconditioned exist.

original: bdag gam bdag gi ni med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gam bdag gi ni med pa'o //
translated: The self and what belongs to the self do not exist.
